headlines: BJP's Rahul Narwekar to be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker
text: First-time Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLA Rahul Narwekar will be the new Maharashtra Assembly Speaker. He won 164 votes, while 144 is the halfway mark. An advocate by profession, Narwekar, who had been associated with the Shiv Sena as well as the NCP in the past, joined the BJP in the run-up to the October 2019 Maharashtra Assembly elections.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Maharashtra CM Shinde, rebel Sena MLAs arrive in Mumbai from Goa
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, along with his faction of MLAs, on Saturday evening reached Mumbai from Goa, where the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs were camping after returning from Assam's Guwahati. This comes after Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray removed Shinde from the post of leader in the party for indulging in "anti-party activities".
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Akhilesh dissolves all SP executive units, except party's UP chief post
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav has dissolved all of the party's national, state and district executive bodies, except its Uttar Pradesh President post, with immediate effect. "National presidents, state presidents, district presidents of all...party's organisations, including youth and women's wings, have also been dissolved," SP tweeted. However, SP didn't give any reason for the move.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: TV anchor falsely claims Rahul Gandhi called Udaipur killers 'children'; FIR filed
text: An FIR has been filed against TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore and others for allegedly misrepresenting Rahul Gandhi's remarks on the vandalisation of his office in Kerala as his statement on Udaipur killing. Rahul called the SFI activists who vandalised his office "children", but his comments were aired as remarks on Udaipur murder accused.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: When tiger comes, foxes run away: BJP as T'gana CM skips welcoming PM
text: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport on Saturday, state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar said, "When the tiger comes, foxes run away." "Now, when the tiger has come, he (KCR) is running away. We do not know why is he doing this," Kumar further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Cong leader says 'Deve Gowda will soon be carried by 4'; apologises
text: Following criticism, Congress leader KN Rajanna has apologised for his remarks on former PM HD Deve Gowda in which he apparently suggested that the latter's end was near, saying, "I regret if my words have hurt him, his family or well-wishers...I apologise." Earlier, Rajanna said, "Deve Gowda is presently being carried by two people. Soon, four people will carry him."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Will miss Aarey protest, have to attend Assembly session: Aaditya
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said he would miss the protest for Aarey forest as he has to attend the State Assembly session. He urged the newly-formed CM Eknath Shinde-led government to reconsider its decision to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony. "Don't cast the hate for us on to our beloved Mumbai," he tweeted.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Shiv Sena legislative party office sealed ahead of Assembly session
text: Ahead of the special session in Maharashtra Assembly to elect the Speaker, the legislative party office of Shiv Sena in the Assembly was sealed. "We've locked up the office," said Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray. The rebel MLAs arrived at the Vidhan Sabha after leaving Hotel Trident in Mumbai. BJP MLAs, including Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis, also arrived.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Insulted institution of both CM, PM: Union Minister as T'gana CM skips welcoming PM
text: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao skipped PM Narendra Modi’s welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport on Saturday, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "Telangana CM has insulted the institution of both CM and PM". "CM KCR can hide but his corrupt politics will not remain hidden," Pradhan added. "Cooperative federalism in letter and spirit is cornerstone of our democracy," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Need development but not at cost of environment: Amit Thackeray on Aarey shed plan
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s son Amit Thackeray called Eknath Shinde-led government’s move to build the metro car shed in Mumbai's Aarey colony, "shocking". "We definitely need development but not at the cost of environment," Amit said. "If our environment is completely destroyed then there will be no one left for politics or to be ruled upon," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons spotted near PM's meet venue in Secunderabad
text: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's public meeting in Secunderabad's Parade Grounds on Sunday, 'Jai Jai KCR' balloons were spotted outside the venue. A video of the balloons has also surfaced online. This comes as political banners and posters, including a few inspired by the show 'Money Heist', among others, surfaced across various locations in Hyderabad recently.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Real face of democracy under BJP: Khalsa Aid Founder on his Twitter account ban
text: Khalsa Aid Founder Ravi Singh criticised the central government after his Twitter account was banned in India on Saturday. Sharing a picture of the account on Facebook, Singh wrote, "My Twitter account has been banned in India! This is the real face of democracy under the BJP!! Banning Sikh social media accounts won't stop us raising our voices!"
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Only our party can free Delhi from BJP's garbage mountains: AAP MLA
text: Aam Aadmi Party's MLA and MCD in-charge Durgesh Pathak urged Delhi Governor to conduct Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections immediately and said that only AAP party can bring freedom from the "BJP’s garbage mountains" in the national capital. "From whichever side one enters Delhi...you are welcomed by the BJP's heaps of trash that are scattered all over," Pathak said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP made clear democracy is for sale: KC Venugopal on Maha political development
text: Following the political development in Maharashtra, Congress leader KC Venugopal said that BJP has made it clear that the democracy is for sale. "Anybody can come, take money and they get to join the BJP. This is the fate of democracy in India but the people of India will fight it," Venugopal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 'Vikasvad defeating Parivarvad' under PM Modi's leadership: Nadda
text: Speaking at BJP national executive meet in Hyderabad, party chief JP Nadda lauded Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said, "Vikasvad is defeating Parivarvad" under PM Modi's leadership, an ANI report said. Dynasty politics is being rejected by people due to politics of development, he added. He lauded PM Modi for the electoral victories of the BJP including UP and Manipur.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar: JD(U)'s Upendra Kushwaha
text: JD(U)’s Upendra Kushwaha said, "Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is NDA and NDA is Nitish Kumar in Bihar". "He's been leading the coalition since it came into being...He will continue to do so as long as NDA exists in Bihar," Kushwaha added. His statement came days after Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said Kumar will complete his current term as Bihar CM.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Important to follow right footsteps: Aaditya in 1st Insta post after govt collapse
text: Former Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray posted for the first time on Instagram after the fall of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government and shared a picture of him walking behind father Uddhav Thackeray. His post read, "Always important to follow the right footsteps. Indebted to all for your love and blessings that keep coming our way, that is our true strength."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Union Minister Shekhawat useless, absent-minded in meetings: Raj CM
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot called Union Minister Gajendra Shekhawat "useless" and said that he remains "absent-minded" during PM Narendra Modi's meetings. He stated, "We'll ask the PM someday why he keeps such a nikamma (useless) minister who remains absent-minded in your meetings." Gehlot's remark was over an alleged denial by Shekhawat about PM Modi's "promise" regarding a canal project.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: Will distribute 21,000 acres land I freed from mafias to poor: MP CM
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that he has freed 21,000 acres of land from clutches of mafias in the state and  announced that he will distribute these lands among poor. "Some influential people encroach upon acres of land due to their muscle power and rowdyism. They should know that Shivraj Singh Chouhan will not spare them," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP-Sena govt has taken charge, based on beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray: Shinde
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday said that the BJP-Shiv Sena government has taken charge, based on the beliefs of Balasaheb Thackeray. "I myself was a minister, several other ministers too left the government. This was a huge thing for a common worker like me who was devoted to the ideology of Balasaheb Thackeray and Anand Dighe," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Even Kasab didn’t have so much security: Aaditya on protection for rebel Sena MLAs
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray reacted to security arrangements for rebel Shiv Sena MLAs and said that even terrorist Ajmal Kasab did not have such security. "We have not seen such security before in Mumbai. Why are you scared? Is someone going to run away?" Thackeray said. The rebel Shiv Sena MLAs reached Vidhan Bhavan in special buses today.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Some 'qualitative' changes in him: Pawar on Maha Guv offering sweets to Shinde
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar reacted to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari feeding sweets to CM Eknath Shinde during his swearing-in ceremony and said that he has seen some "qualitative changes" in the governor's treatment of public representatives. Koshyari also did not object to Shinde mentioning names of Balasaheb Thackeray, Anand Dighe while taking oath, which he did earlier, Pawar added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Totally false: Cong on report of Rahul seeking AIADMK's support for Prez election
text: Congress refuted a report which claimed that Rahul Gandhi called up AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswami to seek support for Opposition's presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha. "This is wholly bogus and totally false. No such phone call was made. The DMK-Congress alliance is firm and steadfast enough to withstand such crude and mischievous efforts to sow confusion and weaken it," Congress said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: AAP members to send ₹420 cheques to PM in protest against 'Agnipath': Sanjay Singh
text: AAP members will send cheques and demand drafts (DDs) for ₹420 to PM Narendra Modi in a symbolic protest against the 'Agnipath' scheme, AAP's Sanjay Singh said. He added, PM would be told not to do "char sau bisi (cheating)" with the Indian Army and the party would appeal to government “to not cry for money to protect the country.”
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP will win in Telangana Assembly polls next year: Keshav Maurya
text: On his visit to Hyderabad, Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Keshav Prasad Maurya said that BJP will win the next year's Telangana Assembly elections. "Today I took [the] blessing of Mata Bhagyalaxmi here (Hyderabad) at Charminar. I request Telangana people to visit devotional places in Uttar Pradesh. We will come to power," Maurya said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Is Bihar Police so incompetent?: Tejashwi after BJP tightens office security
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticised BJP for increasing security in its party offices in Bihar amid protests against Agnipath scheme and said that they don't have faith in their own "double engine government". "The Bihar government should tell us whether the police is so incompetent so as to warrant deployment of central forces at BJP offices?" asked Yadav.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Former Kerala MLA PC George arrested in sexual harassment case
text: Senior Kerala politician and former MLA PC George was on Saturday arrested on charges of sexually harassing a woman, who is also an accused in the solar panel case. George reportedly claimed that he was arrested as part of a conspiracy by CM Pinarayi Vijayan. The woman has alleged that George had invited her to the guest house in Thycaud.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Kolkata Police issues lookout circular against Nupur Sharma
text: Kolkata Police on Saturday issued a lookout circular against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad. According to police, the circular was issued as Sharma reportedly failed to turn up after she was sent two notices for appearance for interrogation. Last month, widespread violence broke out in several districts over Sharma's remarks.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Telangana CM skips PM Modi's welcome at airport for the 3rd time, triggers row
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at the airport as the latter arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday. Notably, this is the third time that Rao has skipped PM Modi's welcome ceremony this year. It triggered a political row in the state with BJP criticising the CM's actions.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Free power, water, healthcare in MP if AAP wins civic polls: Kejriwal
text: AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday announced that his party would provide free water, electricity and healthcare if voted to power in Madhya Pradesh local body polls. "Congress and BJP have cheated you. Give us a chance...If we don't work, kick us out," he added. "I assure you Singrauli will be developed like Delhi," Kejriwal further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: He's scared to face PM Modi: BJP as KCR skips PM's welcome at airport
text: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't attend PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at Hyderabad airport, BJP MLC N Ramchander Rao said that KCR is scared to face the PM. Meanwhile, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "[KCR] has insulted the institution of both...a CM and PM." Notably, PM Modi arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting on Saturday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP denies link to Udaipur killing accused as pics of him with local leaders emerge
text: After several pictures showing Udaipur killing accused Riyaz Akhtari with members of the Rajasthan BJP surfaced online, the party denied having any links with him. "Anyone can have a photo with any leader. It doesn't mean that he's a member," said Rajasthan's BJP Minority Morcha chief Mohammad Sadiq Khan. An India Today report said Akhtari had attended BJP events.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Brother of former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains arrested in rape case
text: Ludhiana Police in Punjab has arrested Karamjit Singh Bains, brother of former Lok Insaaf Party (LIP) MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains, in an alleged rape case of a 44-year-old woman. Simarjeet, along with his two brothers and four others, have already been declared proclaimed offenders in the case. As per reports, Simarjeet continues to be at large.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: By not welcoming PM, KCR jeopardised Constitution's integrity: Irani
text: Union Minister and BJP leader Smriti Irani on Saturday said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao "jeopardised the integrity of the Constitution" by not attending PM Narendra Modi's welcome ceremony at the Hyderabad airport. She said, "[KCR] has just not insulted an individual but also an institution." Notably, PM Modi arrived in Hyderabad for the BJP national executive meeting today.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: I was also offered to join rebel MLAs in Guwahati: Sena's Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that he was also offered to join the rebel MLAs in Guwahati. "I also got an offer for Guwahati but I follow Balasaheb Thackeray...so I didn't go there," he added. "When the truth is on your side, why fear?" Raut stated. Eknath Shinde, who was leading the rebel MLAs, became the new Maharashtra CM.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: PM Modi thinks he is Brahma and is permanent: Telangana CM KCR
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday said, "[PM Narendra] Modi thinks he is Brahma and is permanent." "There will be political transformation. No one is permanent...People choose their leader, who gets to serve the nation," he added. Rao, daring BJP to topple his government in Telangana, said "I'll become free and then will topple your government in the Centre."
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Do something honourable about your honour: Anupam on SC's statement on Nupur
text: Actor Anupam Kher reacted to the Supreme Court's statement on former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet Muhammad, tweeting, "Your Honour! Do something honourable about your HONOUR!" The Supreme Court had stated, "She has a threat or she has become a security threat?...This lady is single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country. We saw the debate."
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Scared to go on pothole-filled, chaotic Mumbai roads: Hema Malini
text: Actress-turned-politician Hema Malini spoke about the roads of Mumbai, saying that she is scared to go on them due to the traffic and chaos. "I just can't imagine how a pregnant woman must be travelling on these roads that are full of potholes," she added. Hema further said that places like Delhi and Mathura have traffic but it is streamlined.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: PM Modi has not actually understood MGNREGA: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was "shocked" when PM Narendra Modi spoke against the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) in Lok Sabha. "PM called [MGNREGA] a living monument of the failures of the UPA," Gandhi said. "It made me realise that the PM actually had not understood the depth of MGNREGA," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: UP CM’s visit to Bhagya Laxmi Temple in Hyd postponed to Sunday: Report
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath's visit to the Bhagya Lakshmi Temple at Hyderabad's Charminar has been postponed till Sunday by the Telangana BJP over "important engagements". According to sources cited by The Siasat Daily, the IB has advised the UP CM against visiting the temple over the Nupur Sharma controversy. Yogi Adityanath was supposed to visit the temple on Saturday afternoon.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: PM Modi govt spends 6 times more on railways in Gujarat than UPA: Shah
text: Addressing a gathering in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that PM Narendra Modi-led Central government spends six times more money annually on railways in Gujarat than the previous UPA government. "UPA used to spend ₹590 crore every year on the railways in Gujarat. PM Modi increased this spending to ₹3,960 crore between 2014 and 2022," Shah added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP's national executive meeting commences in Hyd; PM Modi present
text: The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) two-day national executive meeting commenced in Hyderabad on Saturday. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP chief JP Nadda and other party leaders are present in the meeting. Earlier today, PM Modi took to Twitter and informed that a wide range of issues aimed at further strengthening the party will be discussed in the meeting.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Murmu's victory is certain in Presidential polls: Himachal CM
text: Addressing a function in Himachal Pradesh's Baddi on Friday, state CM Jairam Thakur said NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's victory is certain. "Her efforts for the development of tribal areas, education of girls and balanced development of all sections of the society are highly commendable," Thakur said. She has set an example for society throughout her life, Thakur added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: PM Modi only believes in confrontation: Opposition's Prez candidate
text: Opposition's candidate for Presidential elections, Yashwant Sinha, on Saturday said PM Narendra Modi never believed in "consensus" but only "confrontation". He said the elections are being held under "extraordinary circumstances", adding that it is not a fight between two individuals but a battle of ideologies. Notably, BJP-led NDA has announced Draupadi Murmu's name as its Presidential candidate.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Will she dump Yashwant?: Malviya after Mamata's remarks on Murmu
text: After West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she could've considered NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu as a consensus candidate, BJP leader Amit Malviya said, "Will she dump [Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha]?" He also claimed that Mamata has realised that her anti-tribal and anti-woman position is "untenable". "Murmu is more likely to win...polls," Mamata had said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Naming colonies after PM, Chief Minister in Bihar unethical: RJD leader
text: RJD leader Shivanand Tiwary on Friday criticised the proposal to name residential colonies for the homeless in Bihar after Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. "To name a scheme that uses public funds after a living person...would be unethical," he said. "It should be named after any luminary from our state with an underprivileged background," Tiwary suggested.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: PM can't change my behaviour by making me sit in ED office: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who was questioned recently by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case, said that PM Modi cannot change his behaviour by making him sit in the ED office for five days. "This is a confusion in...mind of the Prime Minister," he added. "My behaviour...can never be shaped by my opponents or...enemies," Rahul further said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Inspired by vengeful spirit: Priyanka on ED action on Sanjay Raut
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised the Centre over action against Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut, saying it was "inspired by the spirit of revenge and malice". "BJP is adopting every trick to suppress the voices standing in opposition to its anti-democratic politics," Priyanka tweeted. This comes after Raut appeared before ED in connection with a money laundering case.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP and RSS are capturing our Constitution: Rahul Gandhi in Kerala
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that India's Constitution is "being captured" by the BJP and the RSS. Gandhi stated, "Voice of people is being crushed. But we aren't scared, we won't let them destroy the fabric of the country." He added, "They are attacking the country's economic backbone." Rahul made the statements while addressing a gathering in Kerala.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: Want to uplift people through infra development: Droupadi Murmu
text: While addressing a function in Himachal Pradesh's Baddi on Friday, NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu said she wants to uplift people through infrastructure development at the grassroots level. She also praised Himachal for "showing the way to the country in various parameters of development". Supporting Murmu, CM Jai Ram Thakur said that her victory in the Presidential poll is certain.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: I see my 5-day ED interrogation as a medal: Rahul Gandhi
text: Speaking in Wayanad, Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he views the five-day Enforcement Directorate interrogation he recently faced as a "medal". He also said, "I wondered why they interrogated me for 5 days, not for 10 days." Rahul Gandhi was interrogated by the ED several times in June over a money laundering case related to the National Herald newspaper.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: Don't forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani: KTR to BJP ahead of Hyd meet
text: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday took to Twitter to mock BJP ahead of its national executive meet in Hyderabad, saying, "To all the Jhumla Jeevis; Don’t forget to enjoy our Dum Biryani and Irani Chai." He also called the BJP a "WhatsApp University". "Please visit, take notes and try to implement in your states," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Modi govt is successfully killing democracy everyday: Telangana CM
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has accused the BJP-led Centre of "killing" democracy. "What the Modi administration is doing is successfully killing democracy everyday, throttling the federal system...toppling governments which do not toe their line," CM Rao said. "PM Modi is the 15th PM...and in terms of the last 14 PMs, never has India's image been affected," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Punjab households to get 300 units of free electricity from today: CM Mann
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said households across the state will get 300 units of free electricity each month from today. "This means that people will get zero amount bills. All electricity bills prior to December 31, 2021 will be waived off," Mann further said. AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while congratulating Punjab's citizens, said, "We've fulfilled our promise."
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Shiv Sena moves SC seeking suspension of Maharashtra CM, 15 rebel MLAs
text: Shiv Sena chief whip Sunil Prabhu has moved the Supreme Court seeking suspension of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and 15 rebel MLAs till the decision on their disqualification is taken. The plea seeks an order restraining them from entering the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly. The disqualification notices were earlier issued to 16 rebel MLAs by state Assembly's Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Uddhav removes Maha CM Shinde as Sena leader over 'anti-party activities'
text: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday removed the new Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde from the post of leader in the party. "You have been indulging in anti-party activities...have also voluntarily given up your membership of Sena," he wrote in a letter addressed to Shinde. "You cannot abandon Sena and claim to be a Sena CM," Thackeray had said earlier.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Masterstroke of Devendra Fadnavis: Shinde on becoming Maha CM
text: Eknath Shinde, after taking oath as Maharashtra CM, said, "People thought that BJP was desperate for power. But truly, this is a masterstroke by Devendra [Fadnavis] ji." "To hand over power to another person despite having a larger number [of MLAs] requires a big heart," he added. "People...got to see a new example of this large heartedness," Shinde said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Have 170 MLAs' support, number increasing: Maha CM Shinde ahead of floor test
text: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday said that the new state government, formed in alliance with the BJP, has the support of 170 MLAs. "The number is increasing. We have a comfortable majority in the Assembly," Shinde added. State Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked Shinde to prove a majority in the Assembly on July 4.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Maha Guv asks CM Eknath Shinde to prove majority in Assembly on July 4
text: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked CM Eknath Shinde to prove a majority in Assembly on July 4 (Monday). A special session of the Maharashtra Assembly is scheduled to be held on July 3 and 4. The nomination for Speaker's elections will be filed on July 2 and the Speaker's elections will be held on July 3.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Had Shah allowed Sena CM for 2.5 yrs in Maha, MVA wouldn't have been formed: Uddhav
text: After Shiv Sena rebel Eknath Shinde became CM of Maharashtra, former CM Uddhav Thackeray said, "I told Amit Shah earlier...that there should be a Shiv Sena CM for 2.5 years (during BJP-Sena alliance)." Thackeray said, "Had they done this earlier, there would've been no Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA or Sena-Congress-NCP alliance)." He added, "A BJP leader would've been CM today."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Assam CM Sarma sues Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia for defamation over corruption claims
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has filed a defamation case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia after the latter accused the former of "brazen corruption". Sisodia had alleged that the Assam government gave contracts to firms linked to Sarma's family to supply PPE kits at exorbitant prices. Sarma's wife Riniki has already filed a ₹100 crore defamation case against Sisodia.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Raj Thackeray hails Fadnavis for accepting Maha's Deputy CM's post
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Friday congratulated Devendra Fadnavis on becoming Maharashtra's Deputy CM. "Everyone thought...you'll become CM, but sometimes one has to accept party's instructions," he wrote in a letter to Fadnavis. "Party's order is greater than anyone's ambition, you have shown it from your actions. This should be remembered by every political party worker and leader," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: We won't disturb new Maha govt, they must work for public: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has claimed that the BJP said from the first day that they'll "disturb" Uddhav Thackeray's government, however, his party "won't disturb" the new Maharashtra government. This comes after rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis were sworn in as state CM and Deputy CM respectively. "They must work for...public," Raut said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP should hang its head in shame: Cong MP on SC's remarks on Nupur
text: Supreme Court's remarks on suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's comments on Prophet should make BJP "hang its head in shame", a statement issued by Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said. "It's no secret that...BJP seeks to profit from inflaming communal passions," he added. The apex court had said that Sharma is "single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Eknath Shinde changes Twitter profile pic to one with Bal Thackeray after becoming CM
text: After taking oath as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Eknath Shinde changed the profile picture of his Twitter handle to one with Bal Thackeray. Shinde had earlier said that Uddhav Thackeray had diluted the Hindutva ideology of Bal Thackeray by forming a coalition with Sharad Pawar's Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the Congress, which he called an "unnatural alliance".
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Don't toy with Mumbai's environment: Uddhav on Shinde govt's Aarey shed plan
text: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said he is saddened by the Eknath Shinde-led government's move to relocate Metro 3 car shed to Mumbai's Aarey Milk colony. "Don't toy with the environment of Mumbai," the former CM added. "Don't project anger for me on Mumbaikars. Don't change the proposal for the metro shed," Thackeray further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Will support NDA's Prez candidate Murmu: Shiromani Akali Dal chief
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Friday said, "We have decided to support National Democratic Alliance's (NDA) Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu." "We will never go with Congress because of the atrocities they have committed on the Sikh community," he further said. "Akali Dal has always supported people from marginalised sections of society," Badal added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: It's like all mess went loose: Urmila on judgment over entering politics
text: Actress Urmila Matondkar spoke about the judgment she faced on entering politics, saying, "It was like all the mess went loose, everything went baloney." She added that being known as a sex symbol, she was expected to be dumb and clueless. Urmila further said the joke was on the journalists who flew down to Mumbai to film her political campaign.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: I think Fadnavis didn't accept Maha Deputy CM post happily: Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar claimed on Thursday that he doesn't think that former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis accepted the Deputy CM post "happily", adding, "His facial expression said it all." "[Fadnavis] must have followed...orders from the top," he also claimed. Furthermore, he alleged that rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde "himself had no idea" that he'd get the CM post.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Will ensure error-free caste census in Bihar: Ex-JD(U) MP Anwar
text: Former JD(U) Rajya Sabha MP Ali Anwar has said that social organisations will ensure an error-free caste census takes place in Bihar. "Now that the caste survey is taking place, the ruling dispensation would get to know the bitter truth at home about the poor economic and educational status of a large section of the society," Anwar said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Rahul visits vandalised Wayanad office, calls act 'unfortunate'
text: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Friday visited his office in Kerala's Wayanad, which was allegedly vandalised by CPI(M)'s student wing Students' Federation of India (SFI) last week. Gandhi said, "It's unfortunate what happened. Violence never resolves problems." "I don't have any anger or hostility towards them. They are kids and they don't understand the consequences of their act," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: There was fear of riots under Congress rule in Gujarat: Amit Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that people feared riots during Jagannath Rath Yatra under Congress rule in Gujarat. "During Congress rule in Gujarat, have you seen any Rath Yatra procession that has gone smoothly?" Shah asked. "Such incidents of violence occurred back then. Twice, the Lord's [Jagannath] chariot [for the Yatra] was taken away," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: I would've supported Droupadi Murmu had BJP informed earlier: WB CM
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that she could've considered Droupadi Murmu, the NDA's Presidential candidate, as the consensus candidate had the BJP consulted her over the nomination. "If...BJP had informed us...that they were backing a tribal lady as the Presidential candidate, then we would've supported her," she said. "Murmu is more likely to win the polls," she added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: We'll do good job as Opp'n, win back people's trust: Maha NCP chief
text: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil said that his party will do a good job as the Opposition and win back people's trust. The three parties of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) will nominate a common candidate for the Assembly Speaker's post, he added. Speaking about ED summons to Sanjay Raut, he said, "He's innocent and we have no doubt about it."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: You're not just Nupur's PM, how long you'll save her: Owaisi to PM
text: After the Supreme Court criticised suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma for her comments on Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned, "Will [PM Narendra Modi] issue a statement or not?" "You're not just Nupur's PM. You're the PM of the 133 crore-strong India which has nearly 20 crore Muslims. How long will you save her?" he further asked PM Modi.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Uddhav has lost the spirit to fight: Former Maharashtra CM Chavan
text: Congress leader and former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan said Uddhav Thackeray has lost his fighting spirit. "Uddhav Thackeray should have put forth his view within the state assembly. Thereafter, he could have resigned. People should have known his views," Chavan stated. He further claimed that Eknath Shinde had wished to become Chief Minister the way Manohar Joshi became in 1995.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Shinde, Fadnavis will bring Maha back on track of development: Scindia
text: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Friday welcomed the formation of a new government in Maharashtra under rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde. "I'm confident Shinde as CM and Devendra Fadnavis as Deputy CM will bring Maharashtra back on...road of development," Scindia added. He claimed that the previous MVA government was acting like a speed-breaker in Maharashtra's development.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Don't gather at ED office: Raut to Sena workers ahead of questioning
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has tweeted that he'll appear before Enforcement Directorate (ED) today at 12 noon and appealed to his party workers to "not gather" at the agency's office. Raut is being questioned by ED in a money laundering case linked to Patra Chawl redevelopment scam. "I respect [ED's summons]...it's my duty to co-operate with...investigation agencies," he said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Cong' Genuine Simple Tax turned into Gabbar Singh Tax by BJP: Rahul
text: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre on the fifth anniversary of the implementation of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) across India. "Congress' Genuine Simple Tax was turned into Gabbar Singh Tax by BJP...It's a nightmare to do business, especially for MSMEs. Congress will revive business and jobs with GST 2.0," Rahul said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Hyd will be renamed Bhagyanagar if BJP elected in T'gana: BJP leader
text: BJP leader and former Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad's name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana. "They [TRS government] don't think about the welfare of the people of Telangana. So people are in favour of BJP," Das claimed. PM Modi will address the national executive meeting to end the dynasty politics, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Eknath Shinde sworn-in as Maharashtra Chief Minister; Fadnavis becomes Deputy CM
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde has been sworn-in as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, a day after Uddhav Thackeray resigned from the post. BJP leader and former CM Devendra Fadnavis has become the Deputy Chief Minister of the state. This comes after Shinde and Fadnavis met Governor BS Koshyari and staked claim to form the government in the state.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Devendra Fadnavis should become Maharashtra Deputy CM: BJP
text: After Devendra Fadnavis announced that he would not be part of the Maharashtra government that will be led by Eknath Shinde, BJP chief JP Nadda said that the party has personally requested him to become Deputy CM of the state. "BJP's central leadership has decided that Devendra Fadnavis should become a part of the government," he stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Eknath Shinde, BJP's Devendra Fadnavis stake claim to form govt in Maharashtra
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis met Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari to stake claim to form government in the state. "In 2019 Maharashtra Assembly elections, people voted for BJP-Shiv Sena alliance, but that mandate was insulted and Maha Vikas Aghadi government was formed," Fadnavis said.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Eknath Shinde to be the next CM of Maharashtra
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Eknath Shinde will be the next Chief Minister of Maharashtra, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis announced. This comes after the duo met Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari to stake claim to form government in the state. Fadnavis also announced that he will stay out of the government.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Uddhav congratulates CM Shinde, says 'I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra'
text: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday congratulated Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on being sworn in as new CM and Deputy CM respectively. "I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra!" Thackeray said on Twitter. Thackeray resigned as the CM on Wednesday after the Supreme Court rejected Shiv Sena's plea to stay floor test.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Despite BJP having more MLAs, Fadnavis made Balasaheb's Sainik CM: Eknath Shinde
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Thursday thanked BJP's Devendra Fadnavis for naming him as the next CM of Maharashtra. "BJP has 120 MLAs but despite that Fadnavis didn't take the post of CM," Shinde said. He added, "I express my gratitude to him along with PM Modi, Amit Shah...that they showed generosity and made Balasaheb's Sainik the CM."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Who is Eknath Shinde, the new Chief Minister of Maharashtra?
text: Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde has been sworn-in as the new Maharashtra CM. Shinde, once an auto-rickshaw driver, was a Shakha Pramukh in Thane in 1980s, before becoming a corporator in Thane Municipal Corporation. The four-time MLA has served as Maharashtra minister twice. He served as Urban Development Minister in Uddhav Thackeray-led government, before staking claim to form government.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Eknath Shinde returns to Mumbai, meets BJP's Fadnavis at his home
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Eknath Shinde returned to Mumbai on Thursday and reached the residence of BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis. Shinde and Fadnavis are likely to meet Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari, as per reports. Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray resigned as Maharashtra CM on Wednesday after the Supreme Court refused to stay the floor test ordered by the Governor.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Special Maha Assembly sessions on July 2, 3; Speaker election to be held
text: The Maharashtra Cabinet has decided to call special sessions of the Assembly on July 2 and 3. On the first day of the session, the election for Speaker will be completed as the post is vacant since Nana Patole's resignation. The decision comes after Eknath Shinde took oath as the new Chief Minister of Maharashtra.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Video shows rebel Maha MLAs dancing at Goa hotel as Shinde named next CM
text: A video has surfaced showing rebel Maharashtra MLAs dancing at a hotel in Goa after Shiv Sena MLA Eknath Shinde was named the next Chief Minister. Shinde's supporters also celebrated outside the Vidhan Bhavan in Mumbai. While announcing Shinde's name as the CM, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said he will not be part of the government.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Delhi govt schools, mohalla clinics in poor condition: Guj BJP leaders
text: A delegation of BJP leaders from Gujarat, which was on a two-day inspection of the AAP government's "Delhi Model", found two mohalla clinics and a school in a "poor condition" on Wednesday. "The reality of what (CM) Arvind Kejriwal touts as his Delhi model of governance is totally different from what he falsely claims," said one of the members.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP has 'unethically' toppled another state with muscle power: Cong
text: The Congress on Thursday accused the BJP government of capturing power "unethically" by use of money and muscle power and criticised it for destabilising democratically elected governments. Under PM Narendra Modi and Amit Shah, BJP wants to gain power through remote control, said Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh. What happened in Maharashtra is shameful for Indian democracy, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Bad news for Uddhav: Omar after Eknath Shinde sworn-in as Maha CM
text: After Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah said it was bad news for Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray and his branch. "Uddhav was probably counting on a BJP CM giving him a political weapon to target Shinde with," Omar said. This makes rebuilding Shiv Sena more difficult, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Ready to talk to Thackeray if he breaks alliance with MVA: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar said that the intention of rebel party MLAs is not to hurt and disrespect Uddhav Thackeray, who resigned as CM of Maharashtra. "We are ready to talk to Uddhav Ji if he breaks the alliance with MVA but he is still with them," Kesarkar added. "We've not gone to SC against Thackeray," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Won't tolerate religious frenzy in Uttarakhand, says CM Dhami
text: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said his government won't tolerate "religious frenzy" in Uttarakhand, CMO stated. "Home Department, administration and police have been instructed to take strict action in this regard, including special action on social media if any activity affects religious sentiments," CMO added. His statement comes following the killing of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Udaipur.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP seeks ex-ally SAD's support for Droupadi Murmu in Prez polls
text: BJP National President JP Nadda reached out to Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal to secure the party's support for NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu ahead of Presidential polls. Notably, SAD left the NDA alliance over the contentious farm laws, which the Centre withdrew in 2021. Presidential elections are slated to be held on July 18.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Decline begins when good fortune is misunderstood as accomplishment: Raj Thackeray
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Thursday said when anyone misunderstands good fortune as one’s personal accomplishment, therein begins the journey towards one’s decline. His statement comes a day after Uddhav Thackeray resigned as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra. His resignation came after the Supreme Court rejected Shiv Sena's plea to stay the floor test ordered by state Governor BS Koshyari.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Hanuman Chalisa effect led to fall of Maha's MVA govt: MP Minister
text: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said the fall of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government in Maharashtra was because of the 'Hanuman Chalisa effect'. "It is happening for the first time that a government has fallen in the name of Hindutva," Mishra said. He said it's Hanuman Chalisa's effect that 40 MLAs of the government left within 40 days.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Teesta Setalvad's Padma Shri should be taken back: MP minister
text: MP minister Narottam Mishra has demanded that arrested activist Teesta Setalvad's Padma Shri should be taken back, claiming that she was "a member of award wapsi gang". Mishra alleged that the UPA government gave her the award to appease minorities. Setalvad was remanded in police custody till July 2 in a case of fabricating evidence linked to 2002 Gujarat riots.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Betrayed by our own, Congress & NCP stood in tough times: Aaditya
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday said that party members were betrayed by their own, while Congress and the NCP stood with them in tough times. "My father is not hungry for power, he walked out of Varsha the moment the banner of rebellion was raised. He is dignified, graceful, clean and loyal to his words," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Money meant for hospitals being used to buy legislators in Maha: AAP
text: Responding to the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, AAP leader Atishi alleged that money meant for establishing schools and hospitals is being used to buy legislators. "You see any state, how the BJP has formed government in Goa, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka and Manipur. Selling and purchasing of legislators has become a common phenomenon," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Shiv Sena formed alliance with the people Balasaheb opposed: Fadnavis
text: Maharashtra BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis while addressing a press conference with Shiv Sena MLA Eknath Shinde said that in 2019, Shiv Sena formed an alliance with the people Balasaheb opposed all his life. "BJP and Shiv Sena had an alliance and we got required numbers in Assembly elections," Fadnavis added. He announced that Shinde will be the Maharashtra CM.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Congress urges PM to make appeal for maintaining peace, harmony
text: Congress on Thursday expressed concern over the "current situation in the country" while referring to tailor Kanhaiya Lal's murder in Udaipur. "We urge PM to...make an appeal for maintaining peace and harmony in the country," Congress leader Alka Lamba said. She further claimed that 8,000 businessmen have sought to move out of the country because of the "atmosphere of fear".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Shiv Sena rebels will 'regret' their decision to part ways: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday said that rebel leaders will regret their decision to part ways, adding that they are free to ally with the BJP. He also tweeted an image of a man in a white kurta-pyjama (presumably Uddhav Thackeray), with blood oozing from a wound on his back. "This is exactly what happened," Raut tweeted.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Time has come to say bye bye Modi: KT Rama Rao over price rise
text: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Thursday said that it was time to say "bye bye" to PM Narendra Modi. "The gas cylinder price in India is the highest in the world. Modi brought rupee value to ₹79 (against US dollar) in 75 years of Indian independence...Now the time has come to say 'bye bye Modi'," KTR said.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Yashwant Sinha reaches Chennai to seek DMK's support for Prez polls
text: Ex-Finance Minister and Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Thursday arrived in Chennai to meet CM MK Stalin and other elected representatives of DMK-led alliance to seek support for his candidature. Sinha, who filed his nomination papers on June 27, was received by DMK MP Kanimozhi Karunanidhi and other ministers at airport. Presidential elections will be held on July 18.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Good govt being formed: Kesarkar after Shinde becomes Maha CM
text: After Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as Maharashtra's Chief Minister, Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar said that a good government was being formed. "Two parties that believe in Hindutva and had parted ways, have come back together," Kesarkar said. "Their tallest leaders...had no reservation about having a Deputy CM from their side," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray resigns as Maharashtra Chief Minister ahead of floor test
text: Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday announced that he is resigning as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra amid political crisis in the state. This comes after the Supreme Court rejected Shiv Sena's plea to stay the floor test ordered by state Governor BS Koshiyari, asking the Uddhav Thackeray-led government to prove the majority in the Assembly on Thursday.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: SC allows jailed NCP MLAs Deshmukh, Nawab Malik to take part in floor test tomorrow
text: The Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed jailed NCP legislators Nawab Malik and Anil Deshmukh to participate in the proceedings of the floor test in the Maharashtra Assembly on Thursday. Both leaders had moved a plea in the Supreme Court to allow them to participate in the floor test called by Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari against the Uddhav Thackeray-led government.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SC refuses to stay Maharashtra floor test; Uddhav to prove majority tomorrow
text: The Supreme Court has rejected Shiv Sena's plea against a floor test to prove the majority in the Maharashtra Assembly on Thursday. The court said, "Our understanding is that floor of the House is the only way to settle these issues of democracy." Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari had asked Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray to face the floor test.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray announces resignation from MLC post too after quitting as CM
text: After resigning as the CM of Maharashtra on Wednesday, Uddhav Thackeray announced his resignation from the Legislative Council too. "I am not going away forever, I will be here and I will once again sit in the Shiv Sena Bhawan," he said. Thackeray thanked the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and Congress for supporting him.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Fadnavis fed sweets after Maharashtra CM resigns ahead of floor test
text: BJP leader Chandrakant Patil on Wednesday fed sweets to ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis at a party legislative meeting in a Mumbai hotel after CM Uddhav Thackeray announced his resignation. Pictures from the meeting have surfaced online. Thackeray, who also resigned from his MLC post, stepped down ahead of MVA government's floor test, which will be held on Thursday.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Sitharaman mistakenly says GST on 'horse-trading' instead of horse racing; video viral
text: While addressing the media after the GST Council meeting on Wednesday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman mistakenly said "horse-trading" while talking about imposition of GST on "horse racing". A video of the incident has gone viral online. Reacting to the video, Congress leader Pawan Khera said, "Yes Nirmala ji, there should be GST on horse trading."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Rebel Sena MLAs reach Goa from Guwahati; CM Pramod Sawant meets them
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLAs arrived on a special flight at Dabolim airport in Goa on Wednesday night from Guwahati and checked into a hotel near Panaji, following which Goa CM Pramod Sawant met them. "The rebel MLAs who were reaching Mumbai tomorrow, I urge them not to come...they should come on the oath-taking day," Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Power is born for Shiv Sena, we’ll come to power once again: Raut
text: After Uddhav Thackeray announced his resignation as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that the party is not born for power rather power is born for Shiv Sena. "This has always been Balasaheb Thackeray's mantra. We will work and come to power on our own once again," Raut added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No discussion with BJP over ministerial posts, don’t believe in rumours: Shinde
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Thursday said there has been no discussion with BJP about the ministerial posts. "There has been no discussion with BJP about...how many ministerial posts will be there, it will happen soon," Shinde said. "Until then, please don't believe the ministerial lists and rumours about it," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Now defection is democracy: Surjewala after Thackeray resigns as Maha CM
text: Soon after Uddhav Thackeray announced that he is resigning as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said that now defection has become a democracy. "Time to pause and think for every fellow Indian - Is this the India of our dreams? If not, let’s reclaim our country!" Surjewala tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No floor test in Maha, Assembly session postponed as CM quits
text: There will be no floor test in the Maharashtra Assembly on Thursday as the scheduled special session has been postponed after Uddhav Thackeray resigned from the CM post. "Maharashtra Vidhan Bhavan issued the circular, now there is no need for a special session. The special session is postponed," said Rajendra Bhagwat, Principal Secretary, Maharashtra Legislative Assembly.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Centre not releasing funds for Banglar Bari scheme: CM Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP-led Central government of not releasing funds for the Banglar Bari scheme. "If other states...change the name of the scheme to their local language...it's not a problem but if the Bengal government calls it Banglar Bari then the central government doesn’t give money due to the state,” she said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: BJP means price rise, price rise means BJP: Ex-K’taka CM Kumaraswamy
text: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy attacked BJP, saying, "BJP means price rise, price rise means BJP". BJP is a Kamadhenu for the business class and bloodthirsty for the poor, he added. "The government, which shocked the people by raising the electricity tariff on April 1, is now set to pull the power back on July 1," he further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Opposition boycotts Bihar Assembly over Agnipath scheme
text: The Bihar Opposition boycotted Assembly proceedings demanding discussion over the Agnipath scheme. Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav made the announcement yesterday, as he refused to agree with the Chair that the issue was not under state's ambit. Due to rains, the leaders were unable to demonstrate outside the Assembly building and shouted slogans for a few minutes before dispersing.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Some crossing all limits of barbarity: Himachal CM on Udaipur killing
text: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur condemned the killing of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Rajasthan's Udaipur. "It shows the way some people are crossing all limits of barbarity," Thakur said, urging the Rajasthan government to take immediate and stringent action against the murderers. Kanhaiya Lal was killed over a social media post supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: I urge Shiv Sainiks to remain calm & follow orders of police: Uddhav
text: Ahead of announcing his decision to step down as the CM of Maharashtra on Wednesday, Uddhav Thackeray said, "I urge Shiv Sainiks to remain calm and follow orders of the police." A new form of democracy will be born tomorrow, he added. Thackeray also announced his resignation from the Maharashtra Legislative Council.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Narendra Modi became PM twice due to Congress' performance: Owaisi
text: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said Congress is losing its relevance, adding that the party fading away will pave way for a new political era in the country. "Narendra Modi became the Prime Minister twice due to Congress' [performance]," he told reporters. Owaisi added that AIMIM will contest the Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections, slated to be held in 2023.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Not going away forever, I’ll once again sit in Shiv Sena Bhavan: Thackeray
text: Uddhav Thackeray, who announced his resignation as CM of Maharashtra on Wednesday, said that he is not going away forever. "I had come (to power) in an unexpected manner and I am going out in a similar fashion. I am not going away forever, I will be here and I will once again sit in Shiv Sena Bhavan," Thackeray added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Great example of cheap politics: AIMIM leader on renaming of Aurangabad
text: After Maharashtra Cabinet on Wednesday approved the renaming of Aurangabad to Sambhaji Nagar, AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel said only people can decide which name of Aurangabad will stay. "I want to tell Uddhav Ji and Shiv Sena that history can't be changed, names can be changed…You're setting a great example of cheap politics," Jaleel added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Not like we are happy with Uddhav's resignation: Rebel Sena MLA
text: Bharat Gogawale, one of the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs, on Wednesday said that the faction wasn't very happy with CM Uddhav Thackeray's resignation. "It is not like we are very happy with the decision of Uddhav Thackeray stepping down as the CM," said Gogawale. He added they would discuss the issue and decide further steps in the Goa hotel.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Fadnavis, Shinde to decide next steps: Maha BJP chief after Thackeray resigns
text: After Uddhav Thackeray announced his resignation as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, state BJP chief Chandrakant Patil said the next steps will be decided by ex-Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde. Patil on Wednesday fed sweets to Fadnavis at a party legislative meeting in a Mumbai hotel after Thackeray announced his resignation.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Withdraw 'Jihad against BJP' remark: WB Governor To Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has asked CM Mamata Banerjee to withdraw her alleged comment declaring that the Trinamool Congress will observe July 21 as "a day of jihad against the BJP". "The statement...is most unfortunate and indicates constitutional anarchy," Dhankhar said. He wrote a letter to Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday evening after receiving a complaint from the state BJP.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: MVA’s collapse is bigger loss of face for Sharad Pawar: BJP's Amit Malviya
text: Following Uddhav Thackeray’s resignation as CM of Maharashtra, BJP’s Amit Malviya said MVA’s collapse is a bigger loss of face for NCP chief Sharad Pawar, who "fancied" himself as the architect of the alliance. "Thackeray has not just lost his CMship but also tarnished the legacy of Balasaheb by entering into an unprincipled alliance with NCP and Congress," Malviya tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sad you're doing this on last day: SP MLA to Sena on renaming cities
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA Abu Asim Azmi has expressed disappointment over the Maharashtra Cabinet's decision to rename cities of Aurangabad and Osmanabad, claiming that the move was aimed at "sidelining Muslims". "I'm sad that the ones we're supporting...are doing this on...last day," he said. Azmi's remarks come as the MVA government will face floor test on Thursday.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray won't stop nor will he be defeated: Maha Minister
text: Addressing the media after the cabinet meeting in Mumbai, Congress Minister Sunil Kedar said that Uddhav Thackeray will not stop nor will he be defeated. "Every MLA in the house would vote as per his conscience, considering the manner in which Thackeray has led the state's battle against COVID-19 despite having no administrative experience," the Maharashtra Minister said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: This is emergence of Talibani culture: Vijayvargiya on Udaipur murder
text: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya condemned the killing of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Rajasthan’s Udaipur. "It was done to spread terror. The video of the incident is very disturbing. This is the emergence of Talibani culture and Congress is giving protection to it," Vijayvargiya said. "Taliban forces also came in Jammu and Kashmir because of Congress," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: CBI being repeatedly used to intimidate Opposition: Mamata
text: CBI is being repeatedly used by the Centre to intimidate the Opposition, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said on Wednesday. The central agency is summoning doctors, scribes and even drivers of electric rickshaws in the name of investigation into the cattle smuggling case and is harassing them, she claimed. The CM had made the comments at an administrative review meeting.
author: Shailesh

headlines: 4 of 5 AIMIM MLAs in Bihar join RJD, make it largest party in Assembly
text: Four out of the five AIMIM MLAs in Bihar joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), headed by Lalu Prasad Yadav, on Wednesday. The MLAs are Shahnawaz, Mohammad Anzar Naimi, Muhammad Izhar Asfi and Syed Ruknuddin. Welcoming the legislators in the party, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said, "Now we are the largest party in the Bihar Legislative Assembly."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Supreme Court to hear Shiv Sena's plea against floor test at 5 pm
text: Supreme Court has agreed to hear Shiv Sena chief whip Sunil Prabhu's plea at 5 pm on Wednesday against the floor test. Prabhu challenged Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari's direction to CM Uddhav Thackeray to prove his majority support on the floor of the House on Thursday. Sena leader Sanjay Raut termed the floor test order as "unlawful".
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rebel Maharashtra MLAs leave Guwahati hotel, reach airport
text: The rebel Maharashtra MLAs led by Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Wednesday left the hotel where they were staying and reached the Guwahati hotel. Governor Bhagat Singh Koshiyari has asked CM Uddhav Thackeray to take a floor test on Thursday. The rebel MLAs visited the Kamakhya Temple in Guwahati earlier in the day.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Heavens won't fall if floor test isn't held tomorrow: Uddhav camp to SC
text: Senior lawyer Abhishek Manu Singhvi, representing the Shiv Sena camp led by CM Uddhav Thackeray, on Wednesday told Supreme Court that heavens won't fall if the floor test isn't held on Thursday. He argued that why can't the rebel Shiv Sena faction wait till July 11, the next Supreme Court hearing. Shiv Sena has moved the court against floor test.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Children in madrasas taught punishment for blasphemy is beheading: Kerala Guv
text: Following the killing of Kanhaiya Lal, a tailor in Rajasthan's Udaipur, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said, "Children are being taught in madrasas that punishment for blasphemy is beheading". "We worry when symptoms come but refuse to notice the deeper disease...It's being taught as the law of God...What's being taught there should be examined," Khan added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We have over two-third MLAs, can pass any floor test: Eknath Shinde
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said the rebel camp will pass any floor test number since it has the support of over two-third MLAs. "Tomorrow after the floor test, we will sit and decide our future course of action," Shinde added. Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked CM Uddhav Thackeray to take a floor test on Thursday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Cong's internal rivalries have affected law & order in Raj: Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur, on Wednesday, criticised the Rajasthan government over the killing of a tailor in Udaipur, asserting that Congress' internal rivalries have affected law and order in the state. He said that the state government remained a "mute spectator", adding that the CM has always "shirked responsibility". The tailor was beheaded by two men, who have been arrested.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Cruelty & heights of bigotry: RJD's Manoj Jha on Udaipur killing
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal MP Manoj Jha condemned the killing of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Rajasthan's Udaipur, calling it "cruelty and a height of bigotry". "There's an atmosphere of violence in the entire country," Jha said. "Such incidents are coming to the fore after 75 years of independence," he added. Lal was killed over social media post supporting Nupur Sharma.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: T'gana people fed up with CM KCR, looking for double-engine govt: BJP
text: Ahead of the Telangana Assembly elections, BJP on Wednesday said that the people are fed up with CM K Chandrashekar Rao and want a double-engine government in the state. "Hundreds of people have sacrificed their lives for the separate state and BJP played a major role in fulfilling their wish," said BJP OBC Morcha National President Dr K Laxman.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: We’ll win floor test tomorrow and form govt: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA
text: After Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari called for a floor test in the state Assembly, rebel Shiv Sena MLA Gulabrao Patil on Wednesday reacted to his call. "People are with us, we will win the floor test tomorrow and will form the government. There is no need to worry," Patil said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Raj govt maintaining law & order, don't demoralise them: Kharge
text: While referring to the murder of a tailor in Rajasthan's Udaipur, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that the state government is maintaining law and order, which is why it's not okay to demoralise them. We all condemn the Udaipur incident, he said. Rajasthan CM took swift action and culprits were nabbed within two to three hours, Kharge added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: He left 52 Sena MLAs, home, but not Sharad Pawar: Rebel MLA on Uddhav
text: Rebel Shiv Sena Minister Gulabrao Patil on Wednesday took a jibe at Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and said that he left 52 MLAs and his residence, but wasn't willing to leave Sharad Pawar. Patil said the rebel MLAs were not opportunists and did everything for the party and their leader, even when they weren't in a position to do so.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Contempt of court proceedings: Sena MP Priyanka on Guv's call for floor test
text: After Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari called for a floor test in the state Assembly, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said it is contempt of court proceedings. "This would be contempt of court proceedings if floor test [is] conducted despite the matter not getting a final hearing in Supreme Court," she tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Radicalisation spreading, Nupur should be arrested: Owaisi on Udaipur murder
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has condemned the killing of a tailor in Rajasthan’s Udaipur for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. "We hope Rajasthan government takes strict action. Had the police been more alert, this wouldn't have happened...Radicalisation is spreading...Nupur Sharma should be arrested," Owaisi said. "Mere suspension was not enough," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Raj govt provoking terror organisations: BJP leader on Udaipur murder
text: BJP leader Rajyavardhan Rathore held the Rajasthan government responsible for tailor Kanhaiya Lal's murder in Udaipur. "Such incidents are...continuously reported in Rajasthan. Terror organisations are thriving in...state and...state govt has directly or indirectly provoked them," Rathore said. He also accused Rajasthan government of being "pliable towards one community and strict with another".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: No religion approves of killing humans: Salman Khurshid on Udaipur murder
text: Congress leader Salman Khurshid condemned the killing of a tailor in Rajasthan’s Udaipur, calling it the "most heinous and regrettable" incident. "We cannot allow our nation to be torn apart in this inhuman manner. No religion approves of killing human beings. Let us reaffirm positivity of faith," Khurshid added. Meanwhile, Congress' Rahul Gandhi said hate needs to be defeated together.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Answer to radical Islam is not radical Hindutva: Karti Chidambaram
text: Following the killing of a tailor in Rajasthan's Udaipur, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said, "The answer to radical Islam is not radical Hindutva." "The answer to all radicals and fringe elements is application of the rule of law and process, without fear or favour," he added. Leaders from several political parties have condemned the Udaipur incident.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Varun Gandhi fond of giving personal opinions: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Narendra Singh Tomar said BJP's Varun Gandhi is fond of giving personal opinions on a daily basis. His remark came as Varun earlier said if those recruited in armed forces under 'Agnipath' scheme are not eligible for a pension, then why should public representatives get such benefit. Reacting to this, Tomar said, "This can be his personal opinion."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Atrocity that shook human conscience: Kerala CM on Udaipur murder
text: Condemning the killing of a tailor in Rajasthan’s Udaipur, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Wednesday said that it was an "atrocity that shook the human conscience". In a Facebook post, Kerala CM wrote that the incident was a reminder that "communalism would wipe away the last speck of virtue from human beings".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: NCP's Malik, Deshmukh seek SC nod to attend Maha floor test
text: Jailed NCP leaders Nawab Malik and Anil Deshmukh have moved the Supreme Court seeking permission to participate in the floor test in Maharashtra Assembly on Thursday. A bench of the top court agreed to hear their application in the evening today. Notably, Shiv Sena has moved the SC against Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari's call for floor test.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Criminals' morale high due to state govt's incitement: Ex-Raj CM on Udaipur murder
text: Responding to the murder of a tailor in Rajasthan’s Udaipur, former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Tuesday said that due to the policy of "incitement and appeasement" of the state government, the morale of criminals is high. "Due to this policy of the state government, a situation of communal frenzy and violence has arisen in the state," Raje added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre wants to give jobs to BJP workers: Mamata on Agnipath scheme
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has claimed that she received a letter from the Centre on the Agnipath recruitment scheme asking her to provide jobs to BJP workers. Banerjee on Wednesday also commented on the murder of a tailor in Udaipur, saying that violence and extremism are unacceptable. "I strongly condemn what happened in Udaipur," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM's 'Gabbar Singh Tax' turning into 'Grahasti Sarvnaash Tax': Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday criticised the government over the rise in taxes on pre-packed food items and hotel stay, alleging that the PM's "Gabbar Singh Tax" is turning into "Grahasti Sarvnaash Tax". "Declining income and employment, topped with a rising blow of inflation," he said. Rahul had previously dubbed GST "Gabbar Singh Tax".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Uddhav-led Sena in hopeless minority within party: Shinde's counsel to SC
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde's counsel on Wednesday told the Supreme Court that the Shiv Sena camp led by CM Uddhav Thackeray is in a "hopeless minority" within the party itself, forget the House. The court is hearing Shiv Sena's plea challenging the floor test. Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut termed the floor test order "unlawful".
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: We're not rebels, we're Shiv Sena & will work for Hindutva: Shinde
text: Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said that the MLAs in Guwahati are not rebels, but a part of Shiv Sena. "We are carrying forward the agenda and ideology of Balasaheb Thackeray's Shiv Sena. We will work for the Hindutva ideology and the development of the state," he said. Maharashtra CM will lose the floor test tomorrow, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Act of cowardice, non-Islamic: Jama Masjid's Shahi Imam on Udaipur murder
text: Condemning the killing of a tailor in Rajasthan’s Udaipur, Shahi Imam of Delhi’s Jama Masjid, Syed Ahmed Bukhari, on Wednesday said that the "brutal murder has shaken humanity". "It's not only an act of cowardice but also non-Islamic, illegal, and inhuman. On behalf of all Indian Muslims, I strongly condemn this," Bukhari added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rajasthan CM should resign: BJP MP after Udaipur killing
text: BJP Rajya Sabha MP from Rajasthan Ram Kumar Verma criticised the state government over the killing of Kanhaiya Lal in Udaipur and demanded CM Ashok Gehlot's resignation over deteriorating law and order in Rajasthan. "Because of this incident, not only Rajasthan...but entire India is feeling ashamed," Verma said. He welcomed the Centre's decision to hand over the case to NIA.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray faces floor test at 11 am tomorrow
text: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has written to the state Assembly Secretary to convene a special session of the state Assembly on June 30, with the only agenda of a trust vote against CM Uddhav Thackeray at 11 am. The proceedings of the floor test shall be concluded in any case by 5 pm on June 30, Koshyari added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Many of you in touch with us, let's find a way: Maha CM writes to rebel MLAs
text: Amid Maharashtra's political crisis, CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday appealed to rebel Shiv Sena MLAs to return to Mumbai and talk to him. "Many of you are in touch with us. You're still in Shiv Sena at heart," Thackeray's letter states. "As Sena's family head, I respect your sentiments...We'll sit together and find a way out of this," he added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Ask Maha CM to prove majority through immediate floor test: Fadnavis to Guv
text: A delegation of BJP, led by Maharashtra Leader of opposition Devendra Fadnavis, on Tuesday met Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari and requested him to direct CM Uddhav Thackeray to immediately prove his majority through floor test, amid political crisis. "We've...told him that 39 Shiv Sena MLAs are saying that they don't want to be with NCP and Congress government," Fadnavis added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Shiv Sena to move SC against Maha Governor's call for floor test
text: After Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari called for a floor test in the state Assembly, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said the party would move the Supreme Court against it. "This is an unlawful activity as the matter of disqualification of our 16 MLAs is pending in SC. The Governor was waiting for this moment only," he said.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut gets 2nd ED summon, asked to appear on July 1
text: Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday sent a second summon to Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case and asked him to appear before it on July 1. Raut was first asked to appear before ED on Tuesday. He had said that he won't be able to join the probe since he had a meeting.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Shinde visits Guwahati temple, says 'will be in Mumbai tomorrow for floor test'
text: Eknath Shinde visited Kamakhya temple in Guwahati on Wednesday. "I'm here to pray for the peace and happiness of Maharashtra. Will go to Mumbai tomorrow for the floor test and follow all the process," Shinde said. Meanwhile, Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked Maharashtra Legislature Secretary to hold floor test of Uddhav Thackeray-led government at 11 am on Thursday.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: News that CM Thackeray called Fadnavis is misleading: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena refuted the "news" that CM Uddhav Thackeray called BJP's Devendra Fadnavis, amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra. "Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray called Devendra Fadnavis to save the government, such news is going on but this news is only to mislead," Shiv Sena spokesperson, Harshal Pradhan, said. "Whatever, Uddhav Thackeray has to say, he speaks publicly," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 31% of Rajya Sabha MPs have declared criminal cases: Report
text: About 31% of the Rajya Sabha MPs have declared criminal cases against themselves, according to a report that analysed the records of 226 lawmakers. Of these, 16% have declared serious criminal cases, the data showed. Separately, about 87% of the 226 Rajya Sabha MPs are 'crorepatis' and the average net worth of the lawmakers is ₹79.54 crore, the report said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: BJP has no role in the turmoil in Maharashtra: Kailash Vijayvargiya
text: BJP General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya said his party has no role in the current turmoil in Maharashtra. "This (rebellion) is the internal strife of Shiv Sena. We're just standing at a distance and watching," Vijayvargiya said. Criticising Shiv Sena workers for attacking offices of rebel MLAs, he said efforts were being made to create a 'West Bengal-like situation' in Maharashtra.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Mohammed Zubair was a 'jihadi' who incited violence: BJP leader
