text: BJP leader CT Ravi on Monday alleged that Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was a "jihadi" who incited violence, and criticised the Opposition for its criticism of the government over the arrest. This incompetent dynast (Rahul Gandhi) did not protest the arrest of a Marathi actress for a simple Facebook post, but is shedding tears for a jihadi, he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Shinde carrying forward Balasaheb's Hindutva ideology honestly: Kande
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, rebel Shiv Sena MLA Suhas Kande, who's in Assam along with other party MLAs, including Eknath Shinde, on Tuesday said that Shinde is honestly carrying forward the Hindutva ideology of the party's Founder Balasaheb Thackeray. Kande further said, "We have come to Guwahati, along with Eknath Shinde, out of our own volition."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Don't talk through TV, come to Mumbai & talk: Sule to rebel MLAs
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, NCP leader Supriya Sule appealed to rebel Shiv Sena MLAs to "come to Mumbai and talk". She said, "Don't talk through social media and television...Dialogue should never stop. It only leads to confusion." This comes after Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray appealed to rebel Sena MLAs to return to Mumbai and talk to him.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP's Fadnavis reaches Delhi amid Maharashtra political crisis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis reached Delhi on Tuesday amid a political crisis in Maharashtra. The former CM of Maharashtra will reportedly meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP President JP Nadda in the national capital. Meanwhile, Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray will hold a cabinet meeting on Tuesday, the Chief Minister's Office said.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Elevation of 1 person doesn't elevate community: Sinha on Murmu
text: While addressing the Presidential candidature of Droupadi Murmu, Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said that the elevation of one person from a community will not ensure the lifting of the entire community. "You don't go to a fight thinking that you will always emerge victorious. You go into the fight because you believe in the fight itself," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Competition between govt and rupee over who's falling faster: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over the falling value of the rupee, claiming that there's a competition between the government and the rupee over who's falling faster. He said that one would have to focus on governance rather than giving speeches to arrest the deteriorating condition of the economy.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP spending crores of rupees to topple govt in Maharashtra: Mamata
text: Amid a political crisis in Maharashtra, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said BJP is spending crores of rupees to topple the government in Maharashtra. "Where are they getting so much money to topple an elected government of a state? Where is our country's democracy heading to?" she asked. "Has the BJP decided to bulldoze everything in this country?" she stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PIL seeks FIR against Uddhav, Aaditya Thackeray & Raut for sedition
text: A PIL seeking registration of an FIR against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, and Shiv Sena leaders Aaditya Thackeray and Sanjay Raut for sedition was filed in the Bombay HC on Tuesday. The petition, filed by Pune-based social worker Hemant Patil, told the HC that the rebel leaders are camping in Assam because of threats given by the aforementioned trio.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: No demands of making Sanskrit compulsory from class 1: Gujarat Minister
text: The Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani has rejected reports of making the Sanskrit language compulsory from class 1 in the state's schools. "I don't know about it. I have not received any such demand. There is nothing like that," Vaghani said. Recently, RSS had reportedly suggested making the language compulsory for class 1 students in Gujarat.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Those silent on Ketaki have no right to condemn Zubair's arrest: BJP
text: BJP's National General Secretary BL Santosh criticised those condemning the arrest of Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. "Those who were conveniently silent on month long arrest of Ketaki Chitale have neither moral nor legal rights to condemn Zubair's arrest," he tweeted. "Your selectiveness robs you of any small window you had. Sleep peacefully," he tweeted.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Nitish Kumar will complete his term as CM: Dharmendra Pradhan
text: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday said that Nitish Kumar will complete his current term as Bihar Chief Minister. "There is no discord," Pradhan said. "Nitish ji is NDA's leader in Bihar with the mandate to run the government till 2025. There should be no doubts about that," Dharmendra Pradhan added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: It poses risk to national security: Tejashwi on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday criticised the Centre's 'Agnipath' recruitment scheme and said that this scheme poses a risk to national security and the future of the youth. "We want a dialogue on the Agnipath scheme," Yadav said. "While we stress that violence is not the answer, there is dissatisfaction among the youth," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP in wait and watch mode: BJP leader amid Maha political crisis
text: Amid a political crisis in Maharashtra, BJP leader Sudhir Mungantiwar said that BJP is in "wait and watch" mode and will make a decision. "Right now we're in a wait and watch mode," he said. "BJP doesn't need to prove the majority as of now. We are waiting for MVA to declare that they don't have the numbers," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Fringe Sharma chilling at home: Mahua on Zubair’s 4-day police custody
text: As Delhi Police has been given four-day custody of Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair, TMC’s Mahua Moitra said it’s enough time for police to "cook up" whatever else they need to. "Meanwhile, Fringe Sharma chilling at home with family, waiting to be safely rehabilitated by BJP at an opportune time," Moitra tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP delegation from Guj has come to learn from 'Delhi model': AAP
text: A delegation of the Gujarat BJP arrived in Delhi on Tuesday to look into what it called the "fake" Delhi model of governance. However, AAP claimed that they had come to learn how people in Gujarat can also be provided with good schools and hospitals. A delegation of the AAP will visit Gujarat next week, said AAP MLA Sanjeev Jha.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Punjab govt to bring resolution against 'Agnipath' scheme
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday announced in the state assembly that his government will bring a resolution against the Agnipath scheme. This comes after Leader of Opposition Partap Singh Bajwa urged the government to bring a joint resolution against the military recruitment scheme. "Agnipath is a whimsical and irrational move," Mann said.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: 'Poisonous' ecosystem out to protest arrest of Setalvad, Zubair: BJP
text: BJP on Tuesday criticised the Opposition for protesting against the arrest of activist Teesta Setalvad and Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair, asserting that they were working as part of a "poisonous ecosystem". "Setalvad was a small branch for fanning communal hate. Its headquarters was in the Congress and its president Sonia Gandhi was the CEO," said BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: CM Mamata criticises BJP govt over arrests of Setalvad, Zubair
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday criticised the BJP-led central government over the arrest of social activist Teesta Setalvad and Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. "No action is taken against those who spread hatred and violence. But action is taken against people like Teesta Setalvad and others. Why was she arrested?" she asked while addressing a gathering in WB.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 50 Maharashtra MLAs are with us: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said 50 MLAs from Maharashtra are with his camp. "We'll let you know about our further course of action," Shinde told media persons in Assam's Guwahati. On Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's remark that some rebel MLAs were in touch with party leaders in Mumbai, Shinde said false information was being spread.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Rebel Sena MLAs enjoying in flood-hit Guwahati, taking pvt choppers: Aaditya
text: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray on Monday said that the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs have "sold themselves for lakhs and crores" of rupees. "They went to Guwahati, where there's a flood situation and many people are without shelter and food," he added. "[Their] bill for meals in one day is ₹9 lakh. They're taking private choppers and enjoying there," Aaditya said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Mukul Roy resigns as Chairman of Bengal's Public Accounts Committee
text: Senior TMC leader Mukul Roy on Monday submitted his resignation as Chairman of the Public Accounts Committee in West Bengal Assembly to Speaker Biman Banerjee. "I am unable to discharge my duties owing to ill-health," his letter states. "I sincerely wish that the good work of the West Bengal Legislative Assembly will continue under your able stewardship," Roy added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Opposition speaks out against Mohammed Zubair’s arrest, seeks release
text: Several opposition parties spoke out against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair's arrest by Delhi Police. Congress, TMC, SP, RJD, NC, AIMIM and the Left parties criticised the Centre and demanded Zubair's release. "Every person exposing BJP's hate, bigotry and lies is a threat to them," said Congress MP Rahul Gandhi. "The great leader invokes Emergency," said RJD MP Manoj Jha.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: CM Gehlot called me 'Nakara', 'Nikamma' earlier too: Sachin Pilot
text: Rajasthan Congress leader Sachin Pilot reacted to CM Ashok Gehlot's remark against him and said "CM...had [earlier also] said many things about me like 'Nakara', 'Nikamma'. "I don't take his statements otherwise as he is...senior and a father figure," Pilot said. Gehlot earlier said BJP's Gajendra Singh Shekhawat was "hand in glove" with Pilot to topple Rajasthan government in 2020.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: I request Uddhav Thackeray to form new alliance with BJP: Maha rebel MLA
text: Shiv Sena rebel MLA Deepak Kesarkar on Monday requested party chief and Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to consider and make a new alliance with BJP. "BJP-Shiv Sena alliance is in line with the verdict given by the people of Maharashtra," he said. In a four-page letter, he added, "This is not a rebellion but a fight for Shiv Sena's self-respect."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: It's an order for them to rest: Raut on SC's order to rebel Sena MLAs
text: After Supreme Court allowed rebel Shiv Sena MLAs to file a reply to the disqualification notices by July 11, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that it is an order for them to rest in Guwahati. "There is no work for them in Maharashtra," he added. Earlier, Maharashtra Assembly Deputy Speaker had asked them to file a reply by Monday.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: We're still in Shiv Sena, will return to Mumbai soon: Shinde in Guwahati
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde, who is camping at a hotel in Assam's Guwahati with other rebel MLAs, on Tuesday said, "We will return to Mumbai soon." "We are still in the Shiv Sena...There should not be any doubt about it," Shinde added, will speaking to mediapersons outside the hotel.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 11-member Campaign Committee formed for Oppn Prez candidate Sinha
text: Opposition parties on Monday formed an 11-member Campaign Committee for the nationwide campaign of their candidate Yashwant Sinha for the Presidential elections. Ten representatives of political parties, including Congress' Jairam Ramesh, CPI(M)'s Sitaram Yechury, NCP's Praful Patel and a member of Civil Society, will be part of the committee.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Rebel Maha MLAs likely to stay at Assam hotel for more days: Reports
text: Rebel Maharashtra MLAs are likely to stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel in Guwahati, Assam for more days, as per reports. The hotel was reportedly booked till July 5 and the booking can now be extended as per requirement. On Sunday, a report said that the hotel has closed all new bookings till June 30.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: MLAs sold themselves when CM was hospitalised: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, state minister Aaditya Thackeray said that rebel MLAs "sold themselves" when CM Uddhav Thackeray was hospitalised. "There are two groups of people in Guwahati, there's a group of 15-16 who are in touch with us...other group [has] no courage and morality," he added. "I would like to ask them...is there no humanity left?" Thackeray stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Tokenism: KTR on Murmu's nomination as Presidential candidate
text: TRS leader KT Rama Rao termed NDA’s move to field Droupadi Murmu, a tribal candidate, for the Presidential election as "tokenism". "We don’t believe in tokenism. It is not about Murmu’s candidature. She represents a party that is heavily reliant on unconstitutional practices. Therefore, we are vehemently opposing the BJP candidate," Rao added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 15-20 rebel MLAs in touch with Shiv Sena, want to come back: Aaditya Thackeray
text: Maharashtra minister and Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Monday said that 15 to 20 of the 'rebel' MLAs are in touch with Shiv Sena. "They called me and Shiv Sainiks and urged us to bring them back from Guwahati. Their situation is like prisoners, first in Surat and then in Guwahati," Aaditya said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Would've accepted to run for Prez even if I was 10th choice: Sinha
text: Ex-Finance Minister Yashwant Sinha, who filed his nomination papers on Monday for upcoming Presidential polls, thanked the Opposition parties for nominating him. "It's being said I am the 4th choice but I want to say even if I was...the 10th [choice], I would've accepted because it's a big battle," he said. The presidential elections will be held on July 18.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Special court extends Satyendar Jain's judicial custody for 2 more weeks
text: A special court has extended Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain's judicial custody by two more weeks. Special Judge Geetanjali Goel passed the order on a plea moved by the Enforcement Directorate seeking extension of Jain's custody. Notably, the minister, who is currently in a hospital, attended the hearing via video conferencing. Jain was arrested under PMLA on May 30.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Police avert clash between Sena workers, rebel Maha minister's supporters
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, police on Monday intervened and averted a clash between Shiv Sena workers and rebel state minister Rajendra Patil Yadravkar's supporters in Kolhapur. While Yadravkar's supporters gathered outside his office, police stopped Sena workers from approaching the area about 200 metre away, according to SP Shailesh Balkawade. "Heavy security has been deployed," he said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Centre uses CBI, ED against those who speak truth: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday accused Centre of using central agencies, including the CBI and Enforcement Directorate (ED), against those who speak the truth. "Today I saw...a Shiv Sena leader [being summoned by ED]...Can [India] run like this?" she said. ED has summoned Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut in money laundering case linked to re-development of a Mumbai chawl.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Centre must extend retirement age of Agniveers to 65 years: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday urged the Centre to extend the retirement age of soldiers recruited under the Agnipath scheme to 65 years. "My motto is to create more and more jobs, unlike the BJP. They are training people for four months and recruiting them for four years. What will these soldiers do after four years?" she asked.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: T'gana Congress chief says 'slap PM Modi' over Agnipath, draws criticism
text: Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee chief Revanth Reddy drew criticism as he said, "PM Modi would be slapped when he asks for votes the next time," while demanding an immediate rollback of the Agnipath scheme. "You [BJP] have donkeys over 300 in Lok Sabha and you will keep them to pass the bills with a closed eye," he said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Traitors never win, MVA govt in Maha won't fail: Aaditya
text: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Monday said that those who betray, never win, adding that the MVA government in Maharashtra won't fail. "We are confident of winning. We have all love with us," he said. Responding to the ED summons issued to Shiv Sena chief Sanjay Raut, Thackeray said that politics has now become a circus.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP toppled 8 state govts since Narendra Modi became PM: KTR
text: Telangana Rashtra Samithi leader and Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao said on Monday that the state will raise objections to 'Centre's dictatorship' amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra. "Since...Narendra Modi became...PM, [BJP]...has toppled at least eight governments," KTR added. BJP has "trampled upon democracy" in states including Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh and Goa, he added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: They think those spreading communal news are secular: Naqvi on Zubair’s arrest
text: Following Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair’s arrest, Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said, "When separatists, terrorists and rumour mongers are arrested, these people (Opposition) say democracy is muzzled." "They think those who spread rumours and communal news are secular," he added. Zubair was arrested for allegedly hurting religious sentiments and promoting enmity.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rahul recently praised my patience level: Pilot on Gehlot’s remark
text: Congress' Sachin Pilot said Rahul Gandhi had praised his patience level a few days back. His statement came in reaction to CM Ashok Gehlot’s remark saying, BJP’s Gajendra Singh Shekhawat was "hand in glove" with Pilot to topple Rajasthan government in 2020. Pilot also said he doesn't take Gehlot's statements otherwise as he is experienced, senior and a father figure.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress stages nationwide 'Satyagraha' against 'Agnipath' scheme
text: Congress on Monday held a nationwide 'Satyagraha' against the new military recruitment model 'Agnipath', the party said. "We're concerned that such gimmicks are being experimented with at a time of...rising threats to our borders," Congress leader Mohan Prakash said. Notably, Congress also submitted a memorandum to PM Narendra Modi seeking the scheme's withdrawal earlier today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: MP panchayat poll candidate places posters of rival on dog, booked
text: A case was registered on Monday against Mukesh Darbar, a panchayat poll candidate in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa, for placing posters of his rival on a dog and taking it out on a tour in the area, police said. A video footage of the incident was widely circulated on social media, as per the complaint filed by an election agent.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Many said Cong, NCP will betray us but our people did: Aaditya
text: Amid the Maharashtra political crisis, state minister Aaditya Thackeray on Monday said that many people told the Shiv Sena that Congress and NCP will betray them, but "our people betrayed us". However, he added that the "positive" thing was that "dirt has left the Shiv Sena". "When [CM Uddhav Thackeray] was hospitalised, [rebel MLAs] sold themselves," he further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Vajpayee wanted to fire CM Modi after Guj riots, Balasaheb saved him: Sena MP
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, Shiv Sena MP Arvind Sawant said that PM Narendra Modi betrayed the party's founder Bal Thackeray, who saved his future after 2002 Gujarat riots. "After the 2002 Gujarat riots, [then PM Atal Bihari] Vajpayee had made up his mind to sack Modi as Chief Minister, but Balasaheb convinced Vajpayee not to do that," said Sawant.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar tests COVID-19 positive amid political crisis
text: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar has tested positive for COVID-19 amid political crisis in the state. The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader said he is in good health and is consulting a doctor. "With the blessings of all of you, I will soon be able to defeat COVID-19 and return to your service," he said on Twitter.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SC issues notice to Maha Dy Speaker on rebel MLAs' pleas, next hearing on July 11
text: The Supreme Court on Monday issued notice to Maharashtra Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal on pleas filed by rebel MLAs challenging the disqualification notice issued to Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde and 15 other rebel MLAs. The court also issued notices to Shiv Sena leaders Ajay Chaudhary and Sunil Prabhu. The court will hear the matter again on July 11.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray government has lost majority in assembly: Eknath Shinde in SC
text: Eknath Shinde, in petition filed in the Supreme Court, said the Uddhav Thackeray-led Maha Vikas Aghadi government lost majority as Shiv Sena legislative party has withdrawn support. This comes after Shinde camp moved apex court challenging disqualification notices sent by Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal on June 21, saying move represented misuse of anti-defection law by Maha Vikas Aghadi coalition.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: SC allows rebel Sena MLAs to respond to disqualification notice by July 11
text: The Supreme Court has allowed rebel Shiv Sena MLAs to file a reply to the disqualification notices issued to them by Maharashtra Assembly's Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal by July 11. Earlier, Zirwal had granted them time to file a reply by Monday. The SC has also issued notice to Zirwal on pleas filed by the MLAs, challenging the disqualification notice.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Maharashtra CM reallocates Cabinet portfolios of 9 rebel ministers
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday handed over Cabinet portfolios of nine rebel MLAs to other lawmakers. The portfolios of the rebel ministers were allotted to other ministers for ease of administration amid the political crisis, according to an official statement. The Urban Development and Public Works portfolio held by Eknath Shinde has been given to minister Subhash Desai.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: CM had called Shinde in May, asked him to become CM if he wanted to: Aaditya
text: Maharashtra Minister and Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said that CM Uddhav Thackeray had called rebel MLA Eknath Shinde on May 20 and asked him to become CM, if he wanted to become so. "At that time, he (Shinde) did drama and started weeping. Just a month after, he broke into rebellion," Thackeray added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 1 or 2 more Maharashtra MLAs will come & join us: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar on Sunday said one or two more MLAs were likely to join them in Guwahati. "With their support and other independents, our strength will be increased to 51," he said. Kesarkar added that the rebel MLAs will arrive at a decision in three to four days and thereafter, they'll directly go to Maharashtra.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Won't take Guwahati route even if you behead me: Raut on ED summons
text: Soon after Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut received summons from Enforcement Directorate (ED) in a money laundering case linked to Patra Chawl land scam, he said it was a conspiracy to stop him. "Even if you behead me, I won't take the Guwahati route," he said, in an apparent reference to the party's rebel MLAs who are staying in Guwahati.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Balasaheb's Sena supporting those linked to Mumbai blast, better to die: Shinde
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde took to Twitter to question how Balasaheb Thackeray's party can support people linked to the Mumbai bomb blast, fugitive gangster Dawood Ibrahim and who're "responsible for taking lives of innocent people of Mumbai". "That's why we took such...step, it's better to die," he tweeted. He also tagged party leader Sanjay Raut in the tweet.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: No dharma sankat: Yashwant on not getting son & BJP MP Jayant's support
text: Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Sunday said that he isn't under any "dharma sankat" over not receiving the support of his son and BJP MP Jayant Sinha. "[Jayant] follows his 'Raj Dharma' and I will follow my 'Rashtra Dharma'," he added. Earlier, Jayant reacted to his father's candidature by urging people to not look at him as a son.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Won't be able to appear before ED, have meeting in Alibaug: Raut
text: After receiving summons from Enforcement Directorate, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said he'll not be able to appear before the probe agency on Tuesday as he has to attend a meeting in Alibaug. The summons were issued on Monday in connection with a money laundering case linked to redevelopment of Mumbai's Patra Chawl. This comes amid political crisis in Maharashtra.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Teesta Setalvad, Congress have cheated the justice system: BJP
text: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Saturday said activist Teesta Setalvad, who was arrested today by Gujarat Police's Crime Branch, along with Congress leader Sonia Gandhi and her party "have cheated the justice system of India". "Some people like Teesta Setalvad...have deliberately created a false story. This has been strongly remarked by the Supreme Court," Patra added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP claims to worship cows; but it's us who are serving cow: Bhupesh Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel has criticised BJP and said that the Congress-led state government is "truly serving the cow". "BJP, Bajrang Dal, all claim to worship cows. But what have they done to serve 'Gau Mata'?" CM Baghel said. "It's the Chhattisgarh government that is truly serving the cow. While they find cow dung disgusting, we...consider it pious," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Pic shows Maha minister Uday Samant with Eknath Shinde in Assam
text: Maharashtra Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant met Shiv Sena rebel MLA Eknath Shinde in Assam's Guwahati on Sunday. A picture showed Samant with Shinde and other rebel MLAs. Samant, a key Shiv Sena leader from the Konkan region, is the ninth state minister to join the rebel camp.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Raut should threaten others, not us: Shinde's son on corpse remark
text: Responding to Shiv Sena chief Sanjay Raut's "corpse" remark, Shrikant Shinde, the son of rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Monday said that Raut should threaten others and not the rebel leaders. "It's not a rebellion, but what the people of Maharashtra want," he said. Shrikant further said that Raut's statement doesn't coincide with the culture of the state.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Maha CM didn't meet in 2.5 yrs with Sena MLAs who lost 2019 polls: Rebel MLA
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray didn't hold a meeting in 2.5 years with those Shiv Sena MLAs who lost Assembly polls in 2019, said rebel MLA Bharat Gogawale. "On the contrary, state's Deputy CM [Ajit Pawar] gave funds to NCP candidates who lost 2019 Assembly elections...In all these difficult situations, Eknath Shinde supported all of us Shiv Sena MLAs," Gogawale added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Why will I go to Guwahati to see those traitors?: Raut's brother on rebel MLAs
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's brother and two-time MLA, Sunil Raut, said that he won't go to Guwahati, where several rebel party MLAs are camping. "Why will I go to Guwahati? I would rather go to Goa to see its natural beauty. Will I go to Guwahati to see the faces of those traitors?" Sunil said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP's win in UP shows people are in support of Agnipath: Minister
text: BJP Minister Pramod Kumar on Monday asserted that the party's win in UP bypolls indicates that the people are in support of the proposed Agnipath defence recruitment scheme. He further alleged that the protests in Bihar against the scheme were part of a "conspiracy" and not a spontaneous outburst of aggrieved youths.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Don't make 'Agnipath' a prestige issue, scrap it: Cong's Pratibha Singh
text: Himachal Pradesh Congress President Pratibha Singh on Sunday urged the Centre to not make 'Agnipath' a prestige issue and roll back the defence recruitment scheme. "The scheme...is neither in the interest of the country, nor the army," Singh said. 'Agnipath' will lower the morale of the youth and the popularity of the armed forces as a career option, she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SP MLA booked after demolishing college wall in UP's Pratapgarh
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA RK Verma and several of his supporters were booked by police in UP's Pratapgarh for allegedly blocking government work and other charges under IPC. This comes days after Verma was seen pushing walls of an under-construction government engineering college in Raniganj to expose the quality of material used. A video of the incident had surfaced online.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Raut is trying to finish Shiv Sena on Pawar's orders: Rebel MLA
text: Amid the Maharashtra political crisis, rebel Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar has alleged that party leader Sanjay Raut is "trying to finish the party on the orders of NCP chief Sharad Pawar". He said that the rebel MLAs won't pull back until they take the state to "new heights". "NCP leaders...fire the gun using Raut's shoulder," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Prevent Muslims from being misled in 2024 elections: Mayawati
text: BSP president Mayawati on Monday asked party workers to prevent Muslims from being misled in the 2024 elections. "The UP bypoll results have once again proved that only BSP has the 'ground force' to defeat BJP here," she said. All party workers have to move forward with more strength, she added. The BSP contested only in the Azamgarh bypoll.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Those who leave party after staying for 40 yrs, their souls are dead: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said, "I will repeat it, 'Those who stay in a party for 40 years and then run away, their souls are dead, they do not have anything left in them'." "These are the lines said by Dr Ram Manohar Lohia. I didn't want to hurt anyone's sentiment, I just said the truth," he added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: If MLAs wanted to rebel, they should have done it in Maharashtra: Aaditya
text: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray has commented on the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs, who are currently camping in Guwahati. "Those [rebel MLAs] who ran away from here, are calling themselves rebels...if they wanted to rebel, they should've done it here [Maharashtra]," Aaditya said. "The second floor test would be when they sit before me...say what did we do wrong," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Politics has now become a circus: Aaditya on ED summons to Raut
text: Responding to the ED summons issued to Shiv Sena chief Sanjay Raut, party leader Aaditya Thackeray said that politics has now become a circus. Sanjay Raut has been summoned by the ED on Tuesday in a money laundering case linked to the Patra Chawl redevelopment scam. The summon comes amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Condemn attack by BJP goons post Cong's Agartala bypoll win: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi condemned the attack on its leaders by BJP goons following Congress's win in the Agartala bypoll. At least 19 people, including Tripura PCC chief Birajit Sinha, were injured in a clash between Congress and BJP supporters in Agartala after the results of the by-elections to the four Assembly seats in the state were declared.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 6 Shiv Sena workers arrested over attack on Eknath Shinde's son's office
text: Thane Police on Sunday arrested six Shiv Sena workers for allegedly pelting stones at the office of Lok Sabha MP Shrikant Shinde, rebel MLA Eknath Shinde's son. The Ulhasnagar office of the MP was attacked on Saturday by a mob of eight to 10 persons. Of the arrested workers, five are 'shakha pramukhs' while one is a Yuva Sena functionary.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Maha Governor asks police to provide security to rebel MLAs, their families
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Sunday wrote to state DGP Rajnish Seth and Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey, directing them to provide security cover to all the rebel MLAs and their families. According to Koshyari, 38 Shiv Sena MLAs, among others, have claimed that security cover of their families has been "illegally withdrawn".
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Amid political crisis, Centre provides 'Y+' security to 15 rebel Shiv Sena MLAs
text: Amid Maharashtra's ongoing political crisis, Centre has provided 'Y+' category security cover of armed CRPF personnel to 15 rebel Shiv Sena MLAs who joined Eknath Shinde's camp. This comes  after Shinde wrote to Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray, Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil and others, alleging security cover provided to the family members of the rebel MLAs had been withdrawn.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Maharashtra Minister Uday Samant joins Eknath Shinde camp in Guwahati: Reports
text: Maharashtra Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant has reportedly joined the Eknath Shinde faction at Guwahati in Assam. As per reports, the minister from Shiv Sena is said to be not reachable. Samant is the eighth state minister to join the Shinde camp. He has reportedly boarded a flight to Guwahati from Surat.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJP's Ghanshyam Lodhi wins Rampur LS bypoll by defeating SP's Asim Raza
text: BJP leader Ghanshyam Lodhi has won the Rampur Lok Sabha byelection after defeating SP candidate Asim Raza, BJP leaders have claimed. Lodhi, a former SP MLC, had joined the BJP ahead of the 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly election. The seat fell vacant after its sitting MP Azam Khan resigned and successfully contested the Uttar Pradesh Assembly election.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SAD (Amritsar) candidate Simranjit Singh wins Mann's Sangrur Lok Sabha seat
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (Amritsar) candidate Simranjit Singh Mann on Sunday said he has won the Sangrur Lok Sabha bypoll. "This is a great win...We've defeated all national parties," he added. Simranjit reportedly beat his AAP rival Gurmail Singh by a margin of over 7,000 votes. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had won the Sangrur seat in 2014 and 2019 parliamentary elections.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Rebel Shiv Sena MLAs move Supreme Court against disqualification notices
text: Amid Maharashtra's ongoing political crisis, the Eknath Shinde-led rebel camp has gone to the Supreme Court with an appeal against disqualification notices issued to 16 rebel MLAs by state Assembly's Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal. The camp has also challenged the appointment of Ajay Choudhari as the Shiv Sena Legislative Party Leader and the rejection of no-confidence motion against Zirwal.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Tripura CM Manik Saha wins Assembly bypoll; Cong wins Agartala
text: Newly-appointed Tripura CM Manik Saha won the by-election to the Town Bardowali Assembly seat by a margin of more than 6,000 votes over the rival Congress candidate. The BJP won the Jubarajnagar seat and stood well ahead in Surma at the end of eighth round of counting. Congress' Sudip Roy Barman defeated BJP's Ashok Sinha in Agartala.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Shekhawat conspired with Sachin Pilot to topple my govt: Raj CM Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday accused Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat of horse-trading in 2020 as part of a conspiracy to topple the former's government. "You (Shekhawat) also took the name of Sachin Pilot and it is clear that you have conspired with him," Gehlot added. Gehlot's allegations came after Shekhawat said that Sachin Pilot had "missed the opportunity".
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Counting of votes on for 3 LS, 7 Assembly seats; SP ahead in UP
text: Counting of votes is underway for bypolls to three Lok Sabha seats and seven Assembly seats. According to early trends, Samajwadi Party is leading in both parliamentary seats in Uttar Pradesh - Azamgarh and Rampur. In Punjab's Sangrur, the parliamentary seat vacated by CM Bhagwant Mann, AAP is trailing behind Shiromani Akali Dal (Amritsar).
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Another 'rubber stamp' at Rashtrapati Bhavan would be catastrophic: Sinha
text: Opposition's candidate for Presidential elections, Yashwant Sinha, on Sunday said, "It would be a catastrophe if we had another 'rubber stamp' at Rashtrapati Bhavan." "This election is more than merely the election of India's President. This election is a step towards resisting the authoritarian policies of the government," he added. "Our democracy, our Constitution are threatened," Sinha said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Result of double-engine govt: UP CM as BJP wins Azamgarh, Rampur LS seats
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath took to Twitter on Sunday and thanked the people of Azamgarh for the "historic victory" after BJP candidate Dinesh Lal Yadav 'Nirahua' won the Azamgarh Lok Sabha seat. CM Yogi attributed the victory to the "double-engine BJP government under PM Narendra Modi's leadership". BJP's Ghanshyam Lodhi has won the Rampur Lok Sabha seat.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: MVA govt will last 2-3 days: Minister amid Maha political crisis
text: Union Minister Raosaheb Danve on Sunday said that the Maha Vikas Aghadi government in Maharashtra will last for two to three days. "Time is running out. The BJP has nothing to do with this rebellion. Shiv Sena rebels have resentment towards Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray as development funds were diverted by NCP and Congress," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: How long will Sena MLAs hide in Guwahati, will have to come to Chowpatty: Raut
text: Amid the political crisis in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, took to Twitter to say, "How long will you hide in Guwahati, you have to come back to Chowpatty." Raut shared the tweet along with an image of Maharashtra Assembly Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal. Zirwal has reportedly served notices to 16 rebel MLAs on the Sena disqualification plea.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: ₹9 lakh spent on our MLAs per day, flood victims left on their own: Aaditya
text: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray said that ₹9 lakh is being spent on Shiv Sena MLAs per day. "Lakhs of flood-affected people are there in the very same Assam, they are left on their own," he said, adding, "It feels that those who left, left for good...country saw...the person who did...most powerful work during COVID-19 had to leave his official residence."
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: SP can't defeat BJP, is a useless party: Owaisi on UP bypoll results
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday reacted to the results of the UP legislative Assembly bypoll results, stating that the Samajwadi Party (SP) has neither the capability nor the ability to defeat the BJP. Owaisi further called SP "useless", adding that Muslims in the state shouldn't waste their votes on such parties. BJP won from both Rampur and Azamgarh constituencies.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Centre acting like 'nakalchi bandar', must retract Agnipath: Cong MP
text: Congress' Rajya Sabha MP Deepender Singh Hooda on Sunday criticised the Agnipath scheme and accused the Centre of acting like a "nakalchi bandar" for exporting ideas from foreign nations to draft policies in India. He further said that Israel's example is being given with an argument that there is compulsory military service, but situations in both countries are different.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Tripura Cong chief injured amid clash with BJP after bypoll results
text: At least 19 people, including Tripura Congress chief Birajit Sinha, were injured in a clash between Congress and BJP supporters in front of Congress Bhavan in Agartala on Sunday. Sinha was attacked with bricks on his head, a Congress leader claimed. Police used tear gas to disperse the mob which clashed after the announcement of state legislative Assembly bypoll results.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Those MLAs who are traitors, won't be taken back into Sena: Aaditya
text: In a warning to the Shiv Sena rebels currently camping in Guwahati, Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday said that those rebel MLAs who are traitors will not be taken back into the party again. He also said that the party doors are open for those who have left but want to return to the Shiv Sena.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: People defeated BJP's 'dirty' politics: Kejriwal on Delhi bypoll
text: After AAP won the Rajinder Nagar Assembly bypoll in Delhi, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday called it a defeat of BJP's "dirty politics" and thanked the people for appreciating the work done by AAP. Durgesh Pathak has defeated his immediate rival Rajesh Bhatia (of BJP) by a margin of over 11,000 votes, Delhi Chief Electoral Officer Ranbir Singh said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Countdown for TRS govt has begun; 529 days left: BJP leader Tarun Chugh
text: BJP leader Tarun Chugh has said that the countdown to the TRS-ruled state government's exit has begun. "The countdown has begun for your (TRS) government from today. It's time to say goodbye after 529 days," Chugh said during a press conference in Hyderabad. Chugh also alleged that the state government hasn't reduced fuel prices despite the Centre reducing them twice.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Security forces deployed outside office of rebel Shiv Sena MLA's son
text: Amid ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, security forces were deployed outside office of rebel Shiv Sena MLA Sada Sarvankar's son Samadhan. This comes after a video showing people vandalising the office of Shrikant Shinde, son of fellow party rebel leader Eknath Shinde, surfaced online. Shiv Sena workers held protests against rebel MLAs in cities including Nagpur and Pune today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: 40 MLAs in Guwahati are living corpses, their souls are dead: Raut
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena chief Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that the 40 MLAs in Guwahati are living corpses, adding that their souls are dead. "Their bodies will be sent directly to the Assembly for post-mortem when they come back. They know what can happen in the fire that has been lit here," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM busy planning another distraction while Indians struggle: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi on Sunday and said that he's busy planning distractions while Indians are struggling. He further said that the PM's "distraction science" can't hide disasters such as an all-time high unemployment rate, a 30-year high wholesale price index and devaluation of LIC by $17 billion.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: It's victory of our work: AAP's Durgesh Pathak on winning Delhi bypoll
text: After winning Delhi's Rajinder Nagar Assembly bypoll, Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) candidate Durgesh Pathak said it is a victory of the work done by the party. "This is CM [Arvind] Kejriwal's victory...BJP had no agenda here, had lost the election on day 1," Pathak said. "They will lose in every election, including upcoming Nagar Nigam elections here," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: If you have guts, resign & face polls: Aaditya Thackeray to rebel MLAs
text: Maharashtra Minister and Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday challenged rebel Shiv Sena MLAs to resign and fight elections "if [they] have the guts" to do so. "If you think what we have done is wrong...then resign and face elections. We are ready," Thackeray said. Addressing supporters, he said, "[Rebel MLAs] won't be able to campaign here in Maharashtra."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP's claim of Sonia being behind Teesta's campaign is baseless: Cong
text: Congress on Sunday refuted BJP's allegations of AICC chief Sonia Gandhi being behind activist Teesta Setalvad's alleged campaign to defame PM Narendra Modi over 2002 Gujarat riots, calling it "baseless". BJP's Sambit Patra had claimed that the then UPA government had given ₹1.4 crore to an NGO run by Setalvad for this purpose. Setalvad was arrested by Gujarat Police today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Withdraw 'Tughlaqi' decision immediately: Cong to Centre on 'Agnipath'
text: Centre is playing with youths' future and it must withdraw the "Tughlaqi" decision immediately, Congress spokesperson Shaktisinh Gohil said on Sunday regarding the 'Agnipath' scheme. Gohil also demanded an apology from PM Narendra Modi over BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya's remarks on 'Agnipath'. "If I want to keep security in BJP office, I'll give priority to Agniveers," Vijayvargiya had said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 16 rebel Sena MLAs served disqualification notices by Maha Dy Speaker
text: Amid the ongoing Maharashtra political crisis, the state Assembly's Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal has issued disqualification notices to 16 rebel MLAs of Shiv Sena, including Eknath Shinde. The MLAs have been asked to file their replies by 5.30 pm on Monday. They are currently staying at a hotel in Assam's Guwahati.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Eknath Shinde-led rebel camp to be known as 'Shiv Sena Balasaheb': Rebel MLA
text: Rebel MLA Deepak Kesarkar has told news agency ANI that the Eknath Shinde-led rebel camp will be known as 'Shiv Sena Balasaheb'. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, while talking about the party meet, said, "We'll...discuss party's expansion, and its future. Party is very big and cannot be hijacked with such ease. It's been made with our blood."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Seek votes in your father's name: Uddhav to Sena rebels on using Balasaheb's name
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said the leaders who have left Shiv Sena should 'ask for votes in their own father's name' and shouldn't use his father Balasaheb Thackeray's name. This came after rebel leader Eknath Shinde-led faction named themselves 'Shiv Sena Balasaheb'. Sena spokesperson Sanjay Raut said legal action will be taken over the rebel faction's name.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Thane imposes Sec 144, bans political processions till June 30 amid political crisis
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, Thane Police imposed Section 144 of CrPC in Thane city. Thane district administration issued an order banning any kind of political procession, gathering or sloganeering in the district till June 30. Notably, Shiv Sena has sent the names of four more rebel MLAs to the state Assembly Deputy Speaker for initiating action of their disqualification.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rebel Sena MLAs, families' protection withdrawn on Maharashtra CM's order: Shinde
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde has claimed that the protection of rebel Sena MLAs and their families at their residences has been withdrawn on the orders of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and the state Home Minister. "The government is responsible for protecting them and their families," he tweeted. Notably, Shinde has called for a meeting in Guwahati, ANI reported.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Mumbai Police issues high alert, asks personnel to secure every political office
text: Mumbai Police on Saturday issued a high alert and asked all the police stations to ensure security at all political offices in the city amid Maharashtra political crisis. It has also ordered the officer-level policemen to visit every political office to ensure their safety. Thane Police imposed Section 144 of CrPC, banning political processions in the district till June 30.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Section 144 imposed in Mumbai till July 10 amid political crisis in state
text: Amid political crisis in Maharashtra, Mumbai Police on Saturday imposed Section 144 of the CrPC in the city till July 10. Earlier on Saturday, police in neighbouring Thane imposed Section 144, banning any kind of political procession, gathering or sloganeering in the district till June 30. Mumbai Police has asked all police stations to ensure security at all political offices.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: PM didn't do drama while appearing before SIT: Shah on Guj riots case
text: Union Minister Amit Shah has said that PM Narendra Modi didn't do "drama or dharna" while appearing before SIT for questioning in 2002 Gujarat riots case. He said this in an apparent reference to Congress' protests over ED questioning Rahul Gandhi in National Herald case. "If SIT wants to ask questions...[PM Modi is] ready to cooperate. Why stage...protest?" Shah added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Was diagnosed with cancer, no senior Sena leader visited me: Rebel MLA
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA from Mumbai's Byculla, Yamini Jadhav, on Friday said that when she was diagnosed with cancer last year, no senior Sena leader came to visit her. "Was I supposed to be on my deathbed for my leaders to come to visit me? This was bothering me," she added. This comes amid the political crisis in Maharashtra.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BSP will support NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu: Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) chief Mayawati on Saturday said that her party has decided to support National Democratic Alliance's (NDA) Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "We have taken this decision neither in support of BJP or NDA nor against Opposition but keeping our party and movement in mind," she added. "We support a woman from a tribal community," Mayawati further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Punjab govt to introduce comprehensive law and order reforms: CM
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday announced that his government will introduce comprehensive law and order reforms in the state. Mann added that the state government will soon introduce a witness protection bill and upgrade the jails of the state to "high-security" jails. This comes after the AAP government recently faced criticism from the Opposition over singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Sena traditional rival of NCP, had asked CM for natural alliance: Rebel MLA
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Chimanrao Patil, in a video tweeted by rebel party leader Eknath Shinde, said, "We're traditionally the rivals of NCP and Congress." "They are our primary challengers in constituencies. We requested CM Uddhav Thackeray that natural alliance should be done," he added. "As there was no response from CM, our leader Eknath Shinde took stand," Patil said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: We don't know politics, not here to do it: Kejriwal in Himachal
text: Delhi CM and AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal, while holding a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu on Saturday, said, "We don't know politics. We're not here to do politics." "Our journey started from Anna [Hazare's anti-corruption] movement and then we formed a party. We vowed to eliminate corruption from the country," Kejriwal further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Attack on Rahul Gandhi's Wayanad office is unacceptable: Yechury
text: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has said that the recent attack on Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's Wayanad office, allegedly carried out by workers of CPI(M) students' wing, SFI, is "unacceptable". "Whatever happened is wrong and action is going on...We have condemned it," Yechury said. "Secondly what is the point of coming here to protest," he added referring to the IYC protest.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: On this day, Cong snatched people's rights: Shah on 47 years of Emergency
text: Union Minister Amit Shah on Saturday marked the 47th anniversary of 1975 Emergency, saying that on this day, Congress "snatched" every Indian's constitutional rights "for power" and "left even...foreign rule behind in terms of brutality". He also paid tribute to "patriots who sacrificed everything to re-establish democracy and defeat...dictatorial mindset". Emergency was declared on June 25, 1975.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Politics is being done: Chhattisgarh CM on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: Criticising the Centre over the 'Agnipath' scheme, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said, "Earlier, people retired at 60 years of age, now...youth will retire at age of 21." He added, "Politics is being done, this is a scheme of the central government, but they are asking chiefs of tri-services to make a statement in favour of the scheme."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Looks like a 'dance of monkeys': Owaisi on Maha political crisis
text: Amid the political crisis in Maharashtra, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi described the events as "a dance of monkeys". "They are acting like monkeys jumping from one branch to another," Asaduddin Owaisi said. "Let Maha Vikas Aghadi deliberate on this matter...It is their problem. Why should I go there and say something?" Owaisi added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: All methods are being used to disempower people of J&K: Mufti
text: PDP chief and former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti criticised the central government on Saturday and alleged that 'all methods are being used to disempower people' of the Union Territory. "Our land is prioritised and given to security forces first," Mufti said. "All small-big contracts are being given to outsiders including Jammu and Kashmir AIIMS," she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Pune Police issue alert after Shiv Sena vandalises rebel MLA's office
text: Pune Police have issued an alert and asked all its police stations to ensure security at offices related to Shiv Sena in the city, according to a statement by police PRO. This comes amid Maharashtra political crisis and after Shiv Sena workers vandalised the party's rebel MLA Tanaji Sawant's office. The party workers reportedly broke window panes at Sawant's office.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: We will not forget betrayal by rebel Sena MLAs: Aaditya Thackeray
text: After Shiv Sena's national executive meeting on Saturday, Maharashtra minister and party leader Aaditya Thackeray said, "We will not forget the betrayal done by rebel Shiv Sena MLAs." He also said that the party faction led by his father, Uddhav Thackeray, will come out victorious from the political crisis. The meeting was held at the Shiv Sena Bhavan in Mumbai.
author: Shailesh

headlines: TMC delegation to meet WB Governor, seek action against Suvendu
text: A delegation of TMC leaders led by Bratya Basu will meet West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on June 28 and seek action against BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari over his alleged involvement in corrupt activities, reported ANI. In its letter to the Governor, the delegation said that it wants to discuss "pertinent issues" that have "cropped up in the recent past".
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: Rajasthan govt misusing its probe agencies: State BJP chief
text: After an anti-graft body moved a court in Jaipur seeking Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat's voice samples in connection with horse-trading allegations, Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia accused the state government of 'misusing its probe agencies'. "CM Ashok Gehlot has used police, Anti-Corruption Bureau and Special Operations Group of the Rajasthan Police...for his own defence," he said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: If won I'll raise voice for farmers, unemployed youth: Yashwant Sinha
text: Opposition Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha has promised to raise his voice for farmers, unemployed youth, women and all marginalised sections of society if he wins the election. "I shall conscientiously uphold, without fear or favour, the basic values...of the Indian Constitution," he said. "I shall not allow the light of democracy and secularism to be dimmed," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: If Agniveers not entitled to pension, ready to give up mine: Varun Gandhi
text: BJP MP Varun Gandhi, while commenting on the Agnipath recruitment scheme, said if those recruited in armed forces under the initiative are not eligible for a pension, then why should public representatives get such benefit. "If those who protect the country do not have the right to pension, then I am also ready to forego mine," Varun tweeted on Friday.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: If Sena workers indulge in dadagiri, we will react in same way: Athawale
text:
Amid the ongoing conflict among the Shiv Sena MLAs, Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has asked Shiv Sena workers to not threaten the rebel MLAs. "If the Sena party workers indulge in dadagiri, then we are capable of reacting to it in the same way," Athawale said.
He added that they haven't thought yet about "forming the government" in Maharashtra.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Shiv Sena vandalises rebel MLA Tanaji Sawant's office in Pune
text: Shiv Sena workers on Saturday vandalised the office of one of the party's rebel MLAs, Tanaji Sawant, which is located in Pune's Katraj. A purported video of the incident shows the workers breaking window panes and shouting slogans. "All traitors and rebel MLAs who've troubled...[Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray] will face this type of action," the city's Shiv Sena head said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Maha CM must accept his faction has lost majority: Rebel Sena MLA
text: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar said that Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray must accept that his faction has "lost majority". "We had been in alliance with BJP for 35 years and we won elections as an alliance, so we must respect the democracy," Kesarkar said. "We've decided to form a new group named Shiv Sena Balasaheb," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Did everything for Shinde, gave him dept that I held: Maha CM
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said rebel Shiv Sena MLAs want to "break the party". "I did everything for Eknath Shinde. I gave him the department which I held. But he is making several allegations against me," he added. "The people who used to say that they would rather die than leave Shiv Sena have fled today," Thackeray said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde leaves for Mumbai from Guwahati
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde has left for Mumbai from Guwahati. This comes after Assam Pradesh Congress Committee chief Bhupen Kumar Borah wrote to Shinde, who claimed he has the support of 50 MLAs, requesting him to leave Assam along with other rebel MLAs. Sena on Thursday sought disqualification of 12 MLAs who were not present in a meeting.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Can't scare us: Shinde after Shiv Sena seeks disqualification of 12 rebel MLAs
text: After Shiv Sena wrote to Maharashtra Deputy Speaker seeking disqualification of 12 MLAs who weren't present in a meeting, rebel MLA Eknath Shinde said, "You can't scare us...because we are followers of Balasaheb Thackeray." He added, "We know the law, so we do not pay heed to threats." In a series of tweets, Shinde said, "We know your ways."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Have support of 50 MLAs, 40 from Sena: Shinde amid Maha political crisis
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde has claimed that more than 50 MLAs are supporting him. "Nearly 40 of them are from Shiv Sena," he added. Commenting on Sena's move seeking disqualification of 12 rebel MLAs, Shinde remarked, "What was done yesterday is illegal...We're the people in the majority and numbers are important in a democracy."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rahul Gandhi's office vandalised in Kerala's Wayanad; 8 SFI activists detained
text: The Kerala Police on Friday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's office in Wayanad has been vandalised by around 100 activists of the Students' Federation of India (SFI), student wing of the ruling CPI(M). "We strongly condemn the attack," Telangana Congress said in a tweet. So far, police have taken eight of the activists under custody.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Can never sit again with those who attacked my family: Uddhav on tie-up with BJP
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that he was under pressure from some MLAs to join hands with BJP. "I can never sit again with those who attacked Matoshree and my family. I may be calm...I am not weak," he added. "Those whom we raised, their ambitions have grown manifold. I can't fulfil their ambitions anymore," Thackeray stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Reaffirm post as Sena Legislature Party leader: Eknath Shinde to Maha Dy Speaker
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde wrote a letter to the Deputy Speaker of the state Assembly regarding the reaffirmation of his appointment as the Shiv Sena Legislature Party's leader. Shinde also sought the appointment of Bharatshet Gogawale as the chief whip of the party. The letter has the signatures of 37 rebel Sena MLAs.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar's office vandalised in Mumbai
text: The office of one of the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs, Mangesh Kudalkar, was allegedly vandalised in Mumbai on Friday by party workers amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra. As per reports, Kudalkar is currently staying at a hotel in Assam's Guwahati along with other Sena MLAs, including Eknath Shinde, who have rebelled against Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Shiv Sena's National Executive meeting to be held in Mumbai tomorrow
text: Amid the political crisis in Maharashtra, the Shiv Sena, led by CM Uddhav Thackeray, has called a meeting of all Sena National Executives at 1 pm on Saturday at Mumbai's Sena Bhavan. This comes after NCP chief Sharad Pawar, state NCP president Jayant Patil and state Deputy CM Ajit Pawar met Thackeray at the latter's residence on Friday evening.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Gave them a chance, now it's too late: Raut while challenging Sena rebels for floor test
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday challenged the rebel MLAs for the floor test and said that Sena will win. "We gave an opportunity to those who left (rebel Sena MLAs), now it's too late," he added. "I challenge them...Maha Vikas Aghadi government will complete the rest of two and a half years," Raut stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: I don't know if Maharashtra MLAs are staying in Assam: CM Himanta Biswa
text: As around 42 rebel MLAs of Maharashtra are staying at a hotel in Guwahati, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "I don't know if Maharashtra MLAs are staying in Assam." He added, "There are many good hotels in Assam, anyone can come there and stay...there is no issue with it." The rebel MLAs are led by Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: All 'tourists' are welcome in Assam: CM Himanta on Maha MLAs in Guwahati
text: Commenting on the rebel Maharashtra MLAs in Guwahati, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that all "tourists" are welcome in the state. "Some people have come to Assam. They booked hotels. I am happy about that. You also come, it will help Assam's economy," he added. "Through this, Assam's tourism is also getting promoted," Sarma further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu files nomination in presence of PM, Shah
text: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu on Friday filed her nomination in the presence of PM Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah and senior leaders of the ruling party. Earlier, PM Modi had tweeted, "I am confident she will be a great President of our nation." "Millions of people, especially those who have experienced poverty...derive great strength from the life...Murmu Ji."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Threats being given to Sharad Pawar by a BJP Central minister: Raut
text: Threats are being given to NCP chief Sharad Pawar by a BJP Central minister, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut claimed. "Do such threats have PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah's support?" he added. "A BJP Central minister has said...if attempts are made to save the Maha Vikas Aghadi government...Pawar will not be allowed to go home," Raut said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Not acceptable: Raut on BJP minister's alleged threat to Pawar
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has claimed that a BJP Central minister threatened that NCP leader Sharad Pawar "will not go home" if attempts are made to save MVA government, adding, "Whether or not...MVA survives, use of such language for Pawar isn't acceptable." Minister of State for Railways Raosaheb Patil Danve denied the allegations, saying, "BJP isn't trying to destabilise...government."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Shiv Sena workers throw eggs, ink on Eknath Shinde's poster in Maha
text: Amid the political crisis in Maharashtra, several Shiv Sena workers were allegedly seen throwing eggs and ink on a poster of rebel party leader Eknath Shinde in Nashik. The workers also allegedly raised slogans against Shinde. On Thursday, a poster of rebel MLA Sada Sarvankar was smeared with ink and the word "traitor" was allegedly written on it.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Man from Maha's Beed writes to Guv, demands to be made acting CM
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, a man from Beed district has written to Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari urging that he be made the acting Chief Minister of the state. Shrikant Gadale, in his letter, claimed that Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray had neglected the problems of common people and that farmers are not being helped in the state.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Have done much more for tribals than Droupadi Murmu: Yashwant Sinha
text: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha on Thursday said that he has done more for tribals and other disadvantaged communities than Droupadi Murmu, NDA's candidate in the polls. "Being born into a certain community doesn't automatically make you the champion of that community," he added. Sinha also said that the contest this time isn't a fight of identity but of ideology.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Would advise rebel Sena MLAs to leave Assam in state's interest: Assam Cong
text: The Congress President of the Assam unit, Bhupen Kumar Borah, has asked rebel Shiv Sena MLAs led by Maharashtra Minister Eknath Shinde to "leave" Assam in the greater interest of the state. "Your presence (rebel MLAs) in Guwahati...who have been kept for alleged horse-trading...has not gone well with the Assamese people and is creating an unhealthy atmosphere," Borah said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Eknath Shinde will form government with BJP: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale
text: Amid political crisis in Maharashtra, Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's time is up. "Most MLAs will go with Eknath Shinde (rebel Shiv Sena MLA) and he'll form government with BJP," Athawale claimed. Meanwhile, Shinde has reportedly gained the support of 44 MLAs so far, of which 37 are from Shiv Sena and seven are independent MLAs.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Someone can break BJP too: Mamata amid Maha political crisis
text: Amid political crisis in Maharashtra, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee demanded justice for CM Uddhav Thackeray, accusing BJP of trying to topple the government. "Today you (BJP) are in power and using money, muscle and mafia power. But one day you have to go. Someone can break your party too," Mamata said. "We want justice for people, constitution," she added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Agnipath harmful for youth & nation, reconsider it: Kejriwal to govt
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday called the Agnipath scheme "harmful for our youth and country" and urged the Centre to review it. Criticising the scheme, he stated, "After four years of service, they will be called ex-servicemen and will not get any pension." He had earlier said that the youth should get to serve the country for their lifetimes.
author: Mayukh Debnath

headlines: Withdraw cases against Agnipath protestors: Telangana Congress
text: Congress leader Mallu Ravi has asked the Centre and the state government to withdraw cases imposed on the state's youth involved in the agitation against the Agnipath scheme at the Secunderabad Railway Station last week. "CM KCR blames BJP for the killing of a youth in protest...(while) the local police, files cases...which shows state govt's double standards," Ravi said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: High inflation, depreciating rupee: Chidambaram as he criticises Centre
text: Former Union Minister P Chidambaram has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the state of the Indian economy. "High FD, high inflation, huge FPI outflows, depreciating rupee, depletion of forex reserves...what do they point to? Is the Indian economy in the pink of health?" Chidambaram questioned. "Within months of setting the FD target at 6.4%...the government is backsliding," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: YSRCP extends support to NDA Presidential candidate Murmu
text: Andhra Pradesh's ruling party YSRCP has extended its support for BJP-led NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "It's a good sign that a person from a tribal community, that too a woman, has been nominated for...President's post for the first time in...history of independent India," a press release announcing YSRCP's support said. Murmu filed her nomination for the post today.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP misused power in bypolls to Azamgarh & Rampur seats: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP of misusing power in the bypolls to Azamgarh and Rampur Lok Sabha seats. "Hurdles were created by the ruling party to disrupt polling," Yadav stated. "Though the EC was informed, the entire election machinery remained a mute spectator," he said. Yadav added that voters were not allowed to vote without fear.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Send Maharashtra MLAs to Bengal: Mamata amid Maha political crisis
text: Amid the political crisis in Maharashtra, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has accused the BJP of trying to topple the Maha Vikas Aghadi government. "Send Maharashtra MLAs to Bengal. We will extend good hospitality to them," Mamata added. At least 42 rebel MLAs are currently staying in Radisson Blu Hotel in Assam's Guwahati amid the ongoing flood situation.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 42 rebel Maharashtra MLAs seen together at Guwahati hotel amid political crisis
text: As many as 42 rebel MLAs from Maharashtra were seen together at Radisson Blu Hotel in Assam's Guwahati on Thursday. The MLAs included 35 from Shiv Sena and seven Independent. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena office bearers have been called for an urgent meeting at the Shiv Sena Bhawan in Mumbai's Dadar.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: After Sena MLA's abduction claim, rebel MLAs release pics with him in private jet
text: The group of rebel Shiv Sena MLAs led by Eknath Shinde has released pictures with MLA Nitin Deshmukh, a day after he claimed that he was "kidnapped" and taken to Gujarat's Surat from where he escaped. Deshmukh is seen sitting with other Shiv Sena MLAs in a chartered plane. Deshmukh had also said that he is with CM Uddhav Thackeray.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Floor test will decide if MVA govt in Maharashtra is in minority: Sharad Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday said the way to prove if CM Uddhav Thackeray-led government in Maharashtra is in minority is through the floor of the Assembly. He said Shiv Sena rebels will have to present themselves in Vidhan Bhawan premises in Mumbai. "I believe once the [Shiv Sena] MLAs return to Mumbai, the situation will change," Pawar added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: If rebels return in 24hrs, Shiv Sena will consider walking out of MVA govt: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the party was ready to walk out of the Maha Vikas Aghadi governement in Maharashtra, but party rebels should return to Mumbai from Guwahati in 24 hours. "We are ready to consider exiting out of Maha Vikas Aghadi if this is will of all MLAs," he added. Raut said MLAs shouldn't communicate from Guwahati.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: If Sena wants to form alliance with anyone, we don't have problem: Maha Cong chief
text: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Thursday said that if Shiv Sena wants to form an alliance with anyone, his party would not have any problem. "We are with Sena to stop BJP from coming to power. This game is happening due to Enforcement Directorate," he added. "Congress is ready for the floor test," Patole further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: We were denied entry to CM house for 2.5 yrs, felt insulted: Rebel MLAs to Uddhav
text: Rebel Sena leader Eknath Shinde has posted a letter on Twitter with a number of complaints against Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray. Rebel MLAs said they felt insulted as they were denied entry to CM house for 2.5 years, however, Congress and NCP leaders met him and even got funds. They also claimed that Thackeray stopped them from visiting Ayodhya.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: TMC workers protest outside Assam hotel where Sena MLAs are staying; detained
text: Trinamool Congress (TMC) workers of party's Assam unit on Thursday protested outside the hotel in Guwahati where rebel Maharashtra MLAs, led by Eknath Shinde, are staying. The protestors, led by TMC's state president Ripun Bora, were detained by the police. "People in Assam are suffering due to floods...CM Himanta Biswa Sarma is busy toppling the Maharashtra government," a protestor said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Cong calls leaders' meeting at 4pm after Raut said 'can consider exiting MVA'
text: Maharashtra Congress has called a meeting of its leaders at Sahyadri guest house in Mumbai at 4 pm on Thursday after Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the party can consider walking out of MVA government if party rebels return to Mumbai from Guwahati. Senior Congress leaders HK Patil, Balasaheb Thorat, Nana Patole and Ashok Chavan will attend the meeting.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Harsh Goenka calls rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde his lookalike, shares pic
text: Amid political crisis in Maharashtra after Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde moved to a Guwahati hotel with over 40 rebel MLAs, RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka has called Shinde his lookalike. Sharing a collage of their pictures, Goenka tweeted, "In Guwahati, if anyone wants to reach me." "Never knew you were the doppelgänger of Shinde saab," a Twitter user reacted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: EPS camp seeks leadership discussion, OPS walks out of AIADMK meet
text: The question of single leadership was left undecided at AIADMK's General Council Meeting on Thursday. Former CM Edappadi Palaniswami's cadres rejected 23 resolutions and the matter was postponed for the next meeting on July 11. Former Deputy CM O Panneerselvam and his supporters staged a walkout. Tamil Magan Hussain was elected as the party's Presidium Chairman.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: About 20 MLAs in touch with us: Sena's Raut amid Maha political crisis
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that about 20 rebel MLAs are in touch with the party. "I won't talk about any camp, I will talk about my party," he added. "When they come to Mumbai, you will get to know...will soon be revealed, in what circumstances [and] pressure these MLAs left us," Raut further said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: We fully support Uddhav ji, will do everything to save govt: Ajit Pawar
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, Deputy CM and NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Thursday said his party fully supports CM Uddhav Thackeray. "We will stand with Uddhav Thackeray ji till the end...We will do everything to save the government," Pawar said. "Uddhav has asked rebels to return...We're keeping an eye on the...political situation," Pawar added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP destabilising govt in Maha, doing same for Prez polls: Cong
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday claimed BJP is responsible for destabilising a stable government in Maharashtra, adding that the saffron party is doing something similar for Presidential polls. Amid the political crisis in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Wednesday claimed that Uddhav Thackeray is Chief Minister of Maharashtra and he will remain the CM.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: NCP ready to sit in Opposition if MVA govt falls: Jayant Patil
text: NCP leader Jayant Patil on Thursday said that his party is ready to sit in the Opposition if the Maha Vikas Aghadi-led government falls in Maharashtra. "If [the] government stays, we will be in power. If [the] government goes, we will sit in Opposition," he said. He has called all NCP MLAs for a meeting in the evening today.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP has lost support base in urban areas of Haryana: Former CM Hooda
text: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday, while referring to the civic body poll results, said the BJP-led state government has lost support even in urban areas of the state. According to Hooda, BJP secured 26.3% votes in cities, while independent candidates got 52.2% votes. "The BJP-JJP alliance...completely failed to win the trust of the people," Hooda said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Uddhav became CM by 'deceit', has no control over Shiv Sena: Amit Malviya
text: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Wednesday, while commenting upon the political crisis in Maharashtra, said Uddhav Thackeray is one of the worst performing CMs. "Uddhav Thackeray inherited the party, power and Balasaheb's legacy. He became CM by deceit," Malviya tweeted. Malviya further alleged that despite being in power, the CM has no control over his party.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: PM busy toppling Maha govt while Assam reels under floods: Cong MP
text: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Thursday criticised PM Narendra Modi over the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra. "If there's a crisis, it's that of floods…There are floods in Assam, PM should visit the state [and] announce a special package but he's busy toppling Maharashtra government or in Gujarat elections," said Gogoi. Power is everything for the BJP, he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Will stand with CM Uddhav Thackeray if MVA govt falls: NCP leader
text: Amid ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, NCP leader Jayant Patil on Thursday said the party will stand with CM Uddhav Thackeray if coalition government Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) falls. "[Sharad Pawar]...told us [to]...do everything...to ensure that the government remains," Patil added.
