Patil's comments come after Thackeray said he'll resign as CM if even a single MLA objects to his designation.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP playing 'dirty politics' in Maharashtra: K'taka Congress leader
text: Karnataka Congress leader Dinesh Gundu Rao on Thursday accused the BJP of playing "dirty politics" to come to power in Maharashtra. "The bad tradition of unconstitutionally overthrowing...constitutionally elected government and purchasing...leaders in other states began in Karnataka," Rao said. He stated that current political situation in Maharashtra "shows how low the BJP goes for power".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Droupadi Murmu's administrative experience will benefit India: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that NDA-backed Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's administrative experience will benefit the entire country. "Met...Droupadi Murmu ji and conveyed [my] best wishes to her. Tribal society is feeling very proud by the announcement of her name," Shah added. Murmu served as the Governor of Jharkhand from 2015 to 2021.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Fadnavis is capable of taking decision in Maha's interest: Goa CM
text: Amid political crisis in Maharashtra, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said that BJP's central leadership and ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis are monitoring ongoing developments. He added that Fadnavis is capable of taking a decision in the interest of Maharashtra. Sawant's comments come as 42 rebel MLAs of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government were seen at a Guwahati hotel earlier today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: ED reduced to taking 'enforced directives' from the Modi govt: Cong
text: Congress National Spokesperson Gourav Vallabh on Thursday alleged the ED has been reduced to taking enforced directives from the PM Modi government. "When their (BJP's) incompetence has started to show across the spectrum, the party has yet again resorted to cheap tricks," he said. He further alleged that ED's questioning of Rahul Gandhi is a mere political stunt.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP has 'broken' dream of lakhs of youth: Rahul on 'Agnipath'
text: Criticising the Centre over the proposed 'Agnipath' scheme, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that BJP has "broken the dream" of lakhs of youth. Rahul also asserted that a storm will rise from the tears of the youth that will break PM Narendra Modi's arrogance of power. He had previously alleged that the BJP was weakening the armed forces.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM will divide K'taka & Maha into 2 parts each, UP into 4: Minister
text: BJP Minister in Karnataka Umesh Katti on Thursday said that after the 2024 elections, PM Narendra Modi will divide Maharashtra and Karnataka into two parts each and UP into four. He said that the PM has plans to create 50 states in total. Katti added that a movement to create a separate state for North Karnataka needs to be created.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM meets Droupadi Murmu, says her nomination appreciated by all
text: PM Narendra Modi met NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu, ahead of her filing the nomination papers for the upcoming Presidential elections. PM Modi, on his Twitter account, claimed that her nomination has been appreciated across India by all sections of society. "Her understanding of grassroots problems and vision for India's development is outstanding," PM wrote in a tweet.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP blind to the pain of people suffering from floods: Cong's Gogoi
text: Assam Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Thursday criticised BJP and said that the party has become blind to the pain of the people of the Northeast suffering from floods. He further said that BJP is only interested in their lust for power and PM Narendra Modi is either busy campaigning in Gujarat or trying to topple the government in Maharashtra.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: If not in power, we know how to fight in opposition: NCP leader
text: Amid the political crisis in Maharashtra, Minister and NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal has said, "If at all we aren't in power, we know how to fight while being in Opposition." "We're in Sharad Pawar-led MVA and are with Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray," Bhujbal said. "Even in governments run by single party there can be internal tussles," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Uddhav Thackeray leaves Maha CM's official bungalow after offering to quit; video surfaces
text: Hours after offering to resign from his post amid political crisis, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray left Maharashtra CM's official residence 'Varsha' in Mumbai. A video showed him leaving the bungalow after his staffers were seen putting his packed luggage in a car. He would be moving to his family home 'Matoshree', according to reports.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Essential to get out of unnatural alliance: Eknath Shinde after Thackeray's speech
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said, "It is essential to get out of the unnatural front for the survival of the party and Shiv Sainiks." His remarks came soon after CM Uddhav Thackeray addressed the state amid the political crisis. Shinde added, "Decisions need to be taken now in the interest of Maharashtra."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: 3 more Shiv Sena rebel MLAs reach Guwahati amid Maharashtra political crisis
text: Amid the Maharashtra political crisis, three more Shiv Sena rebel MLAs on Thursday morning reached Radisson Blu Hotel in Assam's Guwahati. Rebel Sena leader Eknath Shinde and other party MLAs landed in Assam on Wednesday and Shinde claimed the support of 40 Sena MLAs. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday offered to resign from his post amid the political crisis.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Voting for bypolls to 3 Lok Sabha, 7 Assembly seats begins
text: Voting for bypolls to three Lok Sabha and seven Assembly seats began on Thursday. The parliamentary bypolls are being held in Azamgarh and Rampur in UP and Sangrur in Punjab. The Assembly bypolls are being conducted for four seats in Tripura and one each in Delhi, Jharkhand and Andhra Pradesh. Counting of votes will be done on June 26.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: CM post will come & go, real asset is people's affection: Maharashtra CM
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said the CM post will come and go but the real asset is the affection of the people. "In the past two years, I was fortunate enough to get a lot of affection from people," Thackeray added. He told the rebel MLAs that he'll resign if even one MLA objects to him as CM.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Cong leader Acharya Pramod asks Maharashtra CM to resign; party clarifies
text: Congress leader Acharya Pramod Krishnam on Wednesday asked Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to resign amid the ongoing political crisis. Acharya tweeted that Thackeray must respect the legacy of Shiv Sena Founder Bal Thackeray and resign. Responding to this, Congress Communications In-charge Jairam Ramesh said Acharya's views aren't that of Congress and he isn't the party's official spokesperson.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No Sena MLA in touch with us, BJP not staking claim to form govt: Danve
text: Amid Maharashtra political crisis, BJP leader and Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve on Wednesday said that his party is not staking claim to form government in the state. "No Shiv Sena MLA is in touch with us. We haven't spoken to Eknath Shinde," he added. "This is Shiv Sena's internal matter. BJP has nothing to do with this," Danve stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 'How did we have no intel on flight of rebels?' Pawar asked Maha Home Minister: Report
text: Sharad Pawar has reportedly conveyed his "serious displeasure" to Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil about Home Ministry and Intelligence department not alerting the leadership about rebel Sena MLAs leaving the state. "Since police escorts providing security also carry firearms, they are expected to inform superiors about the same so there is no issue in another state," an official said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Time to fight: Shiv Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi amid political crisis
text: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi tweeted a message of fighting back after Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's speech amid political crisis in the state. "Shiv Sena functions like one big family...for larger good over its politics," Chaturvedi tweeted. "Shiv Sainiks work for respect and honour. That principle has been broken by the engineering of those desperate for power," she said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: If India becomes Hindu nation, will it remain so: CM Gehlot
text: Accusing BJP and RSS of provoking people to create communal disharmony, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot questioned, "How long will you keep instigating people in the name of Hinduism?" Gehlot asked if India becomes Hindu nation, will it remain so? "Countries can be formed in...name of religion, but...[no] guarantee that it'll remain united," he said, citing examples of Pakistan and Bangladesh.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: ED knows that a Cong leader can't be scared, suppressed: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said, "ED and such agencies don't affect me, even the officers who interrogated me understood that a leader of the Congress party can't be scared and suppressed." Rahul thanked party workers for supporting him during the ED questioning, adding that he wasn't alone and that they were fighting for democracy with him.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: We welcome all tourists, need funds to deal with floods: Assam CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Wednesday said that he welcomes all to visit Assam as the state needs revenue to deal with the devastating flood. His response came hours after a group of Maharashtra MLAs reached Assam and were put up in a luxury hotel. "We should be happy as it will bring in revenue," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Sharad Pawar meets CM Uddhav Thackeray amid Maha political crisis
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar and his daughter and party leader Supriya Sule met CM Uddhav Thackeray at his residence in Mumbai amid the political crisis in Maharashtra. The meeting came soon after Thackeray addressed the people of Maharashtra and said he was ready to resign from the post if the rebel MLAs tell him they don't want him to continue.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: This is the same Shiv Sena that it was at Balasaheb's time: Maharashtra CM
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday said his party is the same as it was during Shiv Sena Founder Balasaheb Thackeray's time. "Some people say that it's not Balasaheb's Shiv Sena. They should tell what were the thoughts of Balasaheb," the CM said. "It's very shameful for me if even a single MLA is against me," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Droupadi Murmu is suitable candidate for President: Ex-PM Deve Gowda
text: Former PM and JD(S) leader HD Deve Gowda on Wednesday said that Droupadi Murmu is a suitable candidate to be the President of India. Murmu was recently announced as the National Democratic Alliance's Presidential candidate. However, Gowda didn't respond to a question about whether his party would support Murmu or Yashwant Sinha, a joint nominee of major Opposition political parties.
author: Shailesh

headlines: BJP was sleeping on B'luru rail project for 3 years: Kumaraswamy
text: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy criticised PM Narendra Modi and said BJP was "sleeping for the last three years" over implementing Bengaluru suburban rail project. "The project was proposed to be implemented in six years in 2019 and...three years have lapsed," Kumaraswamy said. This comes after PM Modi said a project pending for 40 years will be completed in 40 months.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Maha CM Uddhav's address a 'tight slap' to all dissenters: AIMIM MP
text: AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel on Wednesday praised Uddhav Thackeray's live address and said it was a tight slap to all dissenters within the Shiv Sena. I appreciate the truthfulness of the Maharashtra CM, he said. He further added that while the two parties have ideological differences, his respect for the CM grew after hearing his address.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Stop insulting Murmu ji: Rijiju on Cong's 'dummy President' remark
text: Criticising Congress over "BJP wants a dummy as President" remark, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju tweeted, "Stop insulting Smt Droupadi Murmu ji, former Governor, former Minister...she has risen from a humble background through dedication and devotion." "What do you mean by 'Dummy'? Congress party insulted Dr BR Ambedkar, PA Sangma and many respectable SC/ST leaders," Rijiju tweeted.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: AAP activists protest in Guj, demand free or cheaper electricity
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) activists have been protesting across Gujarat demanding free or cheaper electricity from the ruling BJP government, citing the Delhi model. "Despite BJP being in power for 27 years in Gujarat, electricity here is the most expensive in the country," AAP's national joint general secretary said. AAP's 15-day campaign 'Muft Bijli Andolan' was launched on June 15.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: How will Kamal Nath save Maharashtra govt?: MP CM asks Congress
text: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Wednesday questioned the Congress party's decision of deputing senior party leader and former MP CM Kamal Nath as All India Congress Committee (AICC) observer in Maharashtra amid a political crisis. "How will someone who couldn't save his own govt in Madhya Pradesh, save the Maharashtra government?" Chouhan said while referring to Kamal Nath.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Problem is BJP's attitude of using money to poach MLAs: Venugopal
text: Amid ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, Congress MP KC Venugopal criticised the BJP and said, "The problem is the BJP's attitude of using money and agencies to poach the MLAs." "It's an internal issue of Shiv Sena and the party leadership can sort it out easily," Venugopal said. The Congress MP added that the Shiv Sena will survive.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Won't allow Centre to rob states of their rights if elected Prez: Sinha
text: Yashwant Sinha, the Presidential candidate backed by major Opposition parties, on Wednesday said that he would not allow the Centre to rob the state governments of their rights if he is elected as the President. Congress, Trinamool Congress, Samajwadi Party and Nationalist Congress Party are among the parties that have nominated Sinha. He had resigned from Trinamool Congress on Tuesday.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Those in power targeting dissidents: Pilot on ED questioning Rahul
text: Criticising the BJP-led Central government over Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe against Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, Congress leader Sachin Pilot claimed that party leadership is being "targeted" for being vocal against BJP. He termed the ED investigation a "politically motivated" move. "It is not just about Mrs Sonia Gandhi or Rahul Gandhi, but the entire Opposition," Pilot said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Thackeray will remain Maha CM: Sanjay Raut amid political crisis
text: Amid a political crisis in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Wednesday said that Uddhav Thackeray is Chief Minister of Maharashtra and he will remain the CM. He also said, "If we get the chance, we will prove our majority on the floor of the House." Notably, Thackeray had said that he was ready to resign from the post.
author: Shailesh

headlines: JD(U) backs Droupadi Murmu, RJD to support Yashwant Sinha in Prez polls
text: Janata Dal United (JDU) on Wednesday extended its support to NDA-nominated candidate Droupadi Murmu for the upcoming Presidential elections. "As the Governor of...Jharkhand, [Murmu] performed her duties well," Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, endorsing her candidature for the post. Meanwhile, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has backed Opposition's joint candidate ex-TMC leader Yashwant Sinha for the polls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Turn out in large numbers: Sonam Kapoor appeals to Rajinder Nagar voters
text: As voting for Rajinder Nagar bypoll in Delhi began on Thursday, Bollywood actress Sonam Kapoor appealed to voters to turn out in large numbers. "I appeal to all...voters in Rajinder Nagar assembly constituency to come out with their family members and friends and vote," Sonam said in a video message. She has been chosen as district icon by poll authorities.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: BJP leader seeks FIR against COVID +ve Maha CM for meeting supporters
text: BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga has filed a police complaint and sought an FIR against Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray for allegedly violating COVID-19 protocols by meeting his supporters despite testing positive for the infection. Bagga said that reports of Thackeray being infected came since Wednesday morning but he still met MLAs and MPs before leaving his official residence.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Keeping my resignation ready, tell me if you want me to quit: Maharashtra CM to rebel MLAs
text: Amid political crisis, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray told the rebel MLAs, "I'll resign if even one MLA objects to me as CM. I'm keeping my resignation letter ready. You tell me you want me to resign." This comes after 34 rebel MLAs, supporting Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde, reportedly declared him as their leader in a letter to state governor.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: 34 Sena MLAs back Eknath Shinde as party leader in letter to Maharashtra Governor
text: A total of 34 rebel Shiv Sena MLAs have written a letter to the Maharashtra Governor and passed a resolution backing Eknath Shinde as the legislative party leader. They also removed Sena MLA Sunil Prabhu from the party whip post and appointed Bharat Gogawale as the new whip. Meanwhile, CM Uddhav Thackeray will address the state in a little while.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Shiv Sena's order to MLAs to attend 5 pm meeting legally invalid: Eknath Shinde
text: Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde said the Shiv Sena's order to all its MLAs to attend a meeting scheduled for 5 pm on Wednesday at CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence is legally invalid. Shinde said MLA Bharat Gogawale has been appointed as the Chief Representative of Shiv Sena Legislature. The order about the meeting was issued by party leader Sunil Prabhu.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray tests COVID-19 positive amid political crisis
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has tested positive for COVID-19 amid ongoing political crisis in the state. "I had a meeting with Uddhav Thackeray ji but he has tested positive for COVID-19, so I'm not meeting him" said Kamal Nath, Congress Observer for the state. Earlier in the day, Maharashtra Governor was admitted to a hospital after testing positive for COVID-19.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Upset with NCP, Congress; not Uddhav Thackeray: Rebel Shiv Sena MLA
text: Maharashtra minister Sandipan Bhumare, who is one of the rebel Shiv Sena MLAs amid the state's political crisis, said they are not upset with CM Uddhav Thackeray. It was getting "very difficult" for their proposals and work requests to get approved by Congress and NCP ministers, he added. "I could not [work] properly because of Congress and NCP," Bhumare stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Those who don't attend 5 pm meeting will be considered out: Sena to MLAs
text: Shiv Sena has asked all its MLAs to attend a meeting scheduled for 5 pm on Wednesday at Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence. The letter, issued by Sena chief whip Sunil Prabhu, stated that those who will not attend the meeting will be considered out of the party. "Your membership is liable to be cancelled under the law," it read.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Political crisis in Maharashtra heading towards dissolution of Vidhan Sabha: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Wednesday hinted at the dissolution of Maharashtra Legislative Assembly amid the current political crisis in the state. He tweeted, "The ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra is heading towards the dissolution of Vidhan Sabha." This comes as rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde, who has moved to Assam, claimed the support of over 40 MLAs.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sonia requests ED to postpone questioning till recovery from COVID
text: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Wednesday wrote to Enforcement Directorate to postpone her appearance in connection with National Herald case by few weeks till she completely recovers from COVID-19 and lung infection. Gandhi was undergoing treatment at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital and was discharged on Monday. Her son and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been questioned in this case.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Pawar & Kamal Nath called me, said they want me to continue as CM: Thackeray
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray while addressing the state on Wednesday said NCP chief Sharad Pawar and Congress leader Kamal Nath phoned him saying they want him to continue as the Chief Minister. "Getting calls from MLAs who have gone with Eknath Shinde...They are claiming that they were forcibly taken away," he added amid a political crisis in the state.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Shinde argued with Raut, Aaditya over votes for Congress in MLC polls 2 days ago: Report
text: Two days before Sena leader Eknath Shinde revolted, he reportedly had an argument with Aaditya Thackeray and Sanjay Raut at a hotel in Mumbai where the Sena MLAs had been kept ahead of the Legislative Council elections. The argument was over using additional votes for the Congress party, according to reports. Congress candidate Bhai Jagtap won but Chandrakant Handore lost.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: ED asked how I'm able to sit straight for 11-hr probe, I said I do 'vipassana': Rahul
text: Addressing Congress workers in Delhi, Rahul Gandhi, who is being probed in an alleged money laundering case, said that ED officers asked him how he was able to sit straight up in a chair for 11 hours. Gandhi said, "I told them I do 'vipassana' but the real reason is I wasn't alone there, all Congress workers were with me."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 100 Gujarat policemen took me to hospital, wanted to harm me, I back Uddhav: Sena MLA
text: Shiv Sena MLA Nitin Deshmukh has claimed that he was "kidnapped" and taken to Gujarat's Surat from where he escaped. He said, "At least 100-150 policemen took me to hospital, created a false narrative that I got an attack...They wanted to harm me. I support CM Uddhav Thackeray." Sanjay Raut claimed Deshmukh said it was an attempt to murder him.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: BJP will fail in toppling government in Maharashtra, says Shiv Sena
text: Amid a political crisis in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece ‘Saamana’ said BJP will fail in toppling the government. It stated that BJP attempted to topple the Maha Vikas Aghadi government two and a half years back, but it failed. Meanwhile, party leader Sanjay Raut hinted at the dissolution of the state Legislative Assembly.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong embezzled ₹65 lakh released for street lights: Punjab AAP leader
text: AAP leader from Punjab's Dakha, Dr KNS Kang, claimed that the previous Congress government "embezzled" a grant of ₹65 lakh that was released for installing street lights ahead of Punjab Assembly elections in January. The street lights were supposed to be installed in 26 villages of Dakha's Sidhwan Bet block. The lights were purchased at an inflated rate, Kang alleged.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: At most we might lose power but we'll continue to fight: Sanjay Raut
text: Amid a political crisis in Maharashtra, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Wednesday said that talks are underway with MLAs who are with state minister Eknath Shinde. "Our party is a fighter, we'll struggle consistently, at most, we might lose power but we will continue to fight," Raut added. "Everybody will stay in Shiv Sena," Raut stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Mahila Cong head booked for spitting at Delhi police personnel
text: All India Mahila Congress President Netta D'Souza has been booked by the Delhi Police for spitting on the police personnel during a protest in the national capital. A video surfaced on Tuesday, showing D'Souza spitting from a bus when the protesting Congress workers were being detained by the police for protesting against the ED summons to Rahul Gandhi.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Agnipath will weaken armed forced, PM will have to withdraw it: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday accused Centre of "weakening" the armed forces through the Agnipath scheme. "They are weakening our Army, for which the country will suffer, and they call themselves nationalists," Rahul said while addressing party leaders and workers at Congress headquarters in Delhi. He further said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will have to withdraw the scheme.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Maha CM-led govt's countdown started, says Kirit Somaiya amid political crisis
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, BJP leader Kirit Somaiya on Tuesday said that the "countdown" for Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray-led government has begun. "Maharashtra Vidhan Parishad election results: Shiv Sena (mafia sena) got 52 votes, 12 MLAs revolted (55 Shiv Sena+ nine supporters = 64). Uddhav Thackeray's 'mafia sarkar's' countdown [has] started," Somaiya tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: How will youth secure borders if they're insecure about their future?: Tejashwi
text: Amid protests against the Agnipath scheme, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav asked, "If these people (youth) have to feel unsure about their own future, how are they going to defend the border?" "It is believed that the scheme could render 75% of the soldiers unemployed after four years," Yadav added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Public support for BSP will convert into votes: Mayawati on Azamgarh bypoll
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday exuded confidence about her party candidate's victory in the Azamgarh Lok Sabha bypoll. "The BSP getting the support of people of all classes and religions in the by-election to Azamgarh Lok Sabha seat...is very encouraging...this public support will definitely turn into votes," Mayawati tweeted. The Azamgarh bypoll will take place on June 23.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP's goal is to capture entire India: Adhir Ranjan amid political crisis in Maha
text: Amid a political crisis in Maharashtra, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Wednesday said that the BJP wants to "capture" entire India. "If an Opposition party speaks against them, they don't tolerate it. They are walking the path of building an 'Opposition-free India'," he added. "First they said 'Congress-mukt' India, now they changed it to 'vipaksh-mukt'," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Miscommunication within Shiv Sena led to rift between its leaders: Cong MP
text: Amid a political crisis in Maharashtra, Congress MP Suresh Balubhau Dhanorkar said miscommunication within the Shiv Sena led to the rift between its leaders. Furthermore, Dhanorkar said that when Sena MLAs got elected, it became the responsibility of their leader to keep the flock together. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut hinted at the dissolution of the state Legislative Assembly.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 'Murmu will be dummy President,' says Puducherry Congress; BJP reacts
text: BJP's Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticised the Puducherry Congress after the party's official Twitter handle said Droupadi Murmu, NDA's candidate for the upcoming Presidential poll, will be a "dummy President". "Congress has started insulting tribal community and women...someone who worked her way up being insulted," he tweeted, sharing screenshot of now-deleted tweet by Congress.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Under Modi, conspiracies being hatched to topple governments: CM Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot criticised BJP-led Central government and alleged that under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, conspiracies are being hatched to topple governments. “In Madhya Pradesh they were successful...we [Rajasthan] took...timely steps...that made us successful in thwarting their attempts," he said. His comments came following recent political crisis in Maharashtra.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Shiv Sena should renew its ties with BJP: Sena MLA Pratap Sarnaik
text: Shiv Sena should renew its ties with BJP, Sena MLA Pratap Sarnaik said on Wednesday. His comments came following a revolt by some party MLAs led by Eknath Shinde. Notably, Sarnaik, who is being investigated in a money laundering case, had urged CM Thackeray last year to team up with BJP to save its leaders from action by central agencies.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Kaziranga is a good place to visit: Raut on Shiv Sena MLAs in Assam
text: Kaziranga is a good place to visit, said Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Shiv Sena MLAs camping in Assam's Guwahati. "Those who want to see nature can go there," he added. Meanwhile, a letter issued by Shiv Sena chief whip Sunil Prabhu said party MLAs who don't attend meeting at 5 pm on Wednesday will be considered out.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cong united, MLAs not for sale: Kamal Nath amid Maha political crisis
text: Amid a political crisis in Shiv Sena-led Maharashtra government, senior Congress leader Kamal Nath on Wednesday said his party is united and its MLAs are "not for sale". "It's for...Shiv Sena to take care of its team and see how it wants to handle its MLAs," he said. The Congress on Tuesday appointed Kamal Nath as AICC observer for Maharashtra.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Shiv Sena MLAs to be shifted to Mumbai hotel from Maharashtra CM's house
text: Shiv Sena MLAs, who were reportedly lodged at a hotel in Gujarat's Surat, will now be shifted to St Regis Hotel in Mumbai's Lower Parel from Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's official residence, as per reports. Earlier on Tuesday, Shiv Sena leaders Milind Narvekar and Ravi Pathak met Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde at the hotel in Surat.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Eknath Shinde removes Shiv Sena from Twitter bio amid political crisis in Maharashtra
text: Maharashtra Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday removed Shiv Sena from his bio on Twitter, hours after the party reportedly removed him as its Legislative party leader. Earlier, Shinde had said, "We have never and will never cheat for power regarding Balasaheb's thoughts and Dharmaveer Anand Dighe Saheb's teachings." Shinde reportedly moved to a hotel in Gujarat with several MLAs.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Eknath Shinde lands in Assam, says '40 Sena MLAs with me, will carry forward Hindutva'
text: Rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde and other party MLAs landed in Assam on Wednesday morning and were received by BJP leaders Sushanta Borgohain and Pallab Lochan Das. Shinde claimed the support of 40 Sena MLAs. He said, "We've not left Balasaheb Thackeray's Shiv Sena and will not leave it. We've been following Balasaheb's Hindutva and will carry it further."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu sweeps Shiv temple floor in Odisha
text: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu was seen sweeping the floor at Shiv temple in Rairangpur, Odisha before offering prayers on Wednesday morning. After NDA announced Murmu as their Presidential candidate, the Centre provided round-the-clock Z+ category security cover for her by the armed Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF). Murmu earlier served as Governor of Jharkhand from 2015 to 2021.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Rahul Gandhi leaves ED office after 10 hrs of questioning; 50 hrs in 5 days
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left the Enforcement Directorate's office in Delhi around 8 pm on Tuesday after the fifth day of questioning in connection with the National Herald case. As per reports, he was questioned for a period of at least 10 hours and was given a half-an-hour break. So far, Rahul has been questioned for nearly 50 hours.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Shiv Sena MLAs housed in Guj abducted by BJP, their lives in danger: Raut
text: After Shiv Sena removed Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde from its party post, party leader Sanjay Raut claimed that Sena MLAs, who are reportedly lodged at a hotel in Gujarat, have been abducted by BJP as part of 'Operation Lotus'. "The MLAs who tried to escape...were attacked. Some MLAs have conveyed to us that their lives are in danger," he added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Bengal Assembly passes another bill to make CM Chancellor of universities
text: The West Bengal Legislative Assembly passed the West Bengal University of Health Sciences Amendment Bill (2022) on Tuesday. The bill will also replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar with Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee as the Chancellor of all state-run universities. This comes after the state Legislative Assembly passed The West Bengal University Laws Amendment Bill (2022) on June 13.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: JD(S) MLA slaps K'taka college principal for avoiding questions; video surfaces
text: A video showing Janata Dal (Secular) MLA from Karnataka's Mandya Assembly constituency, M Srinivas, allegedly slapping a college principal in front of the latter's colleagues has surfaced online. As per reports, the alleged incident took place as the principal was not able to provide a clear answer to his questions about the ongoing development work for a computer lab.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: For 1st time preference given to tribal woman as Presidential candidate: Nadda
text: After the BJP-led NDA on Tuesday announced Draupadi Murmu's name as its Presidential candidate, BJP National President JP Nadda said, "For the first time, preference has been given to a woman tribal candidate." "Like Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, Draupadi Murmu has been associated with the field of education for a long time and has been a legislator and a minister," he added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Maharashtra Home Minister arrives at Sharad Pawar's house amid political crisis
text: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil arrived at NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai amid the political crisis. State ministers Jayant Patil and Balasaheb Patil also reached there. CM Uddhav Thackeray has called a cabinet meeting at 1 pm. Meanwhile, Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde, along with around 40 MLAs, reached Assam's Guwahati amid speculations of a rebellion.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Will send team: Police on missing report filed by Shiv Sena MLA's wife
text: Police in Maharashtra's Akola on Tuesday said they'll send a team to Gujarat's Surat to trace Shiv Sena MLA Nitin Deshmukh after his wife filed a missing complaint about him. As per reports, Deshmukh's wife told police that she suspects a threat to his life. Sena leader Sanjay Raut said the families of other Sena leaders have filed similar complaints.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Droupadi Murmu gets Z+ security cover after NDA declares her as Presidential candidate
text: After NDA announced former Jharkhand Governor Droupadi Murmu as their Presidential candidate, the Centre has provided round-the-clock Z+ category security cover for her by the armed Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF). The armed squad took over the security of Murmu, 64, early Wednesday morning, according to a PTI report. If elected, Murmu will be the first tribal President of India.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cong leaders' phones being tapped: Chhattisgarh Minister
text: Chhattisgarh Minister Ravindra Choubey on Tuesday alleged that telephonic conversations of Congress leaders are being tapped. Choubey asked ex-Chhattisgarh CM Raman Singh to clarify whether spyware software Pegasus was bought during his tenure. Accusing BJP of weakening democracy, he said, "Wherever we win elections, Union Minister Amit Shah will...form government by using...undemocratic means."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: PM wants soldiers to become 'chowkidar' after 4 yrs: Owaisi on Agnipath
text: Following BJP’s Kailash Vijayvargiya’s remark about prioritising 'Agniveers' for security of the party’s offices, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the BJP looks down upon such an honourable profession. "We want to know from PM [Modi], is this the respect you've for our soldiers? This means that he wants our soldiers to become a ‘chowkidar’ (watchman) after four years," Owaisi added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress govt responsible for deaths of freedom fighters: Goa CM
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant held the post-Independence Congress government responsible for the deaths of freedom fighters. He said that freedom fighters from across India came to fight the Portuguese to liberate Goa but the "then Congress government failed to protect them", which was "their responsibility". His remarks came at an event to lay the foundation stone for upgrading Martyrs Memorial.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Soldiers on border will be worried about their future: Tejashwi on Agnipath
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticised the Centre over the Agnipath scheme, calling it a "contracting practice". "Suppose the jawans are standing on the border. It must be running in their minds that what will they do after four years," said Yadav. "Will [Agniveers] work as watchmen for [PM] Modi ji or his close aides?" he asked.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray should resign: Ramdas Athawale
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has demanded the resignation of Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray. "Now that the Maha Vikas Aghadi government is in the minority...They have no right to stay in power," Athawale tweeted. His comment comes after Maharashtra Minister Eknath Shinde along with several MLAs moved to a hotel in Surat.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Post-poll violence in Bengal is a blot: Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar
text: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday criticised state government for its 'inaction' on curbing post-poll violence. "Post-poll violence is a blot on this land...Syndicate raj is there in every corner," he said. Notably, his comments come days after bills seeking his removal as Chancellor of state-run universities and visitor of private universities were passed in Legislative Assembly.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: 'Power hungry' BJP won't succeed in toppling govt in Maha: Rawat
text: Congress leader Harish Rawat took a jibe at BJP on Tuesday, saying that the power-hungry party can buy people to create instability, but won't succeed in toppling the government in Maharashtra. "Our alliance is with Shiv Sena, what's happening in their house is Shiv Sena's responsibility and Uddhav Thackeray will look into it," said Rawat.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Honoured: TMC as Sinha named Opp'n's candidate for Presidential poll
text: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said that they are honoured that ex-TMC leader and ex-Finance Minister Yashwant Sinha has been nominated by the unified Opposition as their candidate for the upcoming Presidential election. "We need to keep our differences aside. We've to find someone who'll act as...custodian of the Indian Constitution," he added. Earlier today, Sinha resigned from TMC.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: This will elevate tribal pride: Shah on Droupadi Murmu as Prez candidate
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday said that Droupadi Murmu's selection as NDA's Presidential candidate will elevate tribal people to newer heights. "For the first time, preference has been given to a woman tribal candidate," said BJP National President JP Nadda. The election will be held on July 18, ECI had announced.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Thane Police summon ex-BJP leader Naveen Jindal over Prophet remarks
text: Thane's Mumbra Police station on Tuesday served a notice to ex-BJP leader Naveen Kumar Jindal in connection with his alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad and asked him to join probe on June 25. The new case comes a week after Jindal failed to appear in front of Bhiwandi Police in Thane. Jindal was expelled from BJP on June 5.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP playing 'Operation Kamal' in states where there's oppn: HK Patil
text: Congress leader HK Patil criticised BJP over the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra and said that BJP is playing 'Operation Kamal' in all those states wherever there's Opposition. "I'm in touch with our leaders...Our Congress MLAs are intact, no reason to worry," Patil said. His comment comes after Eknath Shinde along with several MLAs moved to a Surat hotel today.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Bombay HC grants interim bail to student for online comments on Pawar
text: Bombay HC on Tuesday granted interim bail in two FIRs against 22-year-old student for his alleged derogatory comments online that were aimed at Nationalist Congress Party supremo Sharad Pawar. Multiple FIRs were registered against accused, Nikhil Bhamre, who was arrested last month from Nashik. "A student who has been in jail for over a month cannot be countenanced," HC said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Had only questioned those who use foul language for our gods: Naveen Jindal
text: Naveen Jindal, who was expelled from BJP after his remarks on Prophet, said he had only questioned people who “use foul language for our gods and goddesses”. "My statement was taken out of context. My intention was never to insult or hurt the religious sentiments of people of any religion," Jindal added. He was expelled from BJP on June 5.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong leader files complaint against Vijayvargiya over his remark on 'Agniveers'
text: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao filed a complaint against BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya for his remark about prioritising 'Agniveers' for "security in BJP office". The complaint was filed at Hyderabad’s Begum Bazar Police Station, Rao said. He termed Vijayvargiya’s remark insulting to the soldiers and Army. Rao said he has requested to arrest Vijayvargiya for his remark.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP in haste to dismantle Maha govt, but won't succeed: Nitin Raut
text: Amid the ongoing political crisis, Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said that BJP is in haste to dismantle the state government, but it won't succeed. "It's BJP's pattern to attempt to topple governments in Opposition-ruled states...be it using ED, CBI...that can be of help," he added. This comes as Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde moved to a Gujarat hotel on Monday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Yashwant Sinha to be Opposition's candidate for Presidential elections
text: Opposition parties have announced former Minister of Finance Yashwant Sinha as their candidate for the Presidential elections. Earlier today, Sinha resigned from TMC and said, "Now a time has come...for a larger national cause." On Monday, former West Bengal Governor Gopalkrishna Gandhi became the third person to withdraw his name as probable Opposition candidate for the Presidential polls.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Shiv Sena leaders meet Maha minister Eknath Shinde at Gujarat hotel
text: Shiv Sena leaders Milind Narvekar and Ravi Pathak on Tuesday met Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde at a hotel in Gujarat's Surat. Shinde and some other party MLAs are reportedly staying at Le Meridien hotel, where nearly 400 policemen have been deployed. Police have reportedly put barricades on entry and exit points to prevent unauthorised persons from entering the property.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: MVA govt will continue in Maha under CM Thackeray's leadership: Sharad Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has said the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government will continue in Maharashtra under the leadership of CM Uddhav Thackeray. "Plan to topple the government has been in works for 2.5 years," he added. Pawar on Tuesday called for an emergency meeting of top MVA leaders after BJP won five seats in the Maharashtra Legislative Council polls.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Shiv Sena removes Maha Minister Shinde from party post amid political crisis: Report
text: Shiv Sena on Tuesday reportedly removed Maharashtra Minister Eknath Shinde as its Legislative party leader after he and several MLAs were not reachable after suspected cross-voting in Maharashtra Legislative Council elections. Shinde and other MLAs are reportedly in Gujarat amid political crisis. "Sewri MLA Ajay Chaudhary to be the new Shiv Sena Legislative party leader," according to reports.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: We've no role in Maha political crisis, Sena's internal matter: State BJP chief
text: Commenting on Maharashtra political crisis, state BJP chief Chandrakant Patil said that BJP has no role in the crisis and added it is an internal matter of Shiv Sena. This comes after Sanjay Raut confirmed that several Sena MLAs and Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde were not reachable after the Legislative Council polls results. BJP won five seats in the polls.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: No question of going with BJP: Pawar on options if govt falls in Maha
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Tuesday said there is no question of going with BJP if the Maha Vikas Aghadi government falls in Maharashtra. On state Legislative Council poll results announced on Monday, he said cross-voting happens in such polls and there is nothing new in that. BJP won five of the 10 seats in the polls following suspected cross-voting
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Balasaheb taught us Hindutva, will never betray his ideals for power: Eknath Shinde
text: Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde, who along with several Shiv Sena MLAs moved to Surat hotel, on Tuesday tweeted, "We are Balasaheb's staunch Shiv Sainiks." He added, "Balasaheb has taught us Hindutva. We have never and will never cheat for power regarding Balasaheb's ideals and Dharmaveer Anand Dighe Saheb's teachings." This comes as Shinde was reportedly removed from Shiv Sena post.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cong appoints Kamal Nath as AICC observer to Maha amid political crisis
text: Congress has appointed senior party leader and former Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath as the AICC observer to handle the political crisis in Maharashtra. This comes after Maharashtra Minister Eknath Shinde and several Shiv Sena MLAs weren't reachable. As per reports, the Shiv Sena has removed Shinde as its Legislative party leader.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Every single pre-poll promise will be fulfilled in Punjab: AAP chief Kejriwal
text: Aam Aadmi Party's National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday assured that his party will fulfil every single pre-poll promise made to the people of Punjab, adding that work on some projects has already started. Though it'll take some time to clean the "mess" that the previous regimes had created, slowly they will make Punjab "rangla" (vibrant) once again, he said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Yoga increases spiritual power: Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal
text: On the occasion of International Yoga Day, Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal has said that Yoga increases spiritual power. The Minister of State for Parliamentary Affairs and Culture participated in a Yoga event organised by the National Institute of Ayurveda in Jaipur on Tuesday. "Yoga awareness rallies and other activities have also been held," said the institute's VC Sanjeev Sharma.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: If anything is good for BJP, it's fatal for country: Rahul on 'Agnipath'
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said anything which is "good" for BJP, it is "fatal" for the country. "Demonetisation, wrong GST, CAA, record inflation, record unemployment, black agricultural laws…and now the attack from 'Agnipath'," he tweeted. "Prime Minister, as a result of your 'benefits that improve with time', people of the country are suffering every day," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: There was unrest in Shiv Sena for over a week: NCP's Bhujbal
text: Maharashtra NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal claimed that there was unrest in Shiv Sena since over a week. His statement comes after several Shiv Sena MLAs, including state minister Eknath Shinde, became unreachable after suspected cross-voting in MLC election. However, Bhujbal said that he does not feel that there is a threat to the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP high on rage, ED under cage: Cong as Rahul questioned 5th day
text: As Congress leader Rahul Gandhi reached the ED office for the fifth round of questioning in the National Herald case, Congress accused the BJP-led government of a personal vendetta. Addressing a press conference, senior leader Abhishek Singhvi said, "The BJP is high on its rage, which is why it has made ED under its cage."
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Maha CM will keep all MLAs unified: Jayant Patil as Sena MLAs become unreachable
text: After Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde and some Shiv Sena MLAs were not reachable, NCP's Jayant Patil said he is confident that Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray will keep all MLAs unified. "All MLAs are in contact with us," he added. "I don't think Shiv Sainik will do something against Shiv Sena chief," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Agnipath scheme isn't in country's welfare: Chhattisgarh CM Baghel
text: Congress leader and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday said that the Centre's proposed Agnipath defence recruitment scheme is not in the country's welfare. He said, "Entire country is protesting against [the scheme], youth is angry. [The] scheme should be rolled back." Meanwhile, a petition has been filed in the Supreme Court against the 'Agnipath' scheme, terming it as "unconstitutional".
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: What BJP describes as good is fatal for country: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday claimed that what BJP describes as good is fatal for the country, adding that people are suffering because of PM Narendra Modi's reforms that will bring "benefits with time". "Demonetisation, wrong GST, CAA, record inflation, record unemployment, black agricultural laws and now the attack of Agnipath," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Govt is stable in Maha, it'll complete its full course: Pilot
text: Reacting to the ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said that he thinks the government is stable in Maharashtra, adding that it'll complete its full course. This comes as Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde and several other MLAs went unreachable after suspected cross-voting in MLC election. Shiv Sena has reportedly removed Shinde as its Legislative party leader.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP misusing its power: Maha Cong leader as Sena MLAs become unreachable
text: Maharashtra Congress leader Nana Patole alleged BJP's involvement in Shiv Sena MLAs, including state minister Eknath Shinde, becoming unreachable after suspected cross-voting in MLC election and said that BJP is misusing its power. "BJP is taking Indian democracy towards untruthfulness. I am sure the truth will win," Patole added. He also called meeting of all Maharashtra Congress leaders today.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: He'll return without any conditions: Raut as Shinde becomes unreachable
text: After confirming that Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde and some Shiv Sena MLAs are not reachable, party leader Sanjay Raut said Shinde will return without any conditions. "I know Eknath Shinde Ji, he's a true Shiv Sainik," Raut added. Shinde and others are reportedly in Surat. This comes after BJP won five of 10 seats in Maharashtra Legislative Council polls.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Our govt in Maha is stable, MLAs will return: Cong's DK Shivakumar
text: Congress leader DK Shivakumar on Tuesday reacted to ongoing political crisis in Maharashtra, stating that Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government is stable and that the absconding MLAs will return to the state. This comes as Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde along with several MLAs moved to a Surat hotel today. Shiv Sena has removed Shinde as its Legislative party leader.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Problems in Shiv Sena due to Raut's instigating statements: Patil
text: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil reacted to Shiv Sena MLAs, including state minister Eknath Shinde, going unreachable, saying, "Problems have cropped up in their party only due to instigating statements of Sanjay Raut." People won't tolerate this and Shinde's "rebellion is an example", he added. "[Shiv Sena leader Raut] doesn't need to speak harshly on every matter," he further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Shinde never conveyed to us that he wants to be CM: Sharad Pawar
text: Speaking on the ongoing Maharashtra political crisis, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Eknath Shinde has never conveyed to NCP that he wants to be CM. "Shiv Sena has the responsibility of CM and Deputy CM lies with NCP. This is an internal issue of Shiv Sena, we will go with whatever the leadership decides," he further added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP filing false complaints to stall work being done by AAP: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Tuesday accused the BJP of filing false complaints to stall the work being done by the Aam Aadmi Party in the national capital. His comments came following Lt Governor VK Saxena's nod to the Anti-Corruption Branch to probe allegations of irregularities in the construction of seven hospitals in Delhi during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Raut writing script of this rebellion: Maha BJP chief as Shinde goes unreachable
text: Soon after Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde is not reachable, Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil reacted to it. "When Nana Patole spoke about the Centre's intervention in Vidhan Parishad, I said a script needs to be prepared after loss...Similarly, Sanjay Raut is writing the script of this rebellion (Eknath Shinde’s)," Patil added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Shinde hasn't sent proposal to BJP for govt formation in Maha: Patil
text: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on Tuesday said neither state minister Eknath Shinde has sent a proposal to BJP for government formation nor the party has sent any proposal to him. "It's too early to say anything, we're currently waiting and keeping an eye on the situation," he added. Shiv Sena has reportedly removed Shinde as its Legislative party leader.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Industrial leaders should first employ retired soldiers: Akhilesh Yadav
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday urged industrial leaders to first employ retired defence personnel to win confidence of youth protesting against the Agnipath scheme. His comments came after industrial leaders like Anand Mahindra, Harsh Goenka and Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw backed the scheme. Yadav stated that he will send them a list of retired soldiers for employment.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Political storm that has hit Maha will calm down: NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal
text: A storm has come up in Maharashtra's politics, said Maharashtra Minister and NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal after Maharashtra Minister Eknath Shinde along with several MLAs moved to a Surat hotel on Tuesday. "If a storm comes, then it'll calm down and recede as well," Bhujbal said. "In the coming days, the situation will become normal again," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP wins 5 seats and NCP, Shiv Sena 2 each in Maha Legislative Council polls
text: At least five BJP candidates and two leaders each from the Shiv Sena and NCP were declared winners in the Maharashtra Legislative Council elections. The winners include BJP candidates Pravin Darekar, Ram Shinde, Shrikant Bharatiya, Uma Khapre and Prasad Lad, NCP's Eknath Khadse and Ramraje Naik Nimbalkar and Shiv Sena's Aamshya Phulji Padvi and Sachin Ahir.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Sonia Gandhi discharged from hospital, faces ED questioning
text: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Monday informed that Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has been discharged from Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi, adding that she has been advised to take rest. The leader was hospitalised on June 12 over COVID-19 related issues. Earlier, ED issued fresh summons to her to appear before it for questioning on June 23.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Some decisions seem unfair but they help in building nation: PM amid protests
text: Amid ongoing protests against Agnipath scheme, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said, "Several decisions look unfair at present. In time, those decisions will help in building the nation." "The path of reforms will take us to new milestones," he added during a public address in Bengaluru. The PM, however, made no direct reference to the scheme during his speech.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde, several Shiv Sena MLAs not reachable
text: Shiv Sena, which heads the Maha Vikas Aghadi government in Maharashtra, faces the danger of a split as Urban Development Minister Eknath Shinde and several MLAs are not reachable, confirmed party leader Sanjay Raut. They are reportedly in Surat. This comes after the BJP won five of the 10 seats in the Maharashtra Legislative Council elections following suspected cross-voting.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bengal Assembly passes motion condemning Nupur Sharma's remarks
text: The West Bengal Assembly on Monday passed a motion condemning the controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leader Nupur Sharma. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said in the Assembly, "I strongly condemn the remarks made by certain leaders. Those were part of a greater design to spread hatred among communities ahead of Lok Sabha polls."
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa granted bail in corruption case
text: A Bengaluru court has granted bail to veteran BJP leader and former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa in a corruption case. "In his bail application, the accused BS Yediyurappa, has further denied the commission of offence for which he has been summoned and has also offered justification for his actions that are subject of this criminal proceedings," the complainant's advocate stated.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: We are in touch with our MLAs who are in Surat: Shiv Sena
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that the party is in touch with its MLAs who are in Surat. This comes after Raut confirmed that several Sena MLAs and Maharashtra minister Eknath Shinde were not reachable after the results of the Legislative Council polls. Raut added, "We are discussing the situation with Uddhav Thackeray ji and Pawar Sahib."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: EC to delete 111 'non-existent' parties from register
text: The Election Commission (EC) on Monday decided to delete 111 political parties from its register that were found to be "non-existent" during a verification exercise. Any registered unrecognised political party (RUPP) aggrieved by the decision can approach the CEO concerned within 30 days, the EC said. Earlier this month, the EC had deleted 87 such political parties from its register.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Using abusive language against PM in Cong’s DNA: J'khand BJP chief
text: Jharkhand BJP chief Deepak Prakash condemned Congress leader Subodh Kant Sahai’s 'Hitler' remark against PM Narendra Modi. "If Modi walks on the path of Hitler, he will die like Hitler," Sahai had said. Reacting to this, Prakash said that using "abusive language" against PM Modi is in Congress' DNA. Furthermore, he said that Sahai is speaking out of "desperation".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Delhi AAP leader's use of kids in bypoll campaign illegal: Rights body
text: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has written to Delhi Police asking to take legal action against AAP's Rajinder Nagar bypoll candidate Durgesh Pathak over allegations that minors were roped in during campaigning. The child rights body has also written to Chief Election Commissioner on the matter, alleging violation of election code by the AAP leader.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP running fair & lovely scheme through agencies like ED, CBI: Cong
text: Congress on Monday criticised the Centre, saying it was running a "fair and lovely scheme" through probe agencies like ED and CBI wherein opposition leaders "become clean" after joining the BJP. "They ask politicians to stop speaking against the government and if they agree, the cream is applied on them and they become clean," AICC general secretary Ajay Maken said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Agnipath 'pro-youth', opposing it not in interest of youngsters: Pradhan
text: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Monday called the Agnipath recruitment scheme 'pro-youth' and said that opposing the scheme is not in the interest of the country's youngsters. He further urged the party cadre to remain vigilant against the "evil designs" of the opposition parties, which were "bent on exploiting the youngsters against the ruling party".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Character of armed forces under question: Khurshid on 'Agnipath'
text: Amid protests over the 'Agnipath' scheme, Congress leader Salman Khurshid said, "It’s our duty to present their tears and cause of their sorrow before the nation." "This is now not only a matter of the youth but the character of the armed forces is also under question. It is a matter of grave concern for us," Khurshid added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong members plan protest against PM Modi in Bengaluru; detained
text: Over 30 Congress members, who planned to stage a protest against PM Narendra Modi during his Bengaluru visit, were detained on Monday. The members of Congress Kisan Cell, including its President, Sachin Migha, were taken into custody in Chikkamagaluru. They are said to have planned to gherao the Yelahanka Air Force base, where PM was set to land.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Stopped from entering main market due to AAP's roadshow: Punjab Cong
text: The Punjab Congress alleged that the party workers were stopped from entering Barnala market area for roadshow as AAP was going to have roadshow in the area after three hours. Police not only didn't allow us to use that route, the common man, too, was put to inconvenience, Congress said. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal was also part of the roadshow.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: MVA govt couldn't do anything in public interest: BJP MLC Pravin Darekar
text: BJP MLC Pravin Darekar on Tuesday, while reacting to the Maharashtra Legislative Council elections, said the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government couldn't do anything in public interest. "People and public representatives are dissatisfied," Darekar said. He further claimed that the BJP can stake claims to form the government in the state if that is in interest of the people.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Jihadis behind violence in Bihar, JD(U) added fuel to fire: BJP MLA
text: Jihadis against PM Narendra Modi were against the violence that took place in Bihar against the proposed 'Agnipath' scheme, which was fuelled by "big leaders" of CM Nitish Kumar's JD(U), said BJP MLA Harishbhushan Thakur. He further took a jibe at JD(U), adding that it has no connection with the masses and would "vanish after the demise of Nitish Kumar".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Ask Abbas if Nupur’s comment on Prophet was right: Owaisi to PM
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi and said that he should ask his childhood friend 'Abbas' if BJP leader Nupur Sharma's comment on Prophet Muhammad is objectionable or not. He further said that PM Modi should call his friend Abbas and ask him "whether the speeches of Asaduddin Owaisi and Ulemas are true?"
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Apologise to PM Modi, country: Thakur to Cong over Sahai's 'Hitler' remark
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur asked Congress to take strict action against its leader Subodh Kant Sahai for his remarks against PM Narendra Modi and said that the party should apologise to the nation and PM. On Monday, Sahai said that PM Modi is behaving like Adolf Hitler and "will die like Hitler" if he follows path of the German dictator.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Italy's Cong party with bailed leaders perturbed: Raghubar Das on 'Hitler' remark
text: BJP leader Raghubar Das reacted to Congress’ Subodh Kant Sahai’s statement that "If PM Narendra Modi follows Hitler’s path, he will die like Hitler." "Italy's Congress party with its jailed and bailed leaders is perturbed. In 50 years they looted," Das added. "Auditing is being done today so they're using unparliamentary language," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre working to improve connectivity, make B'luru jam-free: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi during his Karnataka visit said that the central government is working on every possible means to make Bengaluru free from traffic jams and is committed to linking the suburban areas of the capital with better connectivity. "I have got the opportunity to complete the development works which should have been done 40 years ago," PM added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: I stand with concerns of youth desirous of joining armed forces: Manish Tewari
text: Amid protests over the 'Agnipath’ scheme, Congress leader Manish Tewari on Monday said that as an MP from a rural constituency, he stands with concerns/fears of youth desirous of joining the armed forces. "Politics apart-Rough calculation of impact of new recruitment paradigms on even largest employer Army shows issue not insurmountable if retirees are transitioned to CAPFs/SPFs," Tewari tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 'Agnipath' protestors are anti-national, have 'Jihadi' mentality: BJP MLA
text: BJP MLA Hari Bhushan Thakur on Monday said that people who are "anti-national" and have a "Jihadi" mentality are protesting against the 'Agnipath' scheme. "It's not a job (serving in Army)," Thakur added. People waste money buying useless degrees, whereas, in the 'Agnipath' scheme, they will get training, four years of service and reservation afterwards, he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: India is now deal maker, not deal-breaker: Piyush Goyal
text: Today the world accepts that India has shown leadership in the WTO in taking good decisions keeping in view the concerns of other countries, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. "India's position on issues is backed by facts, truth and sensitivity. India is now a deal maker, not a deal-breaker," he added. "India has sufficient manufacturing and technology," Goyal stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Supriya Shrinate appointed as Congress' new social media head
text: The Congress party appointed Supriya Shrinate as Chairperson of the Social Media and Digital Platforms in its Communications Department. Shrinate, a former journalist, replaces Rohan Gupta, who has now been appointed as the party spokesperson. The changes come after the party formed a new communications department and appointed Jairam Ramesh as its General Secretary in-charge.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Ashamed: Uma Bharti on seeing saffron flag outside MP liquor shop
text: BJP leader Uma Bharti on Monday tweeted that she was "sad and ashamed" after seeing a saffron flag outside a liquor shop in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara. Bharti, who was coming back after visiting a temple, got down from her car on seeing the flag and left after police removed it. "I've asked police and administration to take action," she said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Kejriwal, Mann hold roadshow in Punjab's Sangrur ahead of bypolls
text: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal held a roadshow with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann in Punjab's Sangrur on Monday ahead of upcoming Lok Sabha bypolls there. The leaders were accompanied by the party's candidate from Sangrur, Gurmail Singh. Bypolls in Sangrur were necessitated after CM Bhagwant Mann vacated the seat to take over as Dhuri's MLA following state legislative Assembly elections.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Mahatma Gandhi's grandson Gopalkrishna refuses to be Opp'n's Presidential candidate
text: Gopalkrishna Gandhi, former West Bengal Governor and Mahatma Gandhi's grandson, declined Opposition parties' request to become their candidate for the upcoming Presidential election. "I see that the Opposition's candidate should be one who'll generate a national consensus and a national atmosphere beside Opposition unity. I feel there will be others who will do this far better than I," he stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Tripura Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman attacked, party blames BJP
text: Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman was hospitalised after he was allegedly attacked with bricks by a group of people in Tripura's Agartala, police said on Monday. The incident occurred when Barman, who is contesting in the upcoming state Assembly bypolls, was visiting a party worker's house, a police officer said. Tripura Congress claimed that BJP workers had "brutally attacked" Barman.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: 3 Cong MLAs among 50 detained at Delhi border amid Agnipath protests
text: Over 50 people, including three Congress MLAs, were on Monday detained along the Singhu border between Delhi and Haryana amid protests against the Centre's Agnipath scheme. Congress MP Deepender S Hooda said Haryana Congress MLAs and leaders were on their way to take part in a peaceful protest demonstration. "Restriction on public expression is unacceptable in a democracy," Hooda added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: If Modi follows Hitler's path, he'll die like Hitler: Congress leader
text: Congress leader and former Union Minister Subodh Kant Sahai while taking part in 'Satyagraha' protest against the 'Agnipath' scheme in Delhi said, "If PM Narendra Modi follows Hitler's path, he will die like Hitler, remember this." He added, "This is a government of looters." However, Congress said it doesn't endorse any indecent remarks against the Prime Minister.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Rahul should know that ED isn't 'Entitlement Demand': Sambit Patra
text: BJP leader Sambit Patra reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi being questioned by Enforcement Directorate (ED), saying, "No one is Queen Victoria or Prince in this country that they won't be probed." He added that Rahul should know that "ED isn't 'Entitlement Demand'". This comes as Rahul reached the ED office today for questioning in the National Herald case.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: 'Agnipath' is a plan to bring Army under RSS' control: Ex-K'taka CM
text: The Centre's 'Agnipath' scheme is a plan to bring the Army under the control of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), said former Karnataka Chief Minister HD Kumaraswamy. "Some youths have been trained by the RSS and maintained as workers. Is [Agnipath] a plan to provide them employment in the Army?" Kumaraswamy asked. "This is like Hitler's Nazi agenda," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Villain for 'Agnipath': Mahua Moitra on Vijayvargiya's remark on 'Agniveers'
text: TMC leader Mahua Moitra reacted to BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya’s remark about prioritising 'Agniveers' for "security in BJP office". "BJP National General Secretary: If I have to choose security guard for BJP office I will choose 'Agniveer(s)'. Yes, if India had to choose a villain for 'Agnipath', [I] am sure they’d choose you too," Moitra tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Youth Cong workers stop train at Delhi's Shivaji Bridge station
text: Workers of the Indian Youth Congress reportedly stopped a train and blocked track at Delhi's Shivaji Bridge railway station on Monday. They are protesting against Centre's Agnipath scheme and ED's summons to party leader Rahul Gandhi. The security has also been ramped up at Hazrat Nizamuddin station in view of calls for Bharat Bandh over Agnipath scheme.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Why are PM, Home Minister quiet on 'Agnipath' scheme?: Kharge
text: Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday asked, "Why are the Prime Minister, Home Minister and Defence Minister quiet on the 'Agnipath' scheme?" "For the first time in 75 years, service chiefs are being fronted to defend a policy decision by the government," Kharge tweeted. His remark came amid protests against the new scheme.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Most youth welcomed Agnipath scheme; protestors being misguided: CM Dhami
text: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has said that the majority of the country's youth have "welcomed" the Agnipath scheme while those who are protesting are being "misguided". "It is our responsibility to make our youth aware of the correct facts of the Agnipath scheme. Our youth are being misguided and being taken in the wrong direction," CM Dhami said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Congress using youth for vested interests: Sambit Patra amid 'Agnipath' protests
text: Amid protests against the 'Agnipath' scheme, BJP leader Sambit Patra said that the Opposition is habitual of maligning forces. "Congress is using youth for vested interests," Patra added. His statement came in reaction to Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi’s remark saying that the 'Agnipath' scheme will "kill the youth of the country and finish the Army".
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Why are BJP & JD(U) together when they have many problems: Tejashwi
text: Amid protests in Bihar over the new military recruitment model 'Agnipath', RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav questioned why the BJP and JD(U) are in an alliance when the parties have "so many problems". Yadav made these remarks after BJP blamed the state government for being unable to curb protests over the scheme. "Centre never consults experts and coerces...schemes," he said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Delhi govt refused funds, PM stepped in: Goyal on Pragati Maidan tunnel project
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday said the Delhi government had refused to pay its 20% share in funds for the Pragati Maidan tunnel construction, risking stalling the project. "PM Narendra Modi said that the central government will bear the project's entire cost," Goyal said. "I give the credit of completing the project on time to the PM," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bail granted to Bhim Sena Chief arrested for threatening Nupur Sharma
text: A Delhi court has granted bail to Bhim Sena chief Nawab Satpal Tanwar, arrested for allegedly threatening suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad. The police said that Tanwar had posted a video in which he announced a bounty of ₹1 crore on Sharma for her remarks and was trying to incite communal disharmony.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Youth not meant to be doorkeepers of BJP offices: TMC on Vijayvargiya's remark
text: Following BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya’s remark about prioritising 'Agniveers' for "security in the BJP office", TMC said the youth of India is not meant to be "doorkeepers" of BJP offices. "The young power wants to serve this nation, unlike the (PM) Modi-led government. The PM should clarify whether these are also comments by 'fringe' elements," All India Trinamool Congress tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP wants to make its armed cadre base through 'Agnipath': Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday alleged that BJP is trying to create its own "armed" cadre base through the new military recruitment programme 'Agnipath'. "[BJP] wants to give arms into the hands of the youth," Banerjee said, adding that the scheme is an insult to the armed forces. 'Agnipath' will employ aspirants in armed forces for four years.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP meant this by 'Main Bhi Chowkidaar': Jairam on BJP leader's statement
text: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh commented on BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya's statement of preferring to employ an Agniveer for security at the BJP's office. "Now we know what the BJP really meant when they launched the campaign in 2019, 'Main Bhi Chowkidaar'..." Ramesh tweeted. Notably, protests against the Centre's Agnipath scheme have been held across the nation.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Cong has turned into old currency notes, they're of no use: Assam CM
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that Congress has turned into old currency notes, adding the country moved in the reverse direction for 75 years because of the "non-performance" of the party. He further said that the northeastern region, which "barely saw development" under Congress rule, is marching towards prosperity under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Cong left with only history but no future, BJP spews poison: KTR
text: TRS leader KT Rama Rao said on Saturday that people had given Congress "10 chances" to prove itself but the party had instead ruined Telangana and the country. "Congress...is left with history but there is no future to it...[while] BJP...leaders are spewing poison whenever they speak," he added. Telangana will head to the polls for Assembly elections in 2023.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: All BJP leaders begin & end their talks with a lie: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said that all BJP leaders, including UP CM Yogi Adityanath, begin and end their talks with a lie. His statements came following Adityanath's remark, where he alleged that Yadav betrayed the people of Azamgarh and obstructed its development and supported criminals. "BJP always ignored Azamgarh and defamed it," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM’s silence is stamp on this insult: Rahul on Vijayvargiya’s remark
text: Following BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya’s remark about prioritising 'Agniveers' for the security of the party’s offices, Congress' Rahul Gandhi said that PM Narendra Modi’s silence is a stamp on this insult. "Those who did not hoist the tricolour for 52 years after independence cannot be expected to respect our soldiers," Gandhi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: We'll meet President & demand for withdrawal of 'Agnipath’ scheme: Ajay Maken
text: Congress leader Ajay Maken on Monday said that the party will meet the President and demand that the 'Agnipath' scheme should be withdrawn. "We'll sit on 'Satyagraha' at Jantar Mantar today," Maken added. "The scheme should first be discussed with the youth and in the Parliament but before that, it should be withdrawn," Maken stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: After training youth will hold guns, there'd be bloodshed: Cong MLA on 'Agnipath'
text: Amid protests over the 'Agnipath' scheme, Congress MLA Irfan Ansari said after training of four years, the youth will "hold guns" and there would be "bloodshed" in the country. Several states across the country have been witnessing protests since the scheme was announced by the Centre. Congress on Monday held a 'Satyagraha' at Jantar Mantar in Delhi, against 'Agnipath' scheme.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP arresting Congress leaders to instill fear: Punjab Oppn leader
text: Leader of Opposition in Punjab Assembly Partap Singh Bajwa in a recent interview said that AAP is trying to instill "fear psychosis" among Congress leaders in state by arresting them.
