His comments come amid recent arrests of Congress' Sadhu Singh Dharamsot and Joginder Pal in corruption and illegal mining cases. Congress' Sangat Singh Gilzian was also booked for alleged corruption.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Cyber security is integral to national security; will make it robust: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that "cyber security is integral to the national security". "We all know how important is cyber security and how it can contribute to the development of India. India's progress is not possible without cyber security," Shah said. He added, "The Modi government is committed to making it (cyber security) robust."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: No one's Queen Victoria, Prince: Patra on Cong protesting against ED's questioning
text: BJP leader Sambit Patra said no one is "Queen Victoria or Prince" in this country that they won’t be probed. His statement came following Congress' protests over ED’s questioning of Rahul Gandhi. "Everyone is probed for corruption…Public knows about the involvement of a family and Rahul Gandhi's role in misusing the country's money through the National Herald scam," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong holds 'Satyagraha' at Jantar Mantar over Agnipath, ED summons to Rahul
text: Several Congress leaders, including Mallikarjun Kharge, Salman Khurshid, Harish Rawat, K Suresh and V Narayanasamy, staged a 'Satyagraha' agitation at Jantar Mantar in Delhi over the Agnipath scheme and ED summons to former party chief Rahul Gandhi. In a Twitter post, the party said that the government is forcing youth on the 'Agnipath' of unemployment.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Rajasthan passes resolution seeking withdrawal of Agnipath scheme
text: The Rajasthan Council of Ministers on Saturday passed a resolution demanding the withdrawal of the Centre's Agnipath recruitment scheme, "keeping in mind the larger public interest and the sentiments of youths". According to an official release, the resolution was passed unanimously during a meeting held at Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot's residence in Jaipur.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: After Sharad Pawar, Farooq Abdullah refuses to be Presidential candidate for Opp'n
text: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah has declined to be the joint Opposition's Presidential candidate, days after Sharad Pawar declined the proposal. "I'm...honoured to have been considered for the highest office in the country," said Abdullah. He added, "I believe that J&K is passing through a critical juncture and my efforts are required to help navigate these uncertain times."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Cong holds 'Satyagraha' at Jantar Mantar over Agnipath, security tightened
text: The Congress party is holding a 'Satyagraha' agitation against the Agnipath scheme at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi. The security was tightened with police and Rapid Action Force personnel being deployed. The party said that the BJP has conspired to destroy the future of the country's youth. Violent protests have broken out across the country over the Centre's scheme.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: If I want to keep office security, I'll give priority to Agniveers: Senior BJP leader
text: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Sunday said, "If I want to keep security in BJP office, I will give priority to Agniveers." Vijayvargiya later tweeted, "Agniveers will definitely be trained and committed to duty, their excellence will be utilised in whatever field they will go after completing their service in the Army. That is clearly what I meant."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: How many houses will be bulldozed now: Owaisi after Agnipath protests
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has criticised the Centre and police force over the alleged difference in treatment towards those protesting against Agnipath scheme compared to those who recently protested against remarks on Prophet Muhammad. "The youth are on the streets because of [PM Narendra] Modi's wrong decision...How many of their houses will you demolish with bulldozers now?" Owaisi asked.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 'Agnipath' scheme will kill youth of country, finish Army: Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday criticised the Centre for its proposed Agnipath scheme, claiming that it will kill the youth of the country and will finish the Army. "Please see the intent of this government and topple it. Bring a government that is true to the nation and protects the country's assets," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Is this MGNREGA-like step or hidden agenda of RSS: Tejashwi on Agnipath
text: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has raised several questions on the Centre's Agnipath scheme. He asked whether the scheme is an MGNREGA-like step or a "hidden agenda" of the RSS. "Protests are taking place across the country and there is anger among those who want to become soldiers," Yadav said while posing 20 questions to the government about the scheme.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Hold peaceful protests but don’t stop: Priyanka Gandhi at 'Agnipath' sit-in
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Sunday urged the protestors to protest peacefully against the 'Agnipath' scheme but also asked them not to stop agitating. "This scheme will kill youth of the country, will finish Army...Please see the intent of this government and topple it," Priyanka added. She addressed the Congress' 'Satyagrah' against the 'Agnipath' scheme at Jantar Mantar in Delhi.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Fight polls till age of 90 but youth should retire at 21: Punjab CM on 'Agnipath'
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said it’s a "bad joke" with the youth that they should retire at the age of 21 and become ex-servicemen but political leaders keep fighting polls even at the age of 90. His statement comes amid protests against the 'Agnipath' armed forces recruitment scheme. He added that this "black" scheme should be rolled back.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ensure legitimate space for Oppn's viewpoint: Adhir Ranjan to PM
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote to PM Narendra Modi, saying that the Centre is not "giving due respect" to the Opposition’s opinion. His statement comes following protests by Congress workers and leaders against the ED’s questioning of Rahul Gandhi. "For a healthy democracy, you should ensure due and legitimate space for the Opposition's viewpoint as well," Chowdhury added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Urge anti-Agnipath protestors to maintain peace: Himachal CM
text: Amid the ongoing protests over the Centre's Agnipath scheme, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur has urged everyone to "maintain peace". "I request to the youth that where the whole country has congratulated this decision and job opportunities...will be available through this medium," CM Thakur said. He added that the opposition is trying to take this "issue in a different direction".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Assure only what you can deliver: Uddhav Thackeray to Centre on Agnipath
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has criticised the Centre's Agnipath scheme. "You (Centre) must assure only what you can deliver," CM Thackeray said. "Why give names like 'Agniveer' and 'Agnipath' to schemes which have no meaning? What will the youth aged 17 to 21 years get after four years?" he asked. CM Thackeray added that "having soldiers on contracts is dangerous".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Don’t disrespect soldiers: Kejriwal on BJP leader’s remarks on ‘Agniveers’
text: Following BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya’s remark on prioritising ‘Agniveers’ for security of party’s offices, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked the BJP leader not to “disrespect” the youth and the Army personnel of this country. The country’s youth works hard as they want to serve the country, not because they want to join as guards for the BJP office, Kejriwal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nupur Sharma will be made big leader in coming 6-7 months: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma will be made a big leader in the coming six to seven months. "Nupur Sharma should be arrested and action should be taken against her according to the law of India," he added. Furthermore, he said it is also possible that Sharma will be made the Delhi CM candidate.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi forcing youth to walk on 'Agnipath' of unemployment: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday claimed that PM Narendra Modi has forced the youth to walk on 'Agnipath' of unemployment by repeatedly giving false hopes of jobs. "In eight years, 16 crore jobs were to be given, but the youth only got knowledge on frying pakoras," Rahul said. PM is responsible for this condition of the country, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Many things done with good intention get caught in colour of politics: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that several things done with good intention get "caught in the colour of politics". PM added that he had the opportunity to inaugurate the Defence Complex last year. "It's the misfortune of our country that many good things, things done with good intention, get caught in the colour of politics," PM added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Youth plagued with Agnipath of poverty, inflation & tension: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Sunday said that at a time when the youth is plagued with 'Agnipath' of poverty, inflation and tension, the government's announcement of a limited defence recruitment scheme has made them disappointed. "I would request the Centre to spare a serious thought for the aggrieved youths of the country and reconsider its decision," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Not appropriate to strike first, think later: Varun Gandhi on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: BJP MP Varun Gandhi said it’s not appropriate for a sensitive government to "strike first and think later" when it comes to the armed forces, security and youth’s future. "The amendments made within a few hours of the launch of 'Agnipath' scheme show that perhaps all the points were not taken into account while planning," Varun tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP govt spent ₹24 cr on ads, trying to mislead Punjabis: Badal
text: SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal said the AAP-led Punjab government spent over ₹24 crore on advertisements in one month, trying to "mislead Punjabis with propaganda" to cover up its "abysmal performance". "The AAP government has also taken a loan of ₹9,000 crore during the last three months but has nothing to show," Badal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Final round of parliamentary elections underway in France
text: The French are voting in the final round of parliamentary elections on Sunday. President Emmanuel Macron is seeking a majority in the 577-member National Assembly. In the previous round, Macron's alliance narrowly edged out the rival group led by leader Jean-Luc Melenchon. Ahead of polls, Macron warned voters that a hung parliament would put the nation in danger.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: 'Agnipath’ has been rejected by retired army officers: Rajasthan CM
text: Congress on Sunday took out a 'Tiranga Yatra' in Rajasthan's Jaipur to demand a rollback on the 'Agnipath' military recruitment model. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, who participated in the protest, called the scheme a "hasty" decision and stated that the model has been rejected by retired army officers. "Modi government is against all sections...Congress...is standing with the youth," he said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Last 3 yrs historical in terms of discussions in Parliament: Om Birla
text: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said last three years were historical in terms of productivity and discussions held in Parliament. "I thank PM and all MPs for their cooperation which has increased public's faith in public representatives and Parliament," Birla added. "COVID-19 was big challenge for all of us. We followed maximum health protocols to ensure everyone's safety," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Bihar bearing brunt of JD(U)-BJP conflict: Prashant Kishor on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: Following protests against the 'Agnipath' scheme, poll strategist Prashant Kishor said the people of Bihar are bearing the brunt of the conflict between JD(U) and BJP. "There should be agitation against 'Agnipath', not violence and sabotage…Bihar is burning and leaders of both the parties are busy sparring and pointing fingers at each other instead of solving the matter," Kishor tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong MP Jothimani hospitalised, was beaten up by Delhi Police: Adhir Ranjan
text: Senior Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that his party colleague and Tamil Nadu Congress MP S Jothimani has been hospitalised at the RML Hospital in New Delhi. Chowdhury claimed that Jothimani was hospitalised due to allegedly being beaten up by the Delhi Police during the party-led protest against the Enforcement Directorate's questioning of senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Amid Agnipath protests, Rahul asks workers not to celebrate his birthday today
text: Amid the ongoing protests over the Agnipath scheme across the country, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has appealed to his party workers not to celebrate his birthday on Sunday. Rahul, who turned 52 today, said, "We are concerned with the situation in the country. Crores of youths are anguished. We should share the pain of the youth and their families."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Recognise 'fake' nationalists, country is with you: Priyanka Gandhi
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday assured her party's full support to the youth protesting peacefully against the proposed Agnipath scheme and urged them to recognise "fake nationalists". She also quoted lines from Harivansh Rai Bachchan's Hindi poem 'Agnipath' to urge the youth to persevere and keep protesting peacefully. "There is no bigger patriot than you," she added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Have faith in PM: Nadda to youth protesting against 'Agnipath'
text: Amid the nationwide protests against the Agnipath scheme, BJP chief JP Nadda called the recruitment programme revolutionary and appealed to the youth to understand the scheme thoroughly. Speaking to a gathering in Karnataka, he said, "I know that efforts are being made to mislead the youth...But I want to tell them to have faith in PM Narendra Modi."
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Sonia Gandhi developed profuse nose bleeding, has respiratory tract infection: Congress
text: In a health update on Congress President Sonia Gandhi, the party said, she was admitted to Delhi's Sir Ganga Ram Hospital after "profuse bleeding from the nose following a recent COVID-19 infection". "A fungal infection in her lower respiratory tract was also detected upon admission. She is currently being treated for it along with other post-COVID symptoms," the Congress added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Completely directionless: Sonia Gandhi on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Saturday said that the party will stand with the people protesting against the 'Agnipath' armed forces recruitment scheme. She added that she is "sad" that the Centre "ignored people's voices" and announced the new recruitment scheme, which is "completely directionless". Furthermore, she also appealed to the people "to protest peacefully in a non-violent manner".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Rahul seeks time from ED probe citing Sonia's health, next summon on Monday
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) will question Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the National Herald case on June 20 (Monday). Earlier, Rahul was summoned by the probe agency on Friday, but he had requested the ED to defer his questioning to June 20 citing his mother Sonia Gandhi's health. Sonia has been admitted to a hospital over COVID-related complications.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Ex-Congress MLA Joginder Pal arrested for illegal mining in Punjab
text: Former Congress MLA Joginder Pal was arrested by Punjab's Pathankot Police on Friday in connection to an illegal mining case. Earlier, police found people carrying out illegal mining using a JCB machine, registered under Krishna Washed Stone Crusher, near a village, SSP Arun Saini said. During investigations, it was found that Pal has 50% share in this firm, he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Video shows Cong's Renuka grabbing Hyd policeman's collar; later says 'my hand slipped'
text: A video showing Congress leader Renuka Chowdhury grabbing a policeman's collar during a protest in Hyderabad surfaced online. A woman officer could be seen removing Chowdhury's hand. Chowdhury later clarified it wasn't her intention to humiliate the policeman, adding, "I was losing my balance and reached to hold his shoulder. My hand slipped and I held on to his collar."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Nupur Sharma untraceable for the last 4 days, Mumbai Police searching: Reports
text: Mumbai Police have been unable to trace suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma in Delhi, reports said on Friday. The team sent to serve notice to Sharma has been searching for her for the past four days, Mumbai Police said as per a Hindustan Times report. She was summoned to appear before Mumbai Police over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP leader from Bihar's Munger kills self after killing wife
text: Police said that a BJP leader allegedly shot his wife dead after an argument and later died by suicide in Bihar's Munger. The deceased were identified as Arun Yadav, who was Munger district Vice President of the BJP OBC Morcha and his wife Preeti Kumari. Police broke open the door and recovered their bodies, Munger SP said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP wants to erase memories of Nehru, Indira Gandhi: Shiv Sena
text: The Shiv Sena on Thursday claimed that the BJP wants to erase the memories of late Congress leaders Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi and Rajiv Gandhi. "It (BJP)...wants to destroy prospects of the Nehru-Gandhi lineage," stated Shiv Sena in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'. While criticising Rahul Gandhi's questioning by ED, Shiv Sena further accused the BJP of showing "arrogance of power".
author: Shiwangi

headlines: List of corrupt politicians ready, action will be taken soon: Punjab CM
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said his government has prepared a list of corrupt politicians and action will be taken against them soon. "We have lodged many inside jails and some are waiting for their turn," Mann said. "They have eaten your tax money. It'll be refunded from them and spent on you," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: PM Modi has to take Agnipath scheme back, the way it revoked farm laws: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Friday said PM Modi will have to take the Agnipath scheme back the way he revoked the land and farm laws. "[It's] absolutely wrong decision...it's not good for...country at all," Owaisi said. "PM Modi thinks that our Navy officers and soldiers are contractual employees or contractual lecturers, but their profession is honourable," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: BMC most corrupt civic body in Asia: Ex-Congress MP Deora
text: Former Mumbai Congress chief Milind Deora on Thursday called the BMC "Asia's most corrupt civic body". He further said that the Congress must expose BMC's misgovernance and bring them to account. "We owe this to everyday Mumbaikars," Deora tweeted while responding to a video on BMC's poor drainage management. His comments come ahead of the BMC polls scheduled for September-October.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Opposition misleading students on 'Agnipath' scheme: Bihar Dy CM
text: Bihar Deputy CM Renu Devi on Friday said the Opposition is "misleading" students on the 'Agnipath' scheme. Her comment comes after protests against the scheme turned violent in Bihar. "Once four years are over, 'Agniveers' will be having a ₹12 lakh economic package to start afresh. Priority will be given to them for loans, educational courses and CAPF," she said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Agnipath scheme being imposed on youth in hurry, withdraw it: Priyanka
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi has accused the BJP-led Centre of imposing the 'Agnipath' scheme on the country's youth in a "hurry". "Not even 24 hours have passed within which the BJP government had to change the rules of new army recruitment scheme...PM Narendra Modi ji, please withdraw this scheme immediately," Priyanka said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Not people, politicians creating unrest in Bengal: Mamata Banerjee
text: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee alleged that not people but politicians are creating unrest in West Bengal over ex-BJP spokesperson's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "Violence is not being created by people of any religion but by...politicians whose minds are like dustbins," Banerjee said. "No one raises...question when I go to...gurdwara...why raise questions when I go to...mosque," she added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Act of revenge by Centre: Gehlot on CBI raid at brother's home
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has alleged the CBI raids at his brother Agrasen's residence on Friday are connected with his participation in the protests against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's questioning by the ED. "Why is the revenge of my participation in the protests being taken on my brother?" CM Gehlot asked. "This is vendetta politics beyond all bounds," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP goons attacked our workers: TMC to CEC ahead of Tripura bypolls
text: Ahead of Tripura Assembly bypolls, a TMC delegation met Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) on Thursday in Delhi and submitted memorandum alleging that "BJP-sponsored goons" had attacked TMC workers in the state. "About 70 families who'd joined TMC in...Surma...constituency were attacked by BJP goons [last night]," TMC's Saugata Roy said. Bypolls to Surma and Agartala will be held on June 23.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Centre only short of building gas chambers like Hitler: Shiv Sena
text: The Shiv Sena, through its editorial, Saamana, said that the Centre is only short of building gas chambers like Hitler to eliminate its opponents. This came following ED's questioning of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in a money laundering case. By questioning Gandhi, the BJP is showing that it can "grab anyone's collar", however powerful the person is, the editorial said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Agnipath scheme controversial, carries multiple risks: Chidambaram
text: Criticising the Centre's Agnipath scheme, Congress leader P Chidambaram said that the scheme is "controversial and carries multiple risks". "We have read and heard the views expressed by retired Defence officers," Chidambaram said. "Almost unanimously, they have opposed the scheme and we believe that many serving officers share the same reservations about this scheme," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Agnipath scheme will push youth into unemployment: Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah said that the Centre's 'Agnipath' scheme will push the country's youth into "unemployment". "The scheme will have an adverse impact on the security of the country. The BJP should drop the new plan," Siddaramaiah said. "Can soldiers be completely involved if they are insecure about their job opportunities," Siddaramaiah asked.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: I guarantee you to get work done in Rajinder Nagar: Kejriwal ahead of bypoll
text: At his first public rally in Delhi's Rajinder Nagar constituency, which will hold by-elections on June 23, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal appealed to vote for the AAP candidate Durgesh Pathak. "I am giving you the guarantee of getting all the work in the constituency done. I do what I promise," CM Kejriwal said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: PM will have to become 'Mafiveer', take back 'Agnipath': Rahul
text: Amid protests over the 'Agnipath' scheme, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said, "[PM Narendra Modi] will have to obey the youth...by becoming 'Mafiveer' and 'Agnipath' will have to be taken back." It'll have to be withdrawn in the same way as the repealed farm laws, he added. "For 8 consecutive years...BJP government has insulted...'Jai Jawan, Jai Kisan'," he claimed.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Riots are handiwork of greedy leaders with minds full of dirt: WB CM
text: Amid cases of violence across the country, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said, "Riots are the handiwork of greedy leaders who have their minds full of black dirt." Riots are never caused by people of any religious community, she added. Speaking at a programme in Kolkata's Dakshineswar Temple, she said, "When life has no surety, why should we fight?"
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: PM Modi can't hear anything except friends' voice: Rahul Gandhi
text: Amid protests by youths across India against the Agnipath scheme, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of not understanding people's needs. "Agnipath - youth rejected, farm laws - farmers rejected, note ban - economists rejected," Rahul tweeted. "The [PM] doesn't understand what...people...want as he can't hear anything except the voice of his 'friends'," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Cong leaders to meet Prez over alleged manhandling of MPs by police
text: A delegation of senior Congress leaders will meet President Ram Nath Kovind to bring to his notice the alleged manhandling of and attacks on the party's MPs by Delhi Police. The MPs were protesting the Enforcement Directorate probe on party leader Rahul Gandhi when the alleged police action occurred.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Agnipath scheme an attack on 'jawani' after 'kisaani': Punjab CM
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann, while condemning the Centre's decision to implement the Agnipath scheme in the Indian Army, has called it a "serious attack" on 'jawani' (youth) after 'kisaani' (farming). "It is a huge loss for Punjabi youth, who are ever ready to serve their motherland by joining the Army," the CM further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: If you want MLAs who fight & don't work, vote for BJP: Delhi CM Kejriwal
text: At a roadshow held in Delhi ahead of Rajinder Nagar bypoll, CM Arvind Kejriwal said people should vote for BJP if they want MLAs who pick fights and don't work. "Wherever...[BJP] MLAs...won, they've indulged in rowdyism, vandalism and brawls. They don't know anything apart from spreading hate," he said. "If you want progressive policies, vote for AAP," Kejriwal added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Arrested for indecent post on Pawar, Marathi actress files plea in HC
text: Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale on Thursday filed a petition in the Bombay High Court challenging her arrest for allegedly sharing an offensive post on social media about NCP chief Sharad Pawar. The actress in her plea said that her arrest was not in accordance with the law and must be declared illegal by the HC.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Sharad Pawar refuses to contest for Presidential post
text:
NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday refused to contest for the upcoming Presidential election. 
"I sincerely appreciate the leaders of opposition parties for suggesting my name as a candidate for the election of the President of India, at the meeting held in Delhi. However I like to state that I have humbly declined the proposal of my candidature," Pawar said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Delhi Police tore my clothes, removed my shoes during protest: Cong's Jothimani
text: Congress MP Jothimani has alleged that Delhi Police personnel assaulted her and tore her clothes while she was protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi. Sharing a video online, she alleged, "They removed my shoes and carried me like a criminal." Jothimani added, "There are eight women on this bus and we repeatedly asked for water but they refused."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: This is outrageous: Tharoor after woman Congress MP says Delhi Police tore her clothes
text: Amid protests by Congress in Delhi over ED questioning Rahul Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor has shared a video of Congress MP Jothimani who said Delhi Police personnel tore her clothes. "This is outrageous...To deal with a woman protestor like this violates every Indian standard of decency, but to do it to a Lok Sabha MP is a new low," Tharoor said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Rahul Gandhi questioned by ED for 3rd day, summoned again on Friday
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for further questioning on Friday in connection with the National Herald case. Rahul appeared before the Enforcement Directorate for the third consecutive day on Wednesday. He arrived at the ED Headquarters in Delhi at around 11.35 am on Wednesday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Rahul takes decisions after consulting his 'bad' coterie: Kuldeep Bishnoi
text: Kuldeep Bishnoi, who was expelled from Congress for cross-voting in RS polls, said Rahul Gandhi "failed" to keep his promise of giving PCC president's post to him. Furthermore, Bishnoi said Rahul promised him to let him build the party in Haryana. "He (Rahul) takes decisions after consulting three-four people who are his immediate coterie...He has a bad coterie," Bishnoi added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Agnipath scheme may prove 'fatal' for country's future, youth: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday criticised central government's 'Agnipath' recruitment scheme, while calling the move "negligent". Akhilesh said that the scheme might prove "fatal for the future of the country and the youth." "The security of the country is not a short-term or informal issue, it requires a very serious and long-term policy," Akhilesh tweeted.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Police use water cannons on BJP workers protesting against Kerala CM
text: Kerala Police used water cannons and tear gas to stop BJP Yuva Morcha members as they protested against CM Pinarayi Vijayan, demanding his resignation over the gold smuggling case. The BJP workers staged a protest outside the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram. The protests came after the prime accused in the gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM's involvement in the scam.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Protests over Rahul's ED questioning will lead to Cong's downfall: Bommai
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said protests over the questioning of Rahul Gandhi by ED will be "disastrous" for Congress. "Congress party is staging protests over a case that concerns illegality and violations of...law. This will be the downfall of...Congress," Bommai added. His comments came in the backdrop of 'Raj Bhavan chalo' protest organised by Congress' Karnataka unit.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Displaying pics is wrong: J’khand minister on posters of Ranchi violence accused
text: After police removed posters of persons accused in the recent violent protests in Jharkhand’s Ranchi, state minister Rameshwar Oraon said posters violate rights of accused. "Displaying pictures of members of the crowd was wrong in my personal opinion. They may have been accused in eyes of the public but they're not yet accused in the eyes of law," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong files complaint against Delhi Police personnel over 'illegal actions'
text: Congress filed a complaint at Tughlak Road Police Station against officers of Delhi Police alleging that the police personnel "forcibly" entered party's headquarters and "attacked" party workers and leaders without provocation. A delegation of senior Congress leaders presented a detailed written complaint highlighting “brazen and illegal actions” of officials of the Delhi Police.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Aaditya Thackeray, Shiv Sena leaders perform aarti in Ayodhya's ISKCON Temple
text: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray, along with other Shiv Sena leaders, performed aarti at ISKCON Temple in Ayodhya's Ramnagar on Wednesday. "Recalling the relationship between Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray and ISKCON Mumbai," Thackeray tweeted while sharing a video of the aarti. "I am grateful for the invitation and love to visit ISKCON Ramnagar," his tweet further read.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Will reduce effectiveness of armed forces: Rahul on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday reacted to the new military recruitment model 'Agnipath', stating that it will reduce the 'operational effectiveness of the armed forces'. "The BJP government must stop compromising the dignity, traditions, valour and discipline of our forces," he tweeted. 'Agnipath' proposes to employ aspirants (below officer rank) in the military for four years.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Agnipath defence recruitment scheme will lead to 'gang wars': RLP
text: The Rashtriya Loktantrik Party in Rajasthan has opposed the Agnipath defence recruitment scheme, with party chief Hanuman Beniwal claiming that it will lead to gang wars in the country. "The government had a loss of face due to farmers' protests and had to withdraw the farm laws. The Agnipath scheme will be opposed in the same manner," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Give youth full-term jobs, not 4 years: Kejriwal on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said the demand of the youth protesting against the Centre’s 'Agnipath' scheme is rightful. "Appeal to the central government: Youth should be given the chance to serve the country their whole life, not four years," Kejriwal tweeted. "The central government’s new scheme in Army recruitment is being opposed everywhere in the country," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Unfair towards rural youth: Mayawati on 'Agnipath' scheme
text: BSP chief Mayawati reacted to the new military recruitment model 'Agnipath', saying it's "unfair towards the rural youth". BSP has demanded that the government must reconsider its decision immediately, Mayawati added. "Even though it has been called an attractive scheme, youths of the country are dissatisfied and angry...They are openly opposing the change," she stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Bad sign for healthy democracy: Cong's Pilot after being detained
text: Congress leader Sachin Pilot, after being detained for trying to enter the party office, said that his detention was a bad sign for a healthy democracy. "I don't know what next they plan to do with us. This sort of detainment has never happened before. This behaviour in a civil society is just not done," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Tripura Cong locks ED office in protest against summons to Rahul
text: The Tripura unit of Congress on Wednesday locked the local ED office in protest against the interrogation of party leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman said the summons is a means to harass Gandhi, adding that PM Narendra Modi has "nothing to show people".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Centre misusing law enforcement agencies: Pawan Bansal
text: Former Union minister Pawan Kumar Bansal accused the BJP-led Central government of "misusing law enforcement agencies to achieve its political ends". "The sole aim of the BJP is to grab power by any means," Bansal said. "The unending quizzing of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on the basis of baseless allegations is...example of unbridled highhandedness of the Enforcement Directorate," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: 'Agnipath' scheme will have far-reaching consequences: Ex-Haryana CM Hooda
text: Senior Congress leader and former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday criticised the Centre over the 'Agnipath' armed forces recruitment scheme. He urged the government to reconsider the scheme as it might have "far-reaching consequences". "It seems government is compromising with the security of the country with the intention of saving money on salary, pension, gratuity," Hooda added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: We’ll start 'party choro' campaign in Bihar: Suspended JD(U) leader
text: Jitendra Neeraj, one of the four JD(U) leaders suspended from the primary membership of party, has announced to launch a 'party choro' campaign across Bihar. "The party didn't issue any show-cause notice before sacking us," he added. "We were working on the lines of 'party jodo' but from now on we will start a 'party choro' campaign," Neeraj stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Siddaramaiah, Shivakumar detained over protest in Bengaluru
text: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar, former CM Siddaramaiah, other leaders and workers were detained in Bengaluru while protesting against ED questioning party leader Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case. The party organised a march from its office to Raj Bhavan. "They (ED) are not taking cases of any BJP leaders, they are harassing only Congress people," said Shivakumar.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Cong writes to VP Naidu, wants action against 'brazen' Delhi Police
text: Congress has written to Vice President Venkaiah Naidu to register the "strongest possible protest against the atrocious manner in which Delhi Police misbehaved" with its MPs. This comes after Delhi Police detained several Congress leaders during protests against ED's summons to Rahul Gandhi. "Delhi Police's actions...were totally unprovoked and a brazen violation of all norms," Congress said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Aware of defeat, Pawar refused to contest Presidential poll: Ramdas Athawale
text: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Thursday claimed that NCP chief Sharad Pawar refused to contest the upcoming Presidential election as he is aware of his defeat. "Sharad Pawar is a big leader. He himself knows that he will be defeated in these polls," Athawale said. "So, it is not right for opposition parties to discuss his name," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Adhir Ranjan seeks Om Birla’s intervention over Rahul’s ED questioning
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote a letter to LS Speaker Om Birla seeking his intervention over the questioning of Rahul Gandhi by ED. "Our esteemed colleague Rahul Gandhi Ji, has been undergoing inexplicable torment for consecutive three days by ED…in Delhi," Chowdhury said. "He has been grilled on an average [of] 10 to 11 hours per day," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong MPs detained without written order, clear violation of liberty: Chidambaram
text: A day after protests were held by Congress workers and leaders in Delhi, party leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said police detained MPs without a written order, for 8-12 hours. "They (police) denied them food and water and when MPs asked if they've been arrested, police didn't give any answer…It's a clear violation of liberty…Every fundamental right violated," Chidambaram added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP's countdown has begun: Cong over Rahul Gandhi's ED summons
text: As protests continue over the Enforcement Directorate's investigation against Rahul Gandhi, Congress' Nana Patole said, "The countdown has begun for the BJP government." The probe against Rahul Gandhi is being carried out "at the behest of the Central government", he added. "Now, the Delhi Police in tandem with the BJP has carried out atrocities on Congress leaders," Patole said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Don’t celebrate demolition of houses, bulldozer can come to your house: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot asked people not to celebrate if someone else’s house is demolished as it can happen with others too. "The bulldozer can come to your house at any time," he added. "If demolition is right, welcome it. If there's injustice, say it. If today it happened with him then tomorrow it can happen with you," Gehlot stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Opposition parties adopt resolution to field common candidate for Presidential election
text: The leaders of several Opposition parties on Wednesday adopted a resolution to field common candidate for the upcoming Presidential election, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee said. "This is a good beginning. We sat together after several months, and we will do it again," she added. The parties included Congress, Shiv Sena, NCP, SP, PDP, National Conference, RJD and DMK among others.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Cong's Sachin Pilot detained amid protests over Rahul’s questioning by ED
text: Congress leader Sachin Pilot was detained on his way to Congress headquarters on Wednesday amid protests over Rahul Gandhi’s questioning by the ED. Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today in connection with the National Herald case. Earlier today, Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were detained by the police outside the AICC office.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Video shows Delhi Police entering Congress HQ, police say 'people threw barricades at us'
text: Congress has shared a video of Delhi Police personnel entering the party's headquarters amid protests over Enforcement Directorate's questioning of Rahul Gandhi. Calling it a "criminal trespass", Congress alleged policemen also thrashed its workers. Delhi Police said that many people threw barricades at the police near the Congress office but denied that policemen entered the office or used force.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Satyendar Jain said he lost memory after COVID-19 when faced with hawala documents: ED
text: The Enforcement Directorate told a court that Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said he was suffering from memory loss due to COVID-19 when he was confronted with documents in connection with alleged hawala transactions. The ED also claimed that despite showing him documents, where he had signed in the capacity of the President, Jain completely disassociated himself from a trust.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Not political, it's for religious purpose: Aaditya Thackeray on Ayodhya visit
text: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Wednesday visited Ayodhya to offer prayers at the Ram temple and said his visit to the temple is not for political benefits. "Shiv Sena leaders and I've visited here for religious purpose...there's no political benefit," he said. Sena leaders Sanjay Raut and Eknath Shinde along with over 1,000 Shiv Sainiks reached Ayodhya for Aaditya's visit.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Cong to gherao all Raj Bhawans over claims of police entering party office
text: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said the party will gherao all Raj Bhawans across India on Thursday to protest against Delhi Police entering Congress' Delhi headquarters and beating up workers. Several Congress leaders and workers have been protesting outside the party office and ED headquarters since Monday. They're protesting over summons to Rahul Gandhi in National Herald case.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP expels Rajasthan MLA for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls
text: BJP on Tuesday expelled MLA Shobharani Kushwah from Rajasthan's Dholpur constituency for cross-voting in the recently-held Rajya Sabha elections. Kushwah was earlier suspended and served a show-cause notice for going against party orders. Notably, the BJP had asked its members to vote for independent candidate Subhash Chandra. However, Kushwah voted for Congress' Pramod Tiwari in the elections.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Work with greater dedication for victory: CM Jairam tells party workers
text: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur urged BJP party workers to work with greater dedication and commitment to ensure BJP was re-elected in the upcoming assembly elections so that the pace of development in the state is uninterrupted. "Only in BJP...a common worker rises to the topmost position, while all other political outfits are headed by families," he said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Wouldn't have gone anyway: Owaisi on not being invited to Opposition meet
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said he wasn't invited to the meeting of Opposition leaders called by TMC chief Mamata Banerjee in Delhi. "Even if I were invited, I wouldn't have participated," Owaisi added, stating Congress to be the reason behind his decision. Notably, Mamata Banerjee had invited leaders of 22 political parties to discuss strategy for Presidential election.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Centre will pay hefty price for suppressing Rahul Gandhi’s voice: CM Baghel
text: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel criticised BJP-led Central government over ED's probe against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case. The centre will have to pay a hefty price for attempting to suppress Gandhi's voice, Baghel said. "Be it GST, demonetisation, COVID mismanagement...unemployment...Gandhi has been raising...voice against every important issue," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Rahul Gandhi arrives at ED office for third day of questioning
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday arrived at the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Delhi for the third consecutive day of questioning in connection with the National Herald case. Meanwhile, women leaders and workers of Congress protested against the ED's action outside the party office in heavy police presence. Gandhi was questioned for several hours on Tuesday.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Won't tolerate forced conversions, will tweak law if needed: Goa CM
text: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said that illegal religious conversions by inducement or duress will not be tolerated and that the anti-conversion law may be modified to check it. "At present, the law is weak. My legal team is studying it. If any changes are required, they will be carried out," Sawant said.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Outrageous act of political vendetta: Stalin on ED's questioning of Rahul
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin condemned the questioning of Congress’ Rahul Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and called it an "outrageous act of political vendetta" against Congress and its leaders. "BJP uses such diversionary tactics to save itself from the public ire," Stalin tweeted. "Political opponents should be fought politically, not by 'forcing' the ED," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Gangsters were born under previous govts in Punjab: AAP's Kejriwal
text: AAP's Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday backed current law and order situation in Punjab while speaking at an event in Jalandhar. "I ask...Opposition, has [Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann] brought gangsters with him? These gangsters were born under...previous governments," he said. Kejriwal's comments come amid Opposition's uproar over rising crimes in Punjab following Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala's murder.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Stalin, Thackeray, KCR among leaders to skip Oppn’s meet: Kharge
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and many big leaders won’t be participating in the Opposition’s meeting, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Wednesday. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee last week wrote to leaders of 22 parties for the meeting to discuss the Presidential election.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: National security being toyed with: Cong over Agnipath recruitment scheme
text: Congress leader TS Singh Deo on Tuesday questioned the central government's Agnipath recruitment scheme for youth to serve in the Army. "Defence services and national security are being toyed with," Deo said. "What kind of job is this where you'll keep them for four years and then only 25% of them would be allowed to go ahead?" he added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP govt making armed forces its laboratory for experiments: Priyanka
text: A day after the Union government announced the 'Agnipath' scheme for recruitment to the armed forces, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked why the BJP was making the armed forces its laboratory for experiments. "Soldiers serving the army for several years, does the government see this as a burden?" Priyanka's Twitter post read.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Uma Bharti throws cow dung at liquor shop in MP; video surfaces
text: BJP leader Uma Bharti on Tuesday threw cow dung at a liquor shop in Madhya Pradesh's Orchha town amid her demand for total prohibition in the BJP-ruled state. Bharti in a tweet claimed the shop wasn't approved for the spot it was located. It was a "crime" to open such an outlet in the holy town of Orchha, she said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: PM expert in making news, not in creating jobs: Rahul Gandhi
text: Following PMO’s announcement to recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi is an "expert" in making news. "This is not a government of 'jumlas’, it is a government of ‘maha jumlas’. The Prime Minister is not an expert in creating jobs, but in making ‘news’ on jobs," Gandhi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Population isn't a burden for Bihar, says JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar
text: JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar on Tuesday said that the population is not a burden for Bihar. "We can't debar weaker sections like Dalits, tribals and Muslims from education and health facilities in the name of population control," Kumar added. "After Nagaland, Bihar stabilised its reproduction rate. We are half of the national average," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: If BJP is a virus, TMC is its vaccine: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee
text: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said the "double-engine government" has failed in Tripura and TMC can give a bright future to the state. "If BJP is...virus, then TMC is its vaccine," Banerjee stated. "BJP's irresponsible...careless comments have created chaos and infighting within...country," he added. He was speaking at a rally in Tripura ahead of the Assembly bypolls.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: FIR against Maha Cong leader for derogatory comments about PM Modi
text: An FIR was registered in Nagpur against Maharashtra Congress leader Sheikh Hussain for allegedly using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi. "I've not made any personal attack against the PM, only used an idiom in my speech. I spoke in favour of the party. I've not said anything I regret or need to apologise for," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Ruthless suppression of Cong's protests is blot on our democracy: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said the "ruthless" suppression of the Congress party’s protests is a "blot" on our democracy. His statement came as Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED for the third consecutive day today. Congress workers and leaders protesting against ED questioning were also detained by the police outside the AICC office earlier today.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 'Solve dispute in lifetime' approach won’t work with India-China matter: RSS leader
text: RSS leader Ram Madhav said the approach of 'I should solve this dispute in my lifetime' will not work in the India-China border issue. "Don't be in a hurry for a (Indo-China boundary) solution…It's not going to be solved, because you are not dealing with just any other country, you are dealing with a civilisation, a cultural nation," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: UP CM asks ministers to refrain from making provocative statements
text: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday asked his ministers to refrain from making provocative statements on any issue that may vitiate the social atmosphere. "Those in government offices should uphold dignity and decorum of their offices," CM Yogi added. He was addressing a meeting of his council of ministers ahead of the bypoll to the two Lok Sabha seats.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Are we terrorists?: Adhir Ranjan as police detain protesting Cong leaders
text: As Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared for the third day before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday, party workers and leaders protesting against the ED questioning were detained by police outside the AICC office. "Are we terrorists? Why are you scared of us? They are using police force against Congress leaders and workers," Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Attempt to fool the masses: TMC on PM's recruitment announcement
text: TMC criticised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's instruction to recruit 10 lakh people in the next 18 months, calling it an attempt to "fool the masses" before 2024 polls. "None of the promises made by BJP and PM Narendra Modi has ever been fulfilled," TMC's Partha Chatterjee said. BJP comes up with a new trick every time election approaches, he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Rahul questioned for over 8 hrs by ED for 2nd consecutive day; summoned again: Report
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate to appear before it on Wednesday, after questioning him for over eight hours in connection with National Herald case on Tuesday, according to reports. This comes after he was questioned for around 10 hours on Monday after he appeared before the agency at 11:30 am.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Bengal Assembly passes bill to remove Guv as Visitor of pvt universities
text: The West Bengal Assembly on Tuesday passed a bill to replace Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar with the state Education Minister Bratya Basu as the Visitor of private universities. This comes after the Assembly passed a bill seeking to replace Dhankhar with CM Mamata Banerjee as the state-run universities' Chancellor. Both the bills need to get consent from Dhankhar before becoming acts.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Mamata meets Sharad Pawar ahead of Oppn's meet on Presidential poll
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday met NCP chief Sharad Pawar at his residence in Delhi ahead of the Opposition's meeting to discuss the Presidential election to be held next month. Banerjee last week wrote to leaders of 22 opposition parties for the meeting. The Opposition's meeting is scheduled for June 15 (Wednesday).
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Congress' Srinivas BV forced into bus by police during protest in Delhi
text: Youth Congress President Srinivas BV was detained while he was protesting the Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe against party leader Rahul Gandhi in Delhi. In a video, police are seen forcefully pushing Srinivas in a bus full of detained Congress workers. Srinivas can be seen resisting attempts to push him onto the police bus.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: PM's security asks Aaditya to get off father Uddhav's car over no name on VIP list: Report
text: PM Narendra Modi's security on Tuesday asked Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray to get off CM Uddhav Thackeray's car as his name wasn't on the list of VIPs scheduled to receive the PM in Mumbai, according to reports. Uddhav reportedly told the security that Aaditya wasn't merely his son but also a minister. Aaditya was later allowed to travel with him.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: He's busy with other issues: Thakur on Rahul's 'maha jumla' remark
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for calling Centre's announcement of recruitment of 10 lakh people in 18 months as "maha jumla". "Rather than welcoming the decision, he is too busy dealing with other issues to show his happiness towards this," Thakur said. "This is a government of not 'jumlas', but 'maha jumlas'," Rahul Gandhi tweeted earlier.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Time for Opposition parties to come together on 1 platform: Baghel
text: Congress leader and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday said that the time has come for the Opposition parties to consider coming together on a single platform. He said that the leaders of different political parties are being harassed by using ED, Income Tax Department or CBI against them. BJP is making all efforts to suppress the Opposition, he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Understand the chronology: Surjewala as wholesale inflation rises
text: As India’s WPI surged to a record high of 15.88% in May, Congress’ Randeep Singh Surjewala said that ED’s notice is served to people who raise their voices against inflation. "Understand the chronology-Issue a notice of ED to the voices raised against inflation so that the attention is diverted under the guise of ED's probe," Surjewala tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: 4 JD(U) leaders suspended from party on disciplinary grounds
text: Four leaders of Janata Dal (United) were suspended from the primary membership of the party on Tuesday on disciplinary grounds. These include Anil Kumar, Bipin Kumar Yadav, Ajay Alok and Jitendra Neeraj. "They were running a parallel programme contrary to the party's ideology and were misguiding party workers despite holding important positions," said Bihar JD(U) chief Umesh Kushwaha.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Cong to attend Opposition parties' meet called by Mamata Banerjee
text: Congress will take part in an Opposition leaders' meeting called by TMC chief and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on June 15 in Delhi, ANI reported quoting sources. Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge, Jairam Ramesh and Randeep Singh Surjewala will reportedly take part in the meeting. The Opposition leaders' meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential election on July 18.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: People should understand Sonia, Rahul's chronology of corruption: BJP
text: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra has said people should try to understand Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's "chronology of corruption". "I want to know how this mother-son duo looted people's wealth," he added. Patra's comments come as Rahul Gandhi, who was probed by Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald case yesterday, was summoned again today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: I'll not be Opposition candidate for President's post: Sharad Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar has said that he's not in the race for the Presidential election scheduled to be held on July 18, a report said. He said, "I'm not in the race...I'll not be an Opposition candidate for the President's post." Pawar's remark came after the Congress in Maharashtra said it'd support him for the President's post.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Promise was to give 2 cr jobs a year: Surjewala on PM’s recruitment announcement
text: Soon after the PMO announced to recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, Congress’ Randeep Singh Surjewala said the promise was to give two crore jobs every year. "Sixteen crore jobs were to be given in eight years. Now they're saying that by 2024, only 10 lakh jobs will be given," Surjewala tweeted. "Jumlebazi (mockery) for how long?" he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong's Surjewala, other party leaders continue to be in police detention
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala, AICC Secretary Pranav Jha and NSUI chief Neeraj Kundan along with other party leaders continue to be detained after protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi in Delhi on Tuesday. Sharing a picture on social media, Surjewala said Congress leaders were detained in various police stations for over 10 hours. "What's our crime?" he wrote.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: New fake promise for polls?: Mayawati on PM's recruitment announcement
text: Reacting to PMO’s announcement that the Centre will recruit 10 lakh people in 1.5 years, BSP chief Mayawati asked, "Is this new fake promise for elections?" "Due to wrong policies and working style of the Centre, poverty...unemployment and devaluation of the rupee, each is at its peak," Mayawati tweeted. "Because of this, everyone is suffering and is restless," she added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Not letting Ajit Pawar speak at PM's event is Maha's insult: Sule
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Supriya Sule on Tuesday said that not letting Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar speak at inauguration of Pune's Sant Tukaram Shila temple is an insult to the state. "A request was made to the PMO to allow [Pawar] to speak, but [there was no response]," Sule added. PM Narendra Modi attended the ceremony earlier today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP is scared of me, I dare CBI, ED to touch me: Abhishek Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday said the BJP is scared of him and further dared the CBI and ED to touch him "if they've the guts". His remarks came after CBI officers reached his residence to question his wife in connection with a coal smuggling case. TMC will reinstall democracy, he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Cong doesn't understand speed with which economy is growing: Piyush
text: BJP leader and Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Tuesday said that the Congress party doesn't understand the speed with which India's economy is growing. He further said that PM Narendra Modi's directive to provide recruitment to 10 lakh youth in different government departments and public sectors shows that youth will have a major contribution in developing modern India.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 2 Telangana BJP leaders arrested in Hyd over skit against CM KCR
text: Telangana BJP leaders Rani Rudrama and Daruvu Yellanna have been arrested in Hyderabad for allegedly enacting a skit defaming CM K Chandrashekar Rao. A notice has been served to state BJP chief Bandi Sanjay to appear before police for questioning in this connection. The skit was enacted on Telangana Formation Day on June 2.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Ex-U'khand AAP chief Deepak Bali joins BJP after quitting party
text: Former Uttarakhand Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Deepak Bali on Tuesday joined the Bharatiya Janata Party a day after resigning from his post and membership of AAP. Bali joined the BJP in the presence of Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. In a letter, Bali had cited being "uncomfortable with the party's methodology" as a reason for his resignation from AAP.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Every year 2 crore jobs announced by Modi govt: Sitaram Yechury
text: CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury criticised PM Narendra Modi's instruction to recruit 10 lakh people in the next 18 months and said that every year two crore jobs had been announced by the Modi government. "How many times have you heard such a thing in the last 8-10 years?" Yechury said. He called the move "gross injustice to the youth".
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Unnecessary & oppressive: TS Singh Deo on ED summon to Rahul Gandhi
text: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo criticised ED summon to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, calling it "unnecessary and oppressive". "It doesn't seem they have a question they want to ask. If they had, they would've asked directly [that] wouldn't have taken over 1-2 hours," Deo said. Rahul Gandhi was summoned by the ED in the National Herald money laundering case.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP is giving collective punishment to Indian Muslims: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said that BJP is giving collective punishment to Indian Muslims. "UP CM has become 'super Chief Justice'. He'll convict anybody in his own court," Owaisi added. "Afreen Fatima's house was in her mother's name...Why isn't BJP demolishing Teni's (son Ashish Mishra) home, accused of killing five people," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress considers its leaders above law: BJP's Sambit Patra
text: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Tuesday said that the Congress considers its leaders above the law. His remarks came after Congress workers protested in support of Rahul Gandhi who was summoned by the ED in the National Herald money laundering case. Patra said, "When lawful action is taking place in...case of corruption, Congress is doing this drama and blocking roads."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Political witch-hunt: TMC as CBI questions Abhishek's wife in coal scam
text: TMC on Tuesday accused the Centre of engaging in a "political witch-hunt" after a CBI team questioned West Bengal MP Abhishek Banerjee's wife Rujira in connection with the coal scam. "Minutes after our National General Secretary...lands in Agartala, 'remote controlled' CBI springs into action," TMC tweeted. Notably, CBI had interrogated Rujira last year ahead of the state assembly elections.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Cong acting like Sonia, Rahul Gandhi never do any wrong: K'taka Minister
text: Karnataka Minister R Ashoka on Tuesday said Congress is acting like party leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi "can never do any wrong and whatever they do is right". Congress is trying to subvert the Indian Constitution by shielding Sonia and Rahul in the National Herald case, the BJP leader said. Congress is carrying out "protest drama", Ashoka added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SP expels MLA Rajesh Kumar Shukla for crossing over to BJP in MP
text: The Samajwadi Party said it has expelled MLA Rajesh Kumar Shukla from the party's primary membership for "anti-party activities" and for switching over to BJP in Madhya Pradesh. "We are also trying to ensure that his Assembly membership gets terminated," SP's Madhya Pradesh unit president Ramayan Patel said. Shukla, along with two other legislators, joined BJP in Bhopal on Tuesday.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: CBI court reserves order on Delhi minister Satyendar's bail plea till June 18
text: A CBI court on Tuesday reserved its order on the bail plea of Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain in an alleged money laundering case. The court will pronounce the order on June 18. The Enforcement Directorate had arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30. Jain is accused of having laundered money through at least four companies allegedly linked to him.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 3 policemen crashed into me, lucky to get away with suspected hairline crack: Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram has tweeted, "When three big, burly policemen crash into you, you are lucky to get away with a suspected hairline crack!" He added, "Doctors have said that if there is a hairline crack, it will heal by itself in about 10 days." Congress alleged Chidambaram suffered hairline fracture in his rib after Delhi Police manhandled him.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Delhi Police detained 459 Congress workers, leaders in Day 1 protest
text: Delhi Police on Monday detained 459 Congress workers and leaders for not following police directions amid the first day of protest, officials said. The party workers were protesting in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi, who appeared before Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald money laundering case. Earlier, the Delhi Police had denied permission to Congress to hold the protest.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Rahul questioned by ED for around 9 hours, to appear again tomorrow: Reports
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was questioned by the Enforcement Directorate for around nine hours in connection with an alleged money laundering case connected to the National Herald newspaper, according to reports. The agency has reportedly asked the leader to appear for questioning on Tuesday as well. Rahul was allowed to leave for lunch at 2:10pm, and he returned at 3:30pm.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Video of Cong leader running from policeman amid protest surfaces, he responds
text: A video showing Congress leader Srinivas BV running from a policeman outside ED office in Delhi surfaced online. He's seen escaping arrest while arriving to protest Rahul Gandhi's questioning. In response, he shared a video of him resisting arrest and said, "'First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win'- Mahatma Gandhi."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bihar MLA Anant Singh found guilty in 2019 arms recovery case
text: A special court in Bihar's Patna on Tuesday found RJD MLA Anant Singh guilty in a case regarding the recovery of an AK-47, ammunition and grenades from his ancestral house in 2019. The punishment will be pronounced on June 21. Singh's lawyer said, "[We'll] move the high court after...punishment is awarded." Singh is a four-time MLA from the Mokama constituency.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Cong leaders Surjewala, Venugopal & others detained amid protest in Delhi
text: Congress workers and leaders were detained on Tuesday as they held a protest for the second consecutive day in Delhi over Enforcement Directorate questioning party leader Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald money laundering case. Congress leaders like Randeep Surjewala, KC Venugopal, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, Gaurav Gogoi, Deepender Hooda, Ranjeet Ranjan, Imran Pratapgarhi and others were detained.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Modi govt crossed limits of barbarism: Cong on police stopping Satyagraha march
text: Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala on Monday said the PM Modi-led government "has crossed all limits of barbarism" after Delhi Police detained Congress workers who were on their way to join the party's Satyagraha march. "Former Home Minister P Chidambaram's...glasses were thrown on the ground, he has a hairline fracture in his left rib...Is this a democracy?" Surjewala said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Our 'Satyagrah' won’t stop: Surjewala on Rahul's ED questioning
text: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala on Tuesday said that probe by the ED against party leader Rahul Gandhi is an attempt to muzzle his voice. "We are Gandhi's heirs, we will once again walk, our 'Satyagrah' won't stop," Surjewala added. Furthermore, he said that Rahul has always questioned PM Narendra Modi-led government on unemployment, price hike and religious vendetta.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sonia, Rahul called to ED office to harass them: Mallikarjun Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday accused the BJP-led government of harassing Sonia and Rahul Gandhi over the National Herald case. "This is nothing but politics...Had there been a legal point in this case, it wouldn't have taken eight years (for action)," Kharge said. "Making them sit for hours (at ED office) and harass them is political vendetta," he alleged.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: 2 Opposition MLAs, independent legislator join BJP in Madhya Pradesh
text: Two Opposition MLAs, including Sanjeev Singh Kushwaha from BSP, Rajesh Kumar Shukla from SP, and one independent legislator Vikram Singh Rana joined the BJP in Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday. With this, BJP's strength in the 230-member state Assembly rose to 130, with the Congress having 96 MLAs and BSP one. The development comes ahead of the Presidential election next month.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: AIMIM directs leaders to not take part in any 'dharna' in UP
text: Following recent violence in UP, AIMIM directed its office bearers, leaders and workers in the state to not participate in any 'dharna' or demonstration organised in any district. "The party does not support any dharna or demonstration that are unconstitutional…Without any evidence or testimony of witness, the Prayagraj police blamed the AIMIM for the Friday violence," AIMIM’s Shaukat Ali said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Tripura CM Manik Saha to be BJP's CM candidate for 2023 polls
text: Tripura CM Manik Saha confirmed on Sunday that he will be BJP's CM candidate for the 2023 state Assembly elections. Saha, who replaced ex-CM Biplab Kumar Deb last month, is set to contest state Assembly bypolls from Town Bardowali constituency on June 23. "I'm close to every resident of Town Bardowali...as I was born and brought up here," he said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Recruitment of 10 lakh people will give new confidence to youths: Amit Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that PM Narendra Modi's directive to recruit 10 lakh people in all government departments "in 1.5 years will bring new hope...confidence among the youth". "The basis of new India is its youth power," Shah said. Notably, the Centre has set a deadline for filling up 10 lakh government vacancies by December 2023.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Sharad Pawar not a contender for President post: NCP
text: A senior NCP leader reportedly claimed that the NCP chief Sharad Pawar is not keen on contesting the upcoming Presidential elections. "I don't think he (Pawar) is keen on it (contesting polls). Saheb (Pawar) is a people's man who loves meeting people. He will not restrict himself to the Rashtrapati Bhavan," the leader said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Hate speeches are starting point of targeted attacks: Delhi HC
text: Hate speeches by politicians and religious leaders warrant stringent action, said the Delhi High Court. "Hate speeches are the beginning point of attacks against the targeted community that can range from discrimination to ostracism, ghettoisation, deportation and even to genocide," it added. It rejected a plea against Union Minister Anurag Thakur and MP Parvesh Verma over alleged hate speeches.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: ED's questioning of Rahul Gandhi is political vendetta: Deepender Hooda
text: Congress leader Deepender Hooda condemned the questioning of Rahul Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and called it a "political vendetta". "The voice of Rahul Gandhi and Congress will not be silenced by these actions," Hooda added. Notably, Rahul Gandhi on Monday left the ED office in Delhi after about 10 hours of questioning in the National Herald case.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Centre will have to make efforts to fill over 1 cr vacant posts: Varun Gandhi
text: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Tuesday said Centre will have to make meaningful efforts to fill up over one crore "sanctioned but vacant posts." "To fulfil...promise of providing two crore jobs every year, steps will have to be taken at...faster pace," Varun tweeted. His reaction came after the central government announced to recruit 10 lakh people over next 1.5 years.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: U'khand AAP chief resigns, says uncomfortable with party's methodology
text: Uttarakhand Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Deepak Bali resigned from his post and membership of the party on Monday. In a letter, Bali cited being "uncomfortable with the party's methodology" as a reason for his resignation. His resignation came after AAP's chief ministerial candidate for the recently concluded Assembly election in the state, Retired Colonel Ajay Kothiyal, quit the party.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Rahul must face probe, Cong shouldn’t hold people to ransom: Fadnavis
text: After Congress’ Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED on Monday, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said he must face the probe and the party should not hold people to "ransom". Rahul was questioned by ED for around nine hours in connection with an alleged money laundering case connected to the National Herald newspaper, according to reports.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress govt in Rajasthan cheating and betraying farmers: BJP
text: Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia on Monday accused Congress of cheating the farmers. "The Congress government in the state is cheating and betraying the farmers in the name of farm loan waiver and auction of lands," he alleged. "On the other hand, the BJP-led Central government will give PM-Kisan Samman Nidhi to the farmers of the country," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: He can’t decide what UP govt will do: Ajay Mishra on Owaisi’s remark on CM
text: Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni said that AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has no right to decide what the UP government and the court will do. His statement came in reaction to Owaisi’s remark saying that UP CM Yogi Adityanath has become the "Chief Justice" of Allahabad HC, after Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed’s property was demolished.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: I am not in Presidential race: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
text: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday put speculations to rest and announced that he is not a candidate for the upcoming Presidential elections scheduled to be held on July 18. "Nitish Kumar has an outstanding parliamentary and legislative career. He can be a good candidate for the President of India," Bihar Minister Shrawan Kumar had previously said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Questioning someone till midnight is wrong: Gehlot on Rahul's ED appearance
text: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was questioned by ED in National Herald money laundering case for around nine hours on Monday, according to reports, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said questioning someone till 12 in the midnight is wrong. "Be it BJP or RSS, everyone is looting, they are not paying attention to it," Gehlot added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Cong protesting against misuse of law, ED not following it: P Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said Congress is protesting against the misuse of law as the ED is not following it. "If ED follows the law, we have no problem," Chidambaram added. "We are asking what's the scheduled offence? There's no answer. Which police agency has registered an FIR? No answer, no copy of FIR," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Govt has blocked probe: MoS IT on Kerala gold smuggling case
text: Minister of State (MoS) for Electronics & IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said when the Kerala gold smuggling case was exposed in 2020, CM Pinarayi Vijayan had written to PM Narendra Modi. "Since then, the government has blocked the investigation," Chandrasekhar added. "Recent revelations are explosive and unprecedented. This points a needle of suspicion towards CM and his family," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Leaders opposing free electricity can pay their full bills: Himachal CM
text: After facing opposition from Congress leaders over the decision to provide 125 units of electricity free of cost each month, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur invited the opposition to pay their bills in full. "It is surprising that these decisions have not gone down well...The leaders opposed to it should voluntarily give up the free power," CM Thakur said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Satyendar Jain sent to 14-day judicial custody in alleged money laundering case
text: The Rouse Avenue court in Delhi on Monday sent AAP leader and Delhi minister Satyendar Jain to 14-day judicial custody in an alleged money laundering case. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate said it recovered ₹2.85 crore in cash and 133 gold coins after conducting raids on Jain and his associates. Jain was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate on May 30.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Too much: Venkatesh Prasad on Nupur Sharma's effigy hanging outside mosque
text: Former cricketer Venkatesh Prasad has expressed concern over the hanging of suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's effigy outside a mosque in Karnataka amid protests against her comments on Prophet Muhammad. "I would urge everyone to leave politics aside and let sanity prevail. This is just too much," he tweeted. "Two wrongs don't make a right," Prasad further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Chidambaram suffers hairline fracture in left rib after being pushed by Delhi Police: Cong
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala has alleged that former Finance Minister P Chidambaram suffered a hairline fracture in his left rib after being pushed and manhandled by Delhi Police during protests on Monday.
