He added that spectacles were also thrown on the road. Congress leader Pramod Tiwari was allegedly thrown on road and suffered head injury and rib fracture.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Congress workers protest over Rahul's ED summon in Delhi; detained
text: The Delhi Police on Monday detained some Congress workers as they held a protest in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi ahead of his appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. Videos of the party workers being detained have surfaced online. Earlier, the Delhi Police had denied Congress permission to hold a rally over the same.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Priyanka meets detained Congress leaders at Delhi police station
text: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi on Monday met with detained party leaders at Delhi's Tughlak Road police station. The Congress leaders were detained following their protests in support of party leader Rahul Gandhi, as he appeared before Enforcement Directorate in the National Herald case. Congress shared pictures of the meeting on its Twitter handle.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Congress is doing 'Jashn-e-Bhrashtachar': BJP's Sambit Patra
text: BJP leader Sambit Patra said what Congress is doing today is 'Jashn-e-Bhrashtachar'- celebrating corruption. His statement came as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared before the ED in Delhi. "Congress has yet again tried launching Rahul Gandhi module from the pad of corruption, we assure that he'll meet the same fate, he will fail yet again," Patra added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Islam says Nupur Sharma should be forgiven: Jamaat Ulama-e-Hind
text: Amid the ongoing controversy over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma, Jamaat Ulama-e-Hind's Suhaib Qasmi said she should be forgiven as per Islam. He added, "Islam says Nupur Sharma should be forgiven. We disagree with the protest that started across the country after Friday prayers against Nupur Sharma and her derogatory remarks."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Attempt to protect ₹2,000 cr of Gandhi family: Irani on Cong protest march
text: Soon after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday reached ED's office in Delhi after a protest march by the party, Union Minister Smriti Irani said it was an attempt to allegedly protect Gandhi family's properties worth ₹2,000 crore. "Congress leaders have taken to the streets to pressurise an investigating agency openly because their corruption has been exposed," Irani added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP criticises Cong for using Moosewala's pictures in campaign song
text: Aam Aadmi Party on Monday criticised Congress for politicising the death of singer Sidhu Moosewala by using his pictures in an election song. "A mother has lost her son, but it is appalling that Congress is trying to get mileage from his death in the elections," said Gurmail Singh. The song was released by Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Kanpur violence well-planned conspiracy: VHP General Secretary
text: Vishva Hindu Parishad's General Secretary Milind Parande on Sunday expressed concern over the Kanpur violence last Friday and described it as a "well-planned conspiracy". Violence had erupted on June 3 in Kanpur following Friday prayers over suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's alleged derogatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad in a television debate.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Undeclared emergency in Delhi: Surjewala ahead of Rahul's ED appearance
text: Ahead of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s appearance before the ED in Delhi on Monday, party leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said "coward" PM Narendra Modi-led government has imposed an undeclared emergency in Central Delhi. "The coward Modi government has deployed many police barriers and police personnel…This proves that the Modi government is shaken by Congress," Surjewala added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress & corruption are made for each other: Union Minister Naqvi
text: Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Monday alleged that Congress and corruption are made for each other, adding that Congress was carrying out "satyagraha for corruption". "The Congress has become a crew of corruption and a champion of converting corruption into revolution," BJP leader Naqvi said. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was questioned by the ED in a money laundering case.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Efforts made to suppress voices of different ideologies: Sachin Pilot
text: After permission was denied to the Congress to hold a Satyagraha march in Delhi, party leader Sachin Pilot has accused BJP of suppressing "the voice of people of different ideologies". "People are seeing the way BJP is misusing the central agencies. Cases, which were already closed 7-8 years ago, have been filed against Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi," Pilot said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Bulldozers missing: Karti Chidambaram as Rahul appears before ED
text: Congress' Karti Chidambaram on Monday said he was "surprised" that BJP has only placed barricades and police leading to Congress office in Delhi, bulldozers were missing. "Guess all have been requisitioned to demolish lives and houses of citizens belonging to the minority faith," Chidambaram added. His statement came as Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared before ED today after protest march.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi, Shah walk around with ego & arrogance; won't last: Raj CM
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah walk around with ego, arrogance, adding that it hasn't worked for anyone and won't work for them either. He said that Congress leaders Rahul and Sonia Gandhi have shown that they won't compromise and will fight on the basis of ideology against them.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP's cronyism has crossed Palk Strait: Rahul on power project claim
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said BJP’s "cronyism" has crossed Palk Strait and moved into Sri Lanka. His statement came after a top Sri Lankan official claimed that PM Narendra Modi "pressured" Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to award a power project to billionaire Gautam Adani’s Adani Group. The official later retracted the claims.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rahul leaves ED office after appearing in National Herald case
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left the ED's office on June 13 after appearing in the National Herald money laundering case. Delhi Police detained several party leaders on Monday for staging protests against the Centre. Among those detained include Ashok Gehlot, Deepender Singh Hooda, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, KC Venugopal, Pawan Khera, Jairam Ramesh, Rajni Patil and Akhilesh Prasad Singh.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Will take U'khand forward: CM after taking oath as Champawat MLA
text: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, who took oath as Champawat's MLA on Monday, thanked PM Narendra Modi and other BJP leaders for giving "the son of a soldier" the opportunity to lead the state. Dhami added that he'll work towards Uttarakhand's progress and make it one of India's best states. He won by over 55,000 votes in state Assembly bypolls.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Bulldozer has become symbol of state-sponsored hooliganism: RLD chief
text: RLD chief Jayant Chaudhary said the use of a bulldozer is not the enforcement of the rule of law rather, it has become a symbol of state-sponsored "hooliganism". His statement came on Sunday when Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed’s property was demolished by the UP government. Javed was arrested on Saturday for his role in protests over Prophet remarks.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: HC dismisses plea for hate speech FIR against Anurag Thakur, Parvesh Singh
text: Delhi High Court on Monday dismissed a plea seeking an FIR against Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh for alleged hate speeches during the anti-Citizenship Amendment Act protests in 2020. The plea was filed by CPI(M) leaders Brinda Karat and KM Tiwari. The HC, while dismissing the plea, said alternative remedies are available to the petitioner.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rajnath, Nadda to hold talks with other parties for Presidential poll
text: The BJP has said that Union Minister Rajnath Singh and BJP chief JP Nadda will hold consultations on behalf of the party with political parties on the upcoming Presidential election. BJP said they will begin holding these consultations soon. The Presidential election is scheduled to be held on July 18 and the votes will be counted on July 21.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: UP govt creating an atmosphere of terror by bulldozing homes: Mayawati
text: BSP President Mayawati has criticised the Uttar Pradesh government for demolishing the homes of protestors, especially from the Muslim community, using bulldozers. "By targeting a particular community, by bulldozing their homes...the state government is suppressing the citizen's right to protest and creating an atmosphere of fear and terror, which is unfair and unjust," Mayawati tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Rahul will be exonerated from baseless accusations: Robert Vadra
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra’s husband Robert Vadra on Monday said Congress’ Rahul Gandhi will be undoubtedly exonerated from all "baseless" accusations. His statement came before Rahul arrived at ED’s office in Delhi today. "I believe, 'truth will prevail' and these harassments of the prevailing dispensation will not have the effect they desire," Vadra wrote in a Facebook post.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: UP CM has become Allahabad HC's Chief Justice: Owaisi on demolition in Prayagraj
text: After Prayagraj violence accused Javed Ahmed’s property was demolished by UP government, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said UP CM Yogi Adityanath is behaving like the "Chief Justice" of Allahabad HC. "He'll convict anyone and demolish their houses?" Owaisi asked. "The house which was demolished is in the name of the wife of accused, who is a Muslim woman," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: SAD's Parkash Singh Badal admitted to hospital in Mohali, is stable
text: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) patriarch Parkash Singh Badal has been admitted to a private hospital in Mohali, a party spokesperson confirmed on Sunday. The 94-year-old was admitted on Saturday after he vomited but his condition is stated to be stable now. Badal was admitted to another hospital on June 6 due to gastric-related problems but was discharged the following day.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Under what law?: Tharoor after razing of violence accused's property in UP
text: After Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad's property was demolished by Uttar Pradesh government, Congress' Shashi Tharoor asked under what law and following what process was the property razed. "Has UP exempted itself from the Constitution of India?" Tharoor tweeted. "Cops carrying out custodial torture receive laurels but being a vocal Muslim is a crime," AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Country needs double impact governance, not futile double engines: KTR
text: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said the country needs a "double impact governance", not "futile double engines". "Telangana with 2.5% of [the] Indian population contributes 5.0% to India’s GDP (Source: RBI report, October 2021)," KTR tweeted. Earlier on Saturday, KTR tweeted, "How many ED, IT and CBI raids on BJP leaders or their kith and kin in last eight years?"
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Sonia Gandhi hospitalised in Delhi over COVID-related issues
text: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has been admitted to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in Delhi due to issues related to COVID-19, party spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "She's stable and will be kept at the hospital for observation," he added. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate had issued fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: High time PM breaks silence on rising Islamophobic cases: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said it is high time PM Narendra Modi breaks his silence on the proliferation of Islamophobic incidents in the country. Tharoor's comments came following controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad by two BJP leaders. "I think our current hate speech laws and Section 295A are quite adequate to deal with such misbehaviour," Tharoor said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: AAP announces new Gujarat unit, Kishorbhai Desai named state chief
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday announced the new office-bearers for its Gujarat unit. Kishorbhai Desai has been named as the State President, while Manoj Sorathiya has been appointed as State General Secretary. The party also appointed Gujarat leader Isudan Gadhvi as the National Joint General Secretary and Indranil Rajguru as the National Joint Secretary.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP clarified respecting all religions is its priority: UP minister on Prophet remarks
text: Amid the ongoing violence over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the party’s action clarified that respecting all religions is its priority. "Our party and our government believe in unity and respect of all religions. They are going to work together with all parties," he added. "We should talk about peace," Ansari stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre misusing agencies to suppress Opp'n voices: Chhattisgarh CM
text: Responding to the summons issued by the ED to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said that the Centre is misusing agencies like CBI, IT to suppress the Opposition's voice. "I will be going to Delhi today as Rahul Gandhi has to appear in front of the ED tomorrow," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: We don't need Nupur Sharma's apology: Owaisi on Prophet remark row
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said there is no need to seek an apology from Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad since an FIR has been filed against her. "Law will take its own course," Owaisi said. Criticising Jharkhand's government over violence on Friday, he said, "There was firing on people in Ranchi, this shouldn't have happened."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: UP CM seems to be presiding over kangaroo court: Mehbooba Mufti
text: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said UP CM Yogi Adityanath seems to be presiding over a "kangaroo court" where minorities are bulldozed on a regular basis. Her statement came after buildings of those accused of violence during recent protests were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur. "Unfortunately, judiciary watches in silence as homes and lives are wrecked," Mufti tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Death knell for rule of law: Karti after buildings bulldozed in UP
text: After buildings of those accused of violence during protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were demolished in Kanpur and Saharanpur, Congress’ Karti Chidambaram said state-sponsored vigilante justice is the "death knell" for the rule of law. In Kanpur, parts of a building owned by businessman Mohammad Ishtiyaq, a relative of 'key conspirator' Hayat Zafar Hashmi, were demolished.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Prominent leader of Shiv Sena to attend Oppn leaders’ meeting: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said a prominent leader of the party will take part in Opposition leaders’ meeting called by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, on June 15, instead of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray. The decision comes as the CM will be in Ayodhya at that time, Raut stated. The meeting has been scheduled ahead of the Presidential poll.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress is making huge drama: BJP on Rahul, Sonia's ED summons
text: BJP National Spokesperson Sambit Patra on Sunday accused Congress of making a "huge drama" about Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi's respective summons to Enforcement Directorate (ED) with regard to National Herald Case. "Present yourself in front of ED and accept the wrongdoing...Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," Patra said. Rahul Gandhi is slated to appear before the ED tomorrow.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: ED's summons to Rahul Gandhi 'baseless': Cong leader Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday stated that the summons issued by the ED to former party chief Rahul Gandhi is "baseless". He said that a money laundering case involves money and laundering of money, which didn't happen. "It is like accusing a person of the offence of 'purse snatching' when there was no purse and no snatching," he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: AIMIM will contest this year's Gujarat Assembly elections: Owaisi
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi announced at a press conference on Saturday that his party will contest in the Gujarat Assembly elections scheduled to be held later this year. "We will fight Gujarat Assembly elections with full strength. However, we haven't decided on how many seats. I believe that Sabir Kabliwala (AIMIM Gujarat chief) will make the right decision," Owaisi said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Cong, JD(S) have accepted BJP as 'A' team: Karnataka CM
text: After BJP won three out of four Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka on Friday, CM Basavaraj Bommai has spoken about the opposition parties namely JD(S) and Congress. "We are not bothered as to who is the 'B' team...It means both the opposition parties have accepted that BJP is the 'A' team," CM Bommai said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Wife of ex-Chambal dacoit elected as sarpanch unopposed in MP
text: Former Chambal dacoit Malkhan Singh's wife, Lalita Rajput, has been elected as sarpanch by people of Sungayayi village in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district. Lalita was elected unopposed even as panchayat elections in state are supposed to commence on June 25. "There's no light or road or sewerage so I want to work for the development of my village," Lalita said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP will be in Guinness Book for paper leaks: Kejriwal in Himachal
text: Addressing a gathering at Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The BJP government will be in the Guinness Book of World Records for paper leaks...during its rule." Kejriwal said, "I don't understand why papers are being leaked in Gujarat, Haryana and Himachal." He added, "Why doesn't it happen in our Delhi?"
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: PM's silence is baffling: Chidambaram on ex-BJP leaders' Prophet remarks
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticised PM Narendra Modi over the alleged remarks against Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders, saying, "The PM's silence is baffling, but in tune with his silence on past occasions." Moreover, on being questioned about foreign countries condemning the remarks, he replied that the PM should have "spoken and acted immediately after the offensive utterances".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: This was small battle, big one still left: Fadnavis on RS poll results
text: After BJP won three out of six Rajya Sabha seats in Maharashtra, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said this was a small battle, the big one is still left. "We didn’t get afraid even when state government lodged cases against those who supported us," Fadnavis added. "We're very happy that all our three candidates…have been elected to Rajya Sabha," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rural development began when PM Modi came to power in 2014, says Shah
text: Union Minister Amit Shah said the aspect of rural development is to make villages convenient. "Gandhi Ji had said country’s soul resides in villages. Thus, if you’ve to make this country complete and independent, you’ll have to do it for the villages. This (rural development) began when PM Modi came to power in 2014," Shah added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis: BJP's Sambit Patra ahead of Rahul's ED date
text: A day before Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is scheduled to appear before ED, BJP's Sambit Patra said Congress is making "a huge drama" out of it. "Why this drama of press conferences…What is this Satyagrah? Gandhiji would be shamed to see this fake Satyagrah of fake Gandhis," Patra added. "Rahulji, don't try to escape the rule," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP ready to use bulldozer model against those disturbing peace in K’taka: CT Ravi
text: BJP leader CT Ravi on Saturday said that the party is prepared to replicate the "bulldozer model" of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath against those who disturb communal harmony and peace in Karnataka. Furthermore, he said that a few political parties that have lost polls are trying to stir up unrest in the country.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Govt setting up communication with minorities to hear their problems: UP minister
text: UP minister Danish Azad Ansari said the state government is starting 'Qaumi Chaupals' in the state to set up communication with the minorities and hear their problems. "Started 'Qaumi Chaupal' to create awareness about schemes for minorities on the ground level," Ansari added. "We're setting up communication with them so we may also hear their problems," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Even Fadnavis will vote for us if ED control given to Shiv Sena: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that if the control of the ED is given to his party, then even BJP's Devendra Fadnavis will vote for Sena. Raut's comments came following the recently concluded RS elections in Maharashtra. He had previously alleged that BJP was using central agencies to put pressure on smaller parties to vote for them.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: $5 trillion GDP goal appears to be case of shifting goalposts: Chidambaram
text: Former Union Minister and Congress leader P Chidambaram said that the BJP-led Centre's "goal of a $5 trillion GDP appears to be a case of shifting goalposts". "The original target year was 2023-24...We are nowhere near that goalpost," Chidambaram said. He added, "Now, the Chief Economic Adviser has said we will achieve the goal by 2027."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Chhattisgarh BJP leader booked over alleged 'fake' coal theft video
text: Chhattisgarh BJP Secretary Om Prakash Choudhary was booked on Saturday following a complaint alleging that the coal theft video he posted was "fake". The purported video, which went viral, showed people digging and carrying away coal from an opencast coal mine in Korba. The District Collector had "accepted that coal theft was going on", Choudhary said reacting to the FIR.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: India needs President who can protect Constitution: Congress
text: The Congress party is of the opinion that India needs a person as President who can protect the Constitution, our institutions and citizenry from the ongoing "onslaught" by the ruling party, Congress said. The statement comes as West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee called a meeting of the Opposition leaders, ahead of the election for the next President of India.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kerala CM should resign, face probe: Muraleedharan on gold smuggling case
text: Union Minister V Muraleedharan said Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan should resign and face the investigation, "if he has some morality left". His statement came following the allegation of CM's involvement in the Kerala gold smuggling case. "For the first time in history of this country, the CM has been accused of such a serious allegation of smuggling (gold)," Muraleedharan added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Villagers in Bihar hold BJP MLA hostage over development work delay
text: BJP MLA Kumar Shailendra was held hostage inside a school in Bihar's Lokmanpur village on Sunday. Shailendra, who was visiting the village to spread awareness about Centre's projects, was held captive for two hours as villagers were upset over delayed development works. "[Villagers] said that until....flood management [work] doesn't begin, they won't let me leave," Shailendra wrote on Facebook.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP's Krishan Lal Panwar, BJP-JJP backed Kartikeya Sharma win in Haryana RS polls
text: BJP's Krishan Lal Panwar and BJP-Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) backed Kartikeya Sharma won two Rajya Sabha seats in Haryana that went to polls on Friday. "Their success is a victory of democracy...best wishes to them for their new responsibilities in the development of our great nation," Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar tweeted. Congress' Ajay Maken lost the election.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Cong expels Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls
text: The Congress on Saturday expelled Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi from all party positions, including the post of the special invitee to the Congress Working Committee, for cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha elections. Congress said while Bishnoi cross-voted, the vote of another MLA was declared invalid. CM Manohar Lal Khattar has claimed that Bishnoi voted after "listening to his inner conscience".
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Sitharaman & 2 other BJP leaders win in K'taka Rajya Sabha polls, Cong wins 1 seat
text: Three BJP candidates bagged Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka in polls for the Upper House held on Friday, while the remaining one seat went to a Congress candidate. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Kannada comedian Jaggesh and Karnataka Legislative Council member Lehar Siroya were BJP's winning candidates. Congress' Jairam Ramesh won the remaining seat that went to the polls on Friday.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP office set on fire in WB's Howrah amid protests, internet suspended in district
text: BJP office in West Bengal's Howrah was set on fire by those protesting against remarks made by two former BJP leaders on Prophet Muhammad. BJP leader Anirban Ganguly shared a video of the vandalised office and sought action against the rioters. Following the incident, internet services were suspended till 6 am on June 13 (Monday).
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Voted for Cong as I love it: K'taka JD(S) MLA on Rajya Sabha polls
text: Karnataka JD(S) MLA K Srinivasa Gowda on Friday said he has voted for the Congress in the Rajya Sabha elections. When asked why, Gowda claimed he did so because he "loves the party". Along with Gowda, JD(S) MLA SR Srinivas from Gubbi has also reportedly voted for Congress. Six candidates are in the fray for four RS seats from Karnataka.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Congress wins 3 seats, BJP 1 in Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections
text: The Congress has won three out of four seats, while BJP has won the remaining one in the Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections. Zee TV Founder and independent candidate Subhash Chandra, who was backed by the BJP, has lost the elections. "Congress' victory in three Rajya Sabha seats in Rajasthan is a victory for democracy," Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot tweeted.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP wins 3 seats in Maha Rajya Sabha elections; Shiv Sena, Cong, NCP 1 each
text: BJP has won three out of the six seats in Maharashtra Rajya Sabha elections, while Shiv Sena, Congress and NCP have won one seat each. All three BJP candidates, Piyush Goyal, Anil Bonde and Dhananjay Mahadik won. From the Maha Vikas Aghadi coalition, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut, Congress' Imran Pratapgarhi and NCP's Praful Patel won the remaining three seats.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: How did Congress leader Ajay Maken lose in Haryana Rajya Sabha polls?
text: Eighty-eight votes were cast in Haryana Rajya Sabha polls. BJP's Krishan Panwar received 36, Congress' Ajay Maken got 29 and Independent candidate Kartikeya Sharma got 23. A candidate needed 29.34 votes to win. After Panwar won in first round, his excess votes 6.66 (36-29.34) were transferred to BJP-backed Sharma. Sharma's tally increased to 29.66, while Maken remained at 29.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Mamata calls Opposition leaders' meeting ahead of Presidential poll
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has called for a meeting of Opposition leaders on June 15 in New Delhi ahead of the election for the next President of India on July 18. "At a time when our democracy is going through troubling times, I believe that a fruitful confluence of opposition voices is the need of the hour," she said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: BJP suspends Raj MLA Shobha Rani for cross-voting in RS polls
text: The BJP has suspended its Rajasthan MLA Shobha Rani Kushwaha for allegedly cross-voting in favour of Congress candidate Pramod Tiwari in Rajya Sabha elections. In a notice, the BJP's disciplinary committee has asked her to respond within seven days, explaining why she should not be expelled from the party. Congress won three seats in the elections, while BJP won one.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 'Liquor shops to be shut for Sitharaman's Goa visit,' says MLA, state govt clarifies
text: Goa MLA Vijai Sardesai on Saturday said that "the absurdity of shutting liquor shops by the state government because of Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's visit is laughable." He also shared a picture of an official order on the same, however, the state government clarified that only a wine shop and two bars in Panaji were told to stay shut.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Hyderabad police arrest BJP leader over skit against Telangana CM
text: Hyderabad's Hayathnagar police on Friday arrested BJP leader Jitta Balakrishna Reddy over an alleged skit that made fun of Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. An officer said that during the skit, actors used derogatory comments, made personal attacks and depicted Rao as a "boozer, cheater etc." State BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar was also booked in the matter.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: ED issues fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi for appearance on June 23
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued fresh summons to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23 in an alleged money laundering case related to newspaper National Herald, officials said. Earlier this week, Sonia had sought more time from the agency to appear before it as she was still recovering from COVID-19.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP MP urges Amit Shah to deploy central forces in Bengal amid protests
text: BJP MP Saumitra Khan on Saturday urged Home Minister Amit Shah to deploy central forces in West Bengal amid protests. "To keep the people of Bengal safe, you (Amit Shah) should appoint a central force...and entrust the security of West Bengal to them," Khan wrote in his letter. Notably, internet services were suspended in Howrah following protests on Friday evening.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Govt failed miserably in creating jobs for youth: KTR writes to PM Modi
text: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao has written an open letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the unemployment issue in the country and claimed that the BJP-led central government has failed miserably in creating jobs for the youth. "There are only 'pakoda' employment opportunities in the country today, all thanks to the inefficient policies of the Union government," he stated.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Strict action must be taken against hatemongers: Sachin Pilot
text: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said strict action must be taken against those spreading hate in society. Reacting to comments over Prophet Muhammad, he said that the Centre wasn't bothered when people of the country demanded action against the spokesperson but was prompt in doing so when foreign countries issued denunciations. Pilot also criticised the Centre over rising inflation and unemployment.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP govt should stop their PR against women's empowerment: TRS leader
text: TRS leader K Kavitha has questioned BJP over its campaign on women empowerment. "BJP government should for once out of sheer respect for women stop their PR against women's empowerment, when they continue to hide the truth behind extravagant publicity," Kavitha said. She added that BJP should apologise to Anganwadi workers "for slashing their budget by 50%".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Kerala Cong protests, seeks CM's resignation over gold smuggling
text: Kerala Congress leaders protested in the state against CM Pinarayi Vijayan and demanded his resignation over the gold smuggling case. "They are trying to threaten the persons who are ready to give evidence against the CM," Kerala Opposition leader VD Satheesan said.  This comes after the prime accused claimed CM, his wife and daughter were involved in the scam.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Past decade saw increase in number of women voters: Book
text: The number of women voters in India has increased over the past decade, according to a new book released. Till 2010, the number of women voters was less than men, Sanjay Kumar, who edited Women Voters in Indian Elections - Changing Trends and Emerging Patterns, said. In 2019 general election, men and women voted in nearly equal numbers, he added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Nadda meets envoys of 13 countries as part of 'Know BJP' initiative
text: BJP National President JP Nadda interacted with envoys of 13 countries at the party headquarters in Delhi, where he informed them about the party's ideology, history and ongoing activities. This is the fourth such event held by the BJP President. The interaction was a part of the 'Know BJP' initiative which was launched on BJP's foundation day on April 6.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Not shocked by Maharashtra RS poll results: Sharad Pawar
text: After BJP won three Rajya Sabha seats from Maharashtra on Friday, NCP supremo Sharad Pawar has said that the results haven't come as "shocking" to him. "I am not shocked to see the results...(MVA) received the votes as per the quota," Pawar said. "Only Praful Patel (of NCP) received one extra vote...it was from the opposite side," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP's victory in Rajya Sabha polls through 'horse-trading': Sanjay Raut
text: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday claimed that the Bharatiya Janata Party secured Rajya Sabha seats in the recent elections in Maharashtra through horse-trading. "The victory [of BJP] was not a mandate," he said. Raut also said that the poll results don't pose any threat to the ruling coalition government of Maharashtra Vikas Aghadi (MVA).
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Election Commission favoured BJP: Sanjay Raut on Maharashtra RS polls
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday alleged that the Election Commission (EC) favoured BJP in the Maharashtra Rajya Sabha elections held on Friday. "EC made our one vote invalid. We objected to two votes, but no action was taken on that," Raut claimed. His reaction came after EC rejected the vote cast by Shiv Sena legislator Suhas Kande.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: BJP's sin, why should people suffer: Mamata Banerjee on violence in Howrah
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee blamed BJP for violence in Howrah over comments made on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson and said, "[It's] BJP's sin, why should people suffer?" "There are some political parties behind what is happening in Howrah. They want to cause riots but this will not be tolerated. Strict action will be taken," she tweeted.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Very happy that all our 3 candidates won: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday expressed happiness after BJP won three out of six Rajya Sabha seats in Maharashtra. "Very happy that all our three candidates- Piyush Goyal, Anil Bonde, and Dhananjay Mahadik have been elected to Rajya Sabha," he said. "Mahadik ne aisa dhobi pachhad lagaya...that he got more votes than Sanjay Raut," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: Development works not done to win elections, says PM Modi in Gujarat
text: During his visit to Gujarat on Friday, PM Narendra Modi said that his government's development projects are not undertaken to win elections but for the good of the people. It is the "people who make us win elections", he added. Notably, PM Modi laid foundation stones, inaugurated and dedicated projects worth ₹3,050 crore during his day-long visit to the state.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Ex-MP Divya Spandana files complaint over lewd comments in B'luru
text: Former MP Divya Spandana on Thursday filed a complaint with Bengaluru cyber crime police over alleged lewd comments made against her on social media. Spandana "herself came to...station and registered a complaint," a police officer said. In May, Spandana, who previously also served as Congress' social media head, claimed that Karnataka Congress leadership asked leaders and volunteers to troll her.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Navjot Sidhu discharged from Chandigarh hospital, shifted back to Patiala jail
text: Former Punjab Pradesh Congress Committee (PPCC) chief Navjot Singh Sidhu was shifted back to Patiala central jail on Thursday evening after he was discharged from PGI Chandigarh. Sidhu was admitted to the hospital due to liver-related problems. Sidhu was last month sentenced to one year in jail over a 1988 road rage case that led to a man's death.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Satyendar Jain is suffering from post-COVID sleep apnea: Lawyer
text: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain, who is in Enforcement Directorate's (ED) custody for alleged money laundering, is suffering from post-COVID sleep apnea, his lawyer said. "When [Jain] came out of...court, he wasn't feeling well and was later sent to...hospital," advocate Rishikesh Kumar said. Jain will be under ED's custody till June 13, a Delhi court ruled earlier today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Congress leader confuses Goddess Sita with Draupadi, says 'cheerharan of Sita Maiya'
text: During a press conference, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala confused Goddess Sita with Draupadi and said, "BJP wants to do cheerharan of democracy, just like cheerharan of Sita Maiya. But they'll lose [in Rajya Sabha polls]." Criticising Surjewala for the error, BJP's Shehzad Poonawala said, "You can wear Janeu on the coat but what's inside you will always come out!"
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: AIMIM to vote for MVA in RS polls in Maha to defeat BJP: AIMIM MP
text: AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel has tweeted that the party will be voting for Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in the Rajya Sabha elections in Maharashtra "to defeat BJP". However, he said that AIMIM's "political/ideological differences...will continue with Shiv Sena" which is part of the MVA. "We laid certain conditions related to the development of our MLAs' constituencies," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Voting for 16 Rajya Sabha seats across four states to be held today
text: Voting for 16 Rajya Sabha seats across four states, Rajasthan, Haryana, Maharashtra and Karnataka will be held today. In Maharashtra, six Rajya Sabha seats are going to the polls. As many as four seats each from Rajasthan and Karnataka, and two from Haryana are also going to the polls. So far, 41 candidates have been elected unopposed.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP MLA's daughter in BMW stopped over rash driving in B'luru; seen yelling at police
text: A video shows BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali's daughter misbehaving with Bengaluru traffic policemen after they stopped her over traffic violation and reportedly fined her for rash driving. The MLA's daughter, who was driving a BMW car, could be seen yelling at the policemen. She also tried to slap away a journalist's camera and said, "Shut the camera off."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Congress leaders protest near Punjab CM's house; detained
text: Several Congress leaders protesting outside Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's official residence in Chandigarh were detained on Thursday. They were reportedly protesting over singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder as well as the arrest of former Punjab minister Sadhu Singh Dharamsot on corruption charges. They alleged that the CM did not meet them despite a confirmed appointment.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Farcical theatre of absurdity: AAP’s Raghav Chadha on Punjab Cong's protest
text: AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Thursday said a "farcical theatre of absurdity" is on display by the Punjab Congress. His statement came after several Congress leaders protested outside Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann’s official residence today and later got detained. They were reportedly protesting over singer Sidhu Moosewala’s murder as well as the arrest of former Punjab minister Sadhu Singh Dharamsot.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: MSP of Kharif crops for 2022-23 inadequate, below inflation rate: Cong
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala on Thursday alleged that the minimum support price (MSP) of Kharif crops announced for 2022-23 is "meagre and far below the rate of inflation". The Congress leader said this while comparing Kharif MSP increase with projected inflation. "Far from increasing...income of the farmer, the pain of the farmer has increased a hundred times," Surjewala said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Go protest in Delhi: Mamata to Nupur Sharma hate speech protesters
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday asked protesters protesting against the remarks of BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal to take their demonstrations to New Delhi. The speech of the BJP leaders has damaged the image of India across the world and they should be arrested, Banerjee told reporters.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Mobile internet suspended in Jaipur's Amber ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
text: Mobile internet services in Jaipur's Amber were suspended for 12 hours starting 9 pm on Thursday. The divisional commissioner issued the order citing a security threat to Congress and other supporting MLAs who are staying in the tehsil ahead of the Rajya Sabha polls. The MLAs staying at Hotel Leela will cast their vote at the assembly building on Friday.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: We didn't win West Bengal elections due to COVID-19: BJP chief JP Nadda
text: BJP National President JP Nadda on Thursday said that his party didn't come to power in West Bengal as they failed to win the required number of seats in the 2021 Assembly elections because of COVID-19. "Due to...rise in COVID, BJP failed to campaign properly," Nadda said. "But there are more elections to come and BJP will win," he added.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: When I talk, 25 BJP leaders bark like Mudhol dogs: Siddaramaiah
text: Congress leader Siddaramaiah sparked a controversy when he compared BJP leaders to Mudhol (hound) dogs. "When I talk individually, 25 people from BJP start barking against me like Mudhol dogs. But when they bark, only I have to speak, no one else from our party speaks," he said, speaking at an event in Mysuru on Wednesday.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Congress should support JD(S) to defeat BJP in RS polls: Kumaraswamy
text: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday said that Congress should support JD(S) in upcoming Rajya Sabha elections. "To defeat the BJP, Congress should support JD(S) which has more votes than it," Kumaraswamy tweeted while tagging Congress leader Randeep Surjewala. JD(S) has fielded Kupendra Reddy as its first candidate in the Rajya Sabha elections to be held on June 10.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: AIMIM supporters protest over FIR filed against Owaisi, detained
text: AIMIM supporters staged a protest in Delhi after their party chief Asaduddin Owaisi was named in an FIR, police said, adding 33 protesters were detained. The Delhi Police has registered FIRs against Nupur Sharma, Naveen Kumar Jindal, Asaduddin Owaisi and Yati Narsinghanand for allegedly posting and sharing messages on social media against the maintenance of public tranquility, officials said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Police use water cannon on Youth Cong workers protesting against Kerala CM
text: The Youth Congress workers staged a protest demanding the resignation of Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan over the gold smuggling case in Thiruvananthapuram. The police used water cannon to disperse the protestors. The protests came after the prime accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Goa govt issues notice to hotels owned by Congress MLA Michael Lobo
text: The Goa government has issued show-cause notices to two properties owned by Congress MLA Michael Lobo. According to Town and Country Planning (TCP) Minister Vishwajit Rane, there have been gross violations of law in the construction of the two hotels in Calangute. The government has sought a reply within seven days failing which the illegal structures will be demolished.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: CM busy in farmhouse, transfer Hyderabad gang-rape case to CBI: BJP
text: Telangana BJP in-charge Tarun Chugh on Wednesday reiterated party's demand to transfer the Hyderabad gang-rape case to CBI. "CM is busy in...farmhouse," Chugh said while accusing CM K Chandrashekar Rao of not being able to do justice to the victim. He further alleged that a "jungle raj" is going on in the state with law and order being compromised.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Kerala CM must reveal his income sources: BJP leader amid gold scam
text: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan said CM Pinarayi Vijayan must reveal the sources of wealth accumulated by himself and his family members. His comment comes after the main accused in Kerala gold smuggling case alleged CM Pinarayi Vijayan, his wife and daughter's involvement in the case. "The CM has to explain each detail of the allegations...against him," Radhakrishnan added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP should look after their house; we will win 3 RS seats: Ashok Gehlot
text: On the day of polling for the four Rajya Sabha seats from Rajasthan, CM Ashok Gehlot has said that Congress will win three Upper House seats. "We are winning comfortably and it's the BJP who should look after their house. The way they fielded another candidate (Independent candidate Subhash Chandra) was not liked by even their party MLAs," Gehlot said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Arrest 'disastrous BJP leaders': Mamata on Prophet remarks row
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday reacted to the alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad by "disastrous BJP leaders", ex-party spokesperson Nupur Sharma and ex-Delhi BJP media chief Naveen Kumar Jindal, terming them as "hate speech". "I strongly seek that the accused leaders of BJP be arrested immediately so that the unity of the country isn't disturbed," she said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: VHP seeks action against B'luru mosque where alleged terrorist stayed
text: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Thursday wrote a letter to Bengaluru City Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy seeking action against a mosque in Okalipuram where the alleged Hizbul Mujahideen terrorist Talib Hussain was staying. The complaint also asked police to collect information on terrorist activities in the mosque. Hussain had come to the city a year ago, according to police officials.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Won’t be intimidated by these tactics: Owaisi on Delhi Police’s FIR
text: After Delhi Police named AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand in an FIR registered over alleged inflammatory remarks, Owaisi said FIR doesn’t specify his crime. "We'll not be intimidated by these tactics. Criticising hate speech and giving hate speeches cannot be equated," Owaisi added. "I don’t know which specific remarks of mine have attracted FIR," Owaisi stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will hit the streets if textbook revisions not rolled back in K'taka: Cong
text: Karnataka Congress leader Siddaramaiah said that his party will take the protest to the streets if the state government does not roll back revised school textbooks. He added that this has hurt the sentiments of Kannadigas. Siddaramaiah said, "The textbook has been revised by Rohith Chakrathirtha (head of the textbook revision committee), who is an orthodox RSS man."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Rahul Gandhi to appear before ED on June 13, Cong plans protest
text: Congress will hold protests on June 13 when party leader Rahul Gandhi will appear before the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a money laundering case. Congress called the case a "political vendetta", adding that the case has no grounds for investigation. ED questioned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge and Congress Treasurer Pawan Bansal in April this year in New Delhi.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM Modi has brought a new culture to political working: Nadda in WB
text: BJP National President JP Nadda, who is on a two-day visit to West Bengal, said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has brought a new culture to political working in the country. Criticising the ruling party TMC, Nadda said, "Condition of West Bengal right now is similar to what India was famous for several years ago, scams and corruption."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Govt betraying country: Rahul Gandhi on Chinese activity near Ladakh
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday alleged that the Indian government is betraying the country by ignoring infrastructure build-up by China near the borders. His comments came after US General Charles A Flynn expressed concern over Chinese infrastructure coming up near eastern Ladakh, calling it "alarming". "China is building...foundations for hostile action in the future," Rahul tweeted.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Future belongs to the BJP: JP Nadda in Kolkata
text: Addressing the state executive committee meeting in Kolkata, BJP National President JP Nadda said the "future belongs to the BJP" and that his party will defeat TMC in the next elections. Criticising West Bengal's ruling party, he said, "The TMC has no principles or policies, it has only syndicates." He added, "In politics, there is nothing static, things change."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Shutdown in J&K over social media posts backing BJP's Nupur Sharma
text: Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar town observed a shutdown demanding the arrest of three Bharatiya Janata Party and IkkJutt Jammu leaders for their alleged social media posts extending support to BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. The three leaders, according to the protesters, include Ashish Sharma, the BJP's Youth Wing general secretary in J&K and IkkJutt leaders Sparsh Parihar and Anshuman Rathore.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: CISF writes to MHA to review Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana's security
text: The CISF has written to the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) to review the security of Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana. Navneet was accorded 'Y' category security cover in April. Navneet and her husband were granted bail in May after being arrested in a sedition case over threats to chant Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's residence in Mumbai.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: 2 independent MLAs join BJP in Himachal Pradesh
text: Two independent MLAs in Himachal Pradesh, Hoshiyar Singh and Prakash Rana, joined BJP on Wednesday in the presence of Chief Minister Jairam Thakur and state BJP President Suresh Kashyap. The independent legislators' joining would make the party and the government stronger, CM Thakur said. Both Singh and Rana had been supporting BJP in the Assembly for long, Suresh Kashyap said.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: We need US General to call out Chinese activities near Ladakh: Owaisi
text: After a US General called Chinese build-up near Ladakh alarming, AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi said it should shame the government that a foreigner has to say it. "We need US General to tell us that the situation in Ladakh from the Chinese preparations and activities is 'alarming' and 'eye-opening' because our vocal PM has forgotten how to pronounce China," he tweeted.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Grant me bail as CBI chargesheet is incomplete: Anil Deshmukh to court
text: Ex-Maharashtra Minister Anil Deshmukh on Wednesday approached the Mumbai special court for default bail, claiming that the CBI chargesheet filed against him was incomplete. Deshmukh sought bail under Criminal Procedure Code's Section 167(2) which allows the accused to file for bail if chargesheet is not filed within 60-90 days. CBI filed chargesheet without completing investigation, Deshmukh said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: What is Kejriwal's compulsion to save Satyendar Jain?: Anurag Thakur
text: After Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain was arrested by ED in an alleged money laundering case, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is enacting "drama" over ED’s action. "The charges are very serious and one wonders what is Kejriwal's compulsion in saving Satyendar Jain...Will you only make false allegations to demoralise the investigating agencies?" Thakur asked.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: NCP names Eknath Khadse for Maharashtra Legislative Council polls
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Thursday named Eknath Khadse for the upcoming elections to 10 seats of the Maharashtra Legislative Council. Khadse, who is facing an Enforcement Directorate (ED) probe in the MIDC land deal, had quit BJP in October 2020. "The BJP ignored me but NCP chief Sharad Pawar has shown confidence in me," Khadse said.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Issuing threats not Indian culture: Uma Bharti on Prophet remark row
text: BJP leader Uma Bharti condemned threats being issued to suspended party spokesperson Nupur Sharma over latter's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "Our party gave punishment to [her] and MEA handled [the] situation on [the] reaction of Muslim nations well but threats to Nupur Sharma is not Indian culture," Bharti said. Sharma was suspended from the party on June 5.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Entire country stands with Kashmiri Pandits: Arvind Kejriwal
text: Greeting Kashmiri Pandits on 'Jyeshtha Ashtami', Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "I want to assure the Kashmiri Pandit community that the entire country is standing shoulder to shoulder with you in your...happiness and sorrow." His tweet comes amid the recent killings in Jammu and Kashmir. "May the blessings of Maa Kheer Bhavani always be with you all," Kejriwal tweeted.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: BJP will be responsible if anything happens: Raut on Al-Qaeda’s threat
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said BJP will be responsible if anything happens in the country, after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, UP and Gujarat. “Everything was fine in the country but the (former) spokesperson of BJP wanted fights to break out between people of two different religious communities,” Raut added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Debt got costlier amid inflation: Congress on RBI's repo rate hike
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala reacted to RBI's repo rate hike stating that the move will negatively impact people. "Today, the repo rate has increased...by 0.50%...People tied with debts will now be forced to deal with increased EMIs. Debt became costlier along with inflation, unemployment and empty pockets," Surjewala said. RBI raised the repo rate by 50 bps to 4.90%.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Don't sell country for few pieces of gold: BJP to Kerala govt
text: BJP criticised the CPI(M)-led LDF government in Kerala on Wednesday over a case of alleged gold smuggling and asked it to not sell the country for a few pieces of gold. "The Kerala Chief Minister should look into his conscience after these charges and step down from his post," BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Northeast marching ahead to be at par with rest of India: Minister
text: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal on Wednesday said that the Northeast is marching ahead to be at par with the rest of India. "Congress never gave importance to Northeast in the last 60 years due to which the region remained neglected despite its huge potential," he said. Had to face several challenges in the development of the region, he added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Sena MP Priyanka to visit J&K to meet deceased Kashmiri pandits' families
text: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi will visit Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday to meet the relatives of Kashmiri Pandits killed recently. She is also expected to meet the family of government employee Rahul Bhat who was shot dead by terrorists in Budgam. Chaturvedi had earlier written to Home Minister Amit Shah seeking security for Hindu community in Kashmir.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Chennithala demands Kerala CM's ouster amid gold smuggling scam
text: Kerala Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala on Wednesday reacted to the allegations levelled against CM Pinarayi Vijayan by Swapna Suresh, the prime accused in the Kerala gold smuggling case, stating the claims made are "unprecedented and shocking". Chennithala also demanded Vijayan's resignation. Suresh has claimed that CM Vijayan, his wife and his daughter were involved in the scam.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Baseless: KT Jaleel on allegations made in gold smuggling case
text: Ex-Kerala Minister KT Jaleel on Wednesday filed a police complaint against allegations levelled by Kerala gold smuggling case prime accused Swapna Suresh, calling the allegations "baseless". Jaleel said the allegations are part of a controversy hatched by Suresh, ex-Congress MLA PC George and BJP. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan also dismissed Suresh's allegations against him and his family.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BJP govt's 'conspiracy' behind Nupur Sharma's remarks: Cong leader
text: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao alleged that a "conspiracy" by BJP-led Centre is behind the controversial remarks of former party spokesperson Nupur Sharma. "With their controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad, a lot of damage was caused to our country at the international level," Rao said. "BJP leaders like Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal should be arrested immediately," he added.
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Haven't forgotten: Maha CM on renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that he has not forgotten his late father Balasaheb Thackeray's promise of renaming Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar and said, "We will change it." "Hindutva is in our every breath," Uddhav Thackeray added. Criticising BJP in a rally in Aurangabad, he said, "If you have the courage then go and recite Hanuman Chalisa in Kashmir."
author: Apoorva Shankar

headlines: Country faced embarrassment due to BJP: CM Thackeray on Prophet remark row
text: While addressing a public rally in Aurangabad, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said that the country faced embarrassment due to BJP over the remarks made by their now-suspended spokesperson Nupur Sharma against Prophet Muhammad. "We had to kneel in front of the Middle East countries...Why should the country apologise when BJP is responsible for this incident?" Thackeray said.
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: SP MLC booked for remarks against Lord Shiva, Shivling in UP
text: Samajwadi Party leader and UP MLC Lal Bihari Yadav has been booked for allegedly making offensive remarks against Lord Shiva and Shivling. The action was taken by police based on a complaint from Bajrang Dal workers, who alleged that Yadav's comments hurt religious sentiments. This comes after claims of a Shivling being found in Gyanvapi Mosque premises were made.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Dispose of public applications in time-bound manner: UP CM to officials
text: The Chief Secretary and Director General of Police should ensure that District Magistrates (DMs)/Superintendents of Police (SPs) are sensitive to the disposal of public grievances, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said. "Public applications should be disposed of in a time-bound manner. DMs and SPs should interact with local public representatives and take guidance from them on public issues," UP CM added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Govt’s efforts to force peace in J&K failed miserably: Farooq Abdullah
text: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said that the government's efforts to "force peace" in Jammu and Kashmir have failed "miserably". "We are facing an alarming situation that has arisen out of the August 5, 2019, undemocratic and unconstitutional decisions," Abdullah added. "Now, they are struggling with their failures. Neither there is peace nor any visage of development here," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Fringe is BJP's core: Rahul Gandhi amid row over remarks on Prophet
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said "fringe" is the BJP's core and highlighted some derogatory statements made by BJP leaders in the past. The post included comments by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who allegedly called Bangladeshi migrants "termites" and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who said that women "are not capable of being left free or independent".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Bihar CM’s good governance claim intact: Kishor as parents beg for son's body
text: After the parents of a youth in Bihar were seen begging to collect money to get the mortal remains of their son from a hospital, political strategist Prashant Kishor said humanity is ashamed. "Yet, Nitish Kumar’s claim of good governance is intact," Kishor tweeted. A hospital employee allegedly asked the parents for ₹50,000 to release the body.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: JD(S) shifts MLAs to Bengaluru resort ahead of Rajya Sabha polls
text: In a bid to avoid poaching ahead of Rajya Sabha elections, Janata Dal (Secular) has shifted its MLAs to a resort in Bengaluru. "It is a routine practice as we will have a JDLP [JDS Legislature Party] meeting this [Thursday] evening and people [legislators] who have come from different places will stay back there," said JD(S) leader BM Farooq.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Hindutvadis should know Islam rejects terrorism: Owaisi on Al-Qaeda's threat
text: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday said "Hindutvadis" should know that Islam rejects terrorism. His statement came after Al-Qaeda in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) threatened to carry out suicide attacks in Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat. "The name of our Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) is exalted and does not need terrorists like Al-Qaeda to defend it," Owaisi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma
